Review: capsule the much anticipated readaptation of the pierre boulle novel comes the screen as dark and little dreary lots of chases and fighting but very little intelligence visually there is much like about this version but the approach is take an adventure after the style of gullivers travels and treat it as an action that makes it without much center pierre boulle author of the bridge on the river kwai wrote planet of the apes k monkey planet the novel as social satire it reads lot like fifth book of gullivers travels humans discover planet in the roles of apes and humans have been reversed not unlike the roles of horses and humans on jonathan swifts island of the houyhnhnms the novel moves somewhat slowly create some suspense in revealing all the things most fans know be true about the nature of the planet it seems me there is also statement about human cruelty animals but perhaps was just looking for that when rod serling adapted the novel into released in he added number of serling touches familiar from episodes of the twilight zone and changed the ending make it more serlingish the final irony of the original version has become history without it there could never have been planet of the apes series can surmise only that serling ran into serious script problems in how handle the tricky question of language in the book the apes had their own language and the human eventually learned that language that could have been done in the but that would have required the entire be subtitled for the nonapespeaking serling avoided this having the apes speak english and of course there is some justification for that the end of the justifying why the apes spoke english may have even been the inspiration for his surprise ending but serling never tackles the allimportant question of why supposedly intelligent human never shows any curiosity or even surprise that the apes speak his own language language they had no opportunity ever hear few viewers questioned this serious plot hole however and the has become well respected in cinema history partial credit at least should go jerry goldsmith whose extremely inventive score is one of goldsmiths best if not his best when the films success called for sequels the filmmakers turned up the violence and they added wellintentioned though not very subtle political messages about what was happening in the united states of the and while the first had little shooting of guns and what was there seemed little half hearted the second beneath the planet of the apes there was good deal more violence and from that point on the series had lot of violence and chases the series concluded battle for the planet of the apes in now director tim burton tries his hand at adapting the original book again for those who thought that the version was not very faithful the book burtons new version is even less faithful first he does not really reverse the roles of the humans and the apes he has them both be intelligent articulate races battling for dominance of the planet currently in the hands uh make that paws of the apes that could be good story too but it is not planet of the apes as the mission impossible films and so many other cinematic homages the third quarter of the last century the title makes promises that the filmmakers have no intention of honoring in leo davidson mark wahlberg not this worlds most expressive actor works on space station increasing the intelligence and usefulness of apes then convenient time storm sweeps him up wizardofozfashion and drops him on an alien planet yes he survives this storm but then no storm is perfect he quickly finds not greatly any surprise he shows that on this planet apes rule and humans drool but everybody talks and the language they talk is earth english apparently it does not even occur leo that there is mystery that needs be explained about that the fact it does not occur leo and apparently did not occur tim burton either is the heart of the real horror of this both just assumed that if apes were going talk the language they would speak would be english in any case having one talking race dominating another makes this not look at humananimal relationships and more one of the masterslave relationships outside of sudan and few other countries this is less relevant topic leo is captured be used as slave but also is discovered ari played helena bonham carter ari is an attractive ape close ties high political power she is bent on making the world better place perhaps in previous draft of the script she was called hilari in any case makeup that stifles her usual pout carter is just about as attractive as she has ever been in she may want consider this become her standard look from this point forward it is not long before leo escapes some human and only couple of sympathetic apes this is further abandonment of the source material the chase severely limits the interplay of ape and human and the examination of eachs place in this reversed society each important in the book we cannot see how the society works because most of the screentime society has broken down we see the humans either separated from the apes or fighting them burton chooses visceral thrills over cerebral ones at almost every turn this is miscalculation as characters so lacking in empathy value are difficult ones place much emotional investment in they are basically chess pieces and the viewer has little reason root for them win the script had little subtlety lines like never met an ape did not like but at least we cared for what happened taylor the main character most of what this has offer is in the visuals the visual work is spotty but generally nicely done except that so much of the takes place in the night or in fog this tends limit close looks at the makeup in general it seems much improved from the makeup team is led rick baker instead of john chambers who did it for the version in chambers makeup was jawdropper it was realistic enough almost be believable but flexible enough show emotion chambers is good but if anyone had chance best him it would have be baker today audiences have higher expectations bakers visualization is really an improvement these visuals work nicely what does not work is the wire assisted leaps some of the apes make they look like they were inspired the physics defying leaps of crouching tiger hidden dragon apes spring incredible distances some of the best scenes are apes running into battle looking like they have ape posture but when they start flying through the air the effect is lost one final visual problem is that the frequently shows its budget in what should be spectacular battle scenes the camera shows us only small group of people closeup since the days of lon chaney and boris karloff few actors have crossed over stardom in role that required heavy makeup the one actor who has shot is paul giamatti it is not that his lines are so good most are silly jokes but he delivers them very well he was always watchable actor but has not yet made stardom as the apetrader limbo he overemotes overcome his ape makeup but does it very well in doing so he makes himself the most interesting thing on the screen he is probably the best thing in the and conjures up memories of peter ustinovs performance in spartacus as an injoke there are several lines in the script borrowed from the and an old ape played charleton heston becomes an allusion the first itself danny elfmans score has nice primitive feel but jerry goldsmiths tour de force score is real classic that score and the whole will be remembered when the is forgotten rate the remake on the scale and on the scale

i wish could accurately describe the theme music for part the best way can put it is that it is funky know this is an odd question but remember the opening music of police academy citizens on patrol when steve guttenberg and michael winslow perform the title song citizens on patrol during the opening credits it is just like that anyway part takes place day after the events of part so technically still this time group of horny teens who also bring along two aging hippie potheads for some reason head up cabin on crystal lake for weekend of sex and weed it turns out that one of the teens had been attacked jason earlier in her life must have been between parts and so why she has returned crystal lake one day after new batch of murders is beyond me she is the lone survivor this time part was originally shown in theaters in and from what can tell from the video it looks as though they may have been fairly decent effects jason had long wild hair when he was unmasked in part now one day later he is completely bald also it being one day later it cannot be friday the th now can it oh well steve miner is the only director who helmed more than one in the series r

jessica lange is one of the most inconsistent actresses working today from timetotime she blows away audiences powerful intense performances on the other hand this is the same woman who made her jawdroppingly awful feature debut in dino delaurentiis king kong and much as lange would probably prefer moviegoers develop amnesia regarding that particular entry on her resume every once in while she does work that is reminiscent of it if only in quality hush is one such example lange is so bad here that she might have been fun watch if the rest of the was not such prime example of motion picture tedium the opens as many socalled psychological thrillers do posing as light drama we are introduced jackson johnathon schaech last encounter in tom hanks that thing you do and helen gwyneth paltrow picture perfect young couple who are very much in love jackson is taking helen home for the holidays so she can meet his mother martha lange the moment first saw martha started looking for fangs soon the wicked witch of the east is plotting way for her son get helen pregnant this involves poking hole in diaphragm once that goal is accomplished she manipulates events so that the expecting couple moves out of new york city the horse farm where she lives as long as she gets her way martha is perfectly amicable person but when helen defies her it is declaration of war hush has three very simple problems it is incredibly dumb it is incredibly boring and it is incredibly predictable at least up the stupefying ending this has absolutely nothing recommend it the exception of couple of nice shots of snowcovered fields and quick glimpse of gwyneth paltrows bare buttocks frankly it is embarrassing watch respected actress of langes stature give performance like this it is like bad blanche dubois the role she played in tv version of streetcar named desire meanwhile paltrow does her best get through her dialogue without gaping at the stupidity of some of her lines and schaech attempts passable imitation of an inanimate object as in all psychological thrillers the battle lines are clearly drawn here it is mom and against wife jackson caught in the middle of course since schaechs character is poorlydeveloped and badly acted it is impossible say how he feels about being in that situation maybe someone should ask him if he is familiar oedipus martha is of course the evil one how do we know she is evil she smokes cigarettes and drinks hard liquor two sure signs that the devil is at work on the other hand helen is good girl the evidence for this is that she is nice old ladies and treasures locket picture of her dead parents that is about it for character development beyond that point hush is just series of increasingly hardtoswallow coincidences contrivances and moronic plot twists however the first minutes are just warmup for the ending is as anticlimactic as it is profoundly dissatisfying cannot imagine anyone no matter what they thought of the movie as whole liking this conclusion either there was some serious lastminute editing or someone left out few pages of the script before the climax disliked hush the time the end credits started hated it viewers invest something in every movie they watch no matter how good or bad it is cheating them like this is offensive and unpardonable most entries into this wornout wormeaten genre are not especially good films like consenting adults the hand that rocks the cradle and single white female rely on stock plots and predictable twists propel the narrative along in general however they are directed degree of competence that assures level of sustained tension that is not the case really bad thrillers like this fail generate even momentary heart palpitation the characters are too bland and the plot is too uninvolving for anyone in the audience care indeed the title of this movie probably refers what the producers hope viewers will do in lieu of telling their friends what they really think of this sorry piece of celluloid

synopsis sonny koufax adam sandler is rich childish angry man who has just been dumped his girlfriend vanessa kristy swanson in bid impress vanessa sonny impersonates his friend kevin jon stewart and adopts year old boy named julian cole and dylan sprouse while kevin is on an overseas trip under sonnys supervision julian soon learns lie women tell people how he wipes his ass throw tantrums and scream for his god damned treats self centered julian breaks school classmates arm without apologizing or even realizing he has done anything wrong meanwhile sonny bribes julian sugary talk food toys and flashy promises in order get the kid perform not surprisingly the government takes julian away from sonnys incompetent supervision and this leads custody battle opinion it is movie about an embittered creep teaching little kid be jerk and we all get cheap laughs because for minutes the innocent kindergartner never finds out what it means when he mimics all the bad boy behavior that is the essence of big daddy but there is bigger issue involved marketing movies that are rated pg and pg are heavily marketed towards children of preteen age and below on tv clips advertise these movies as familyfriendly hit comedies then when you go see them they turn out be either raunchy sex acts like austin powers characters named fat bastard or big daddy where adult characters get their jollies buddying up naive five year olds and encouraging them experiment drugs and mistreatment folks in are trying develop preteen market for raunchy stuff but think most american parents would agree that early childhood is time of mental innocence that should be protected from uncaring media market exploitation many american mothers there is probably nothing more pathetic and unsettling than the sight of theater full of unsupervised little eight year olds laughing raucously as movie character father adam sandler jokes about womans ice cold tits

certainly no one would rent ed woods glen or glenda expecting see good movie but this screwy discourse about transvestitism betrays level of incompetence that did not know was possible in fact woods infamous plan from outer space actually seems pretty tame comparison watching glen or glenda found myself occasionally wondering if wood had originally made two or three separate movies and accidentally edited them together as result it is actually quite entertaining in that it is unintentionally hilarious the movie starts out as what mostly seems like bad documentary endless repetitive narration about transvestites how difficult it is for transvestite look at his girlfriends clothes without being able wear them how transvestites are not necessarily homosexuals and how the main character glenglenda is as it reminds us probably half dozen times not half man and half woman but man and woman at the same time the camera work is terribleoccasionally the camera lingers on say closed door while the characters talk offscreen or inexplicably zooms in on someones ear or nose wood also makes copious use of mostly irrelevant stock footage leads voicedover nonsequiturs like yes our world is busy and frightening place so many people driving their automobiles finally there is occasional commentary from bela lugosi as sort of omniscient being who seems inhabit frankensteinstyle laboratory delivering pointless lines such as people all their own thoughts their own ideas while lightning crackles quasiominously overhead had wood continued in this vein glen or glenda probably would have been remembered as nothing more than poorly done documentary the occasional inappropriate horrormovie touch unfortunately he then wanders so far off into left field that you have wonder if he had been eating some funny mushrooms when he wrote the script pull the string pull the string announces an alarmed lugosi as stock footage of buffalo appears there is another crash of lightning before lugosi returns this time warning us beware beware the big green dragon that lurks outside your door it eats little boys and puppy dogs tails and big fat snails bizarre nightmare sequence is probably meant be symbolic but instead is just incredibly stupid ensues during glenglenda finds his fiance trapped under fallen treein the living room someone who is apparently intended be the sinister green dragon but looks more like klingon from the original star trek series appears be orchestrating all this though the is far from clear on this point put it kindly near the end of this sceneand here must confess that wood lost me completelyis violent sexual encounter on couch that features two characters who do not even appear in the rest of the movie and is scored goofily upbeat folk music after this scene ends not moment too soon glen or glenda returns its documentary style but at that point any lingering sense that wood had the slightest idea what he was doing is pretty much gone the wanders dumb happy ending that also seems abandon much of what it was trying say about transvestitism but at that point it did not matter much what happened as soon as the aforementioned sex scene was over glen or glenda had pretty much cemented its place in my mind as the most incoherent had ever seen honestly think that if picked up my camcorder and deliberately tried make the worst movie possibly could it still might not match glen or glenda for sheer cinematic disaster am giving this movie an but am not sure that quite does it justice

the second serialkiller thriller of the month is just awful oh it starts deceptively okay handful of intriguing characters and some solid location work after babysitter gets gutted in the suit ably spooky someonesinthehouse prologue parallel stories unfold the first involving texas sheriff lee emery gruesome double murder and the arrival of morose fbi agent dennis quaid on the eve of voting for the local lawmans reelection the second pairs hitch hiker jared leto friendly former railroad worker danny glover they are headed west toward the rockies and away from the murder scene one is the killer well it does not really matter ecause when writerfirsttime director jeb stuart die hard finally spills the beans you will not take his choice seriously anyway the whole thing goes south about an hour in the tale taking hairpin turns that certainly could not follow and through the whole thing there is quaid playing the most intense monotony this side of steven sea gal guess am glad that did not walk out there is some nice train stuff at the end and fun nod dr strangelove

this is my first review that post this newsgroup and kind of feel like have say something negative about this no one else seems care that it takes certain liberties that should not be taken historical story however even if one thinks of it as fiction the prince of egypt remains shallow but will begin from the beginning the biggest difference between the original biblical story and this version is that moses has some semblance of divinity in the bible whereas the animated version gives the impression of reluctant hero maybe it is just me but if knew had god on my side would have little bit more confidence there are other differences as well such as lack of important female characters and the passing over of the original pharoahs death like it is nothing but thing most of all though the storys focus has shifted rather than being story about fatherson manethnicity mangod the prince of egypt is almost solely about the brotherbrother relationship between rameses and moses was originally excited about this story element until saw the movie where it came off as maudlin rameses and moses squabble like children and then in the interests of peace moses saves rameses butt even though moses was the one who started it yawn did not care anymore the time moses ran off for murdering an overseer of course never happened in the original story moses was exiled but enough about the differences let us talk about the movie itself it features moses who in the interests of making the character more human lacks any divinity whatsoever is not convincing at all anyone who knows who god is it features cookiecutter iwannapleasedada rameses who at least is given dignity the voicework of ralph fiennes from schindlers list among other things the also features an extremely annoying character way of the newimproved miriam voiced the everantsy sandra bullock even though the most irritating thing about her is her tendency burst into song for no apparent reason here bullock is replaced singing voice speaking of it contains very annoying music it contains shallow writing it features extraordinary animation is one good thing can say about this most of all it contains an attempt commercialize homogenize and massmarket story about manifestation of god am not christian but got the impression of blasphemy the writers and producers took butcher knife and chopchopped into the story

for original sin the road the screen has been rocky initially slated for release last november the was bumped twice finally landing in the dog days of summer advance screenings of the were denied all but few critics generally sign that the studio realizes it has dud on its hands so is original sin really all that bad yes it is but the melodrama does offer some rewards the location settings are gorgeous and there is healthy sprinkling of ta angelina jolie providing the and antonio banderas the more importantly the movie is entertainingly bad veteran readers know that as rule do not encourage people patronize lousy films most of the time there are plenty of quality offerings on the marketplace that are more deserving of our money and besides the let us go laugh at the failings of others mindset reflects an elitism that makes me uncomfortable but things are different this summer quality films put it mildly have been few and far between so as far as am concerned it is fair find our kicks where we may original sin will never join such treasures as valley of the dolls road house and showgirls in the bad movie hall of fame but it will do until something worse comes along the adapted director michael cristofer from the cornell woolrich novel waltz into darkness was also the source for the francois truffaut mississippi mermaid opens in turnofthecentury prison as jolies character slated for dawn execution tells her lurid tale priest who appears desperately horny the freshman writing class tone is quickly established when she says things like this is not love story it is story about love wary of local golddiggers cuban coffee dealer luis antonio vargas banderas makes arrangements secure mail order bride from america listing himself as mere clerk dissuade foreign golddiggers practical man luis chooses frumpy looking lady hoping she will be loyal mate able provide him children imagine his surprise when his fianc julia russell jolie turns out be infinitely more attractive than the woman in the photo julia explains that she sent different womans image because she did not want be selected solely for her pretty face luis then confesses his deception leading julie state great significance we have something in common we are both not trusted after their wedding luis and julia retire for glorious night of carefully choreographed lovemaking their bodies positioned display her breasts and his bottom as erotically as possible jolie and banderas are attractive people and watching them naked is fun although the filmmakers insistence on using one of banderas legs cover jolies crotch makes it look like he is trying climb her luis the stupidest man who ever lived immediately instructs the bank make his personal and business accounts available julia despite the fact that she seems nothing like the woman whom he corresponded his blissful ignorance continues as the warning signs mount up luis must force julia write her sister emily who is frantic over her lack of communication shortly after julia complains about the chirping of pet bird it is found on the floor of its cage broken neck finally when she cleans out his accounts and disappears luis begins suspect that something might be wrong incidentally if you are afraid am giving too much away rest assured that all of this happens in the first minutes of the movie leaving plenty of time for numerous dopey plot twists great deal of operatic acting and more footage of her tits and his ass along the way private detective walter downs played thomas jane who was terrific as mickey mantle in the hbo movie turns up hired the frumpy womans sister find out what happened the real julia luis is also eager for the detective track down the con artist having decided that if he cannot have her he will kill her oh the pathos of it all the cast appears recognize the trashiness of the story adjusting their performances accordingly banderas is suitably impassioned while jolie alternates between vamping and pouting and those lips she can really pout as for thomas jane he starts off acting suspicious and cagey then accelerates snidely whiplash level of nastiness his most startling moment comes when prove his power humiliate he forces luis against wall verbally taunts him while rubbing his cheeks against those of luis and then finishes establishing his dominance fullon kiss if anyone ever questions the difference between sex and rape show them this chilling scene and if anyone ever questions the difference between real drama and laughable potboiler show them original sin

one would think that david duchovny star of the cult favorite xfiles would be very careful in choosing his leading man cinema roles at least one would hope so one would be seriously incorrect eugene sands duchovny is surgeon so dedicated his craft that he becomes addicted amphetamines stay awake and work more it turns out be bad plan when he loses patient and his license while under the influence ten months later in seedy bar score synthetic heroin the doctor gets chance ply his trade when assassins gun down customer using plastic water bottle and bar tubing sands operates and saves his life smalltime hoodlum raymond blossom timothy hutton is impressed the cutlery skills on his associate he kidnaps and then offers downandout eugene position in his organization blossom needs doctor patch up gunshot victims that would be problematic at hospital sands temptation is that this will give him chance practice medicine again albeit illegally big chunks of cash fuel his habit and close proximity the gangsters womanfriend claire angelina jolie this films babe factor the wouldbe big time operator is desperately in need of help on the run from russian mobsters the bad guys that seem be all the rage in this years films and trying cut pirate software deal the chinese mafia blossom is surrounded blood after few medical misadventures the physician grows disenchanted his employment an encounter couple of psycho surfer dudes who threaten blow him away unless he fixes their dead buddy cements his feeling that he is in the wrong line of work when the fbi visits and forces him become an informant there is no question that he needs be somewhere else oddly enough these seem like they could be exciting scenes the disproves that assumption then bunch of other uninteresting things happen writing this only two days after seeing the its struggle remember the events you can take that as solid lack of recommendation for all the coolness that duchovny exhibits in xfiles it is surprise that his big screen presence is so lacking in charisma the doctor is particularly bland and dull even the cold turkey bit is rife dramatic possibilities come across as banal little chocolate and minor sweats get him through heroin withdrawal like virtually everything else in the it is missed opportunity the fox mulder detachment does not work here oscarwinner huttons manic mobster is much more difficult get handle on played partially for comedy and partially as crazed killer blossom almost becomes real but then sinks into goofiness most of the time hutton looks as if he is searching for his character and coming up empty jolie also makes few false moves towards creating threedimensional human being before giving up and turning into scenery the most interesting aspect of her performance is watching her pouty lips threaten take over the screen the rest are not any better michael massees eccentric fbi agent never revs up one of blossoms henchmen steals few moments of the show as quirky gunman reminiscent of val kilmers doc holliday in tombstone his twogunned blasting as he does bizarre dance is the high point of the but that seconds is not worth sitting through the other minutes first time director andy wilson known for his work on the british television series cracker appears be attempting jump on the pulp fiction bandwagon the best of these movies combine sense of style and flash significant substance the secondrate ones concentrate on just one of these aspects playing god does neither well the basic idea of the is solid and then it goes nowhere even worse it plods back and forth up and down long and winding road before it ends up nowhere fox fails yet again in his search for intelligent life

would appreciate it if you did not do that again starring jet li bridget fonda tch ky karyo burt kwouk directed chris nahon rated it is no secret that martial arts often use their plot simply get from one action sequence another when the fight scenes are enough justify paying admission there is no problem this as in most jackie chan projects and lot of the hong kong actioners when they are not well we are in bad shape kiss of the dragon jet lis second consecutive american misfire plays like one big miscalculation and fails even as the most rudimentary entertainment now before start getting emails angrily touting the genius of jet li let me explain myself li is as spectacular as ever here and do not think anyone would ever dare call his martialartsstar skills into question the problem is not him it is the movies tone the much touted fightscenes here are filmed such unflinching unrelenting brutality that they are unpleasant watch they are joyless perfuctory lis rogue chinese detective is more of killing machine than hero terminator black belt instead of metal skeleton but even the terminator in judgement day had sympathetic side the plot is not relevant but if you are curious it is some nonsense about chinese law enforcement officer li sent paris investigate possible drug ring and encounter corrupt chief of police tcheky karyo who kills people and does sinister things no motivation whatsoever oh yeah and lis character is also an acupuncture expert who is able ease pain andor kill at the touch of needle kiss of the dragon is the name of an acupuncture maneuver in you stick needle in precise location on the back of the victims neck somehow redirecting all of the bodys bloodflow the brain and killing the poor sap more or less immediately there is vague attempt humanize li having him fall in love downtrodden prostitute whose daughter is being held hostage for some reason the villain this is one of the worst love stories have ever seen on screen even worse than the one in pearl harbor there is no conviction whatsoever as the movie barely pays lip service it it is only here because someone apparently thought there should be some kind of boymeetsgirl subplot kiss of the dragon was written luc besson whose screenplay the messenger the story of joan of arc for all of that films flaws was at least thoughtful do not know why the guy got himself involved in this train wreck but perhaps he wanted so something more mainstream after the neverending weirdness of the fifth element and the aforementioned stylized biopic suppose you could call this mainstream but will choose the bizarre any time of the day if action scenes in movie are going be brutal instead of dazzling you need story justify watching them the filmmakers behind kiss of the dragon should have rethought their strategy no one will walk out of this misbegotten project smiling but hear rush hour is coming in just few weeks

the rich legacy of cinema has left us certain indelible images the tinkling christmas tree bell in it is wonderful life bogies speech at the airport in casablanca little elliotts flying bicycle silhouetted the moon in t and now starship troopers director paul verhoeven adds one more image that will live in our memories forever doogie houser doing vulcan mind meld giant slug starship troopers loosely based on the robert heinlein novel is the story of an interstellar war between humans and giant insects in the hands of verhoeven the mammoth scifi battle flick is one of the most astonishingly bad films ever made monument inept filmmaking on colossal scale put it simply it is bug bomb in robocop and total recall verhoeven displayed gift for creating an entertaining mix of violence special effects and social satire and starship troopers starts off in similar fashion tongueincheek futuristic military recruitment ad that shows promise things go downhill fast though as we meet our heroes group of buenos aires teens preparing graduate from high school inexplicably johnny rico carmen ibenez dizzy flores and xander barcalow are played squarejawed anglo kids who look like they just stepped out of mountain dew commercial it is veritable alpha centuri as we watch the lovesmitten teens squabble in the name of love michael ironside plays their teacher who waves around cheesy fake severed arm while lecturing about civic responsibilities eventually the kids join the military dreams of glory in their addled little minds one of their classmates carl jenkins doogie housers neil patrick harris snags job in military intelligence because of his strong psychic abilities he displays his gift psychically ordering pet ferret crawl up his mothers leg long dull boot camp sequence follows enlivened only an extended coed shower scene where the recruits swap snappy banter as the showgirls directors camera roams over their buff bodies finally full hour into the the war finally starts and we meet the enemy the bugs hail from klendathu and colonize planets hurling their spores into space they attack starships spinning around and firing deadly plasma blasts from their rears yes incredible as it seems the bugs actually kill cosmic farts phenomenally large amount of money was spent creating the computer animated insects and the results are mixed at best sweeping distant shots depicting hordes of giant bugs racing attack are both impressive and scary but the closeups are different matter the insects have an odd artificial look like origami creations mottled plastic coating the attack scenes are intensely violent as one would expect from verhoeven but the overall look is too phony generate any real tension while the action is frantic the military strategy wildly illogical even standards grows tiresome quickly verhoeven tries spice things up throwing in more satiric news coverage but the fauxjingoistic scenes of children doing their part for the war effort squishing roaches on sidewalk are not enough make up for the long stretches of sheer dreck one can only guess what paul verhoeven was trying do here his customary one part satire two parts ultraviolence formula is way out of whack and most of the just flounders in showgirls fashion some scenes are almost bad enough be good an intergalactic kegger party jake busey playing dixie on green plexiglas fiddle has certain bizarre appeal sex scene between two of the teens achieves smarmy charm enhanced few minutes later when the female receives fatal jab from bug but tells her hero that she does not mind dying it is okay she gasps got have you and then of course there is doogies mind meld bug it is possible that verhoeven was attempting create an homage the era of the original novel heinleins pre stranger in strange land books were aimed at adolescent males and starship troopers has the antiseptic retrofuture look of late searly scifi the one cityscape shown is jetsonslike gleaming metropolis flying cars whizzing past an obvious matte painting the hairstyles are retro too straight from the frankie avalon annette funicello school of fashion ultimately verhoevens motives are irrelevant he has produce gargantuan that fails as an action or as social satire it even fails be an entertaining bad movie avoid starship troopers at all costs

tim robbins and martin lawernce team up in this road movie comedy robbins plays an exec who discovers his wife having sex his boss he goes into depression and drives around his neighbourhood until he arrives inside the usual ghetto side of every american city there lawernce attempts steal his car but no avail and is dragged along robbins on trip arizona there they hold up store are mistaken for two other robbers just like in my cousin vinny and are chased the police and the other robbers of course there is gags along the way usually from lawernce although the is midly funny and quite watchable there is something so horribly familiar about it all this should really be called beverly hills midnight run there is lawernce his wisecracking and heavy profanity just like eddie murphy in beverly hills cop and pratically the same idea as midnight run it is full of all the road movie cliches and even has comedy car chase just seemed so eighties even the credit sequence seemed be out of steve martin or chevy chase eighties comedy there also is not much chemistry between robbins and lawernce in planes trains and automobiles there was real chemistry between steve martin and john candy in nothing lose there is hardly chemistry at all towards the end the chemistry seems work but for the bulk of the there is hardly any the director directs the in workman like fashion but gets the jokes across and although there is no chemistry between the two leads they give good performances on their own lawerence gives good eddie murphy performance and robbins is alright aswell however robbins performance is nowhere near as good as the characters he played in jacobs ladder and the player in fact if you want see robbins do comedy much better than in nothing lose suggest you rent out the hudsucker proxy where he is much funnier nothing lose does have some funny moments in it however the humour is not particulary sophisticated but if you enojyed dumb dumber you might enjoy this the characters in arizona are funny and there is also good scene where robbins asks shopkeeper threatening approach was better lawerences consisted of lawerence threatening shoot the shopkeepers ass and swearing lot or himselfs was speaking in deep scary voice but the gags are predictable the lack of chemistry infurating and the ending too farfetched and perfect nothing lose then is robbins first bad movie and hopefully his last and suggests that odereick should twice before making another he nearly ruined carreys career ace ventura when nature calls let us hope he has not ruined robbins or even lawerences nothing lose

capsule not as bad sequel as crow or batman robin but still horribly putrid cheesy and illconceived this one belongs in saturday morning cartoons extended review you know about halfway through this movie realized that if you hacked out everything except the fight scenes you would have damn fine minutes or so of flashy hong kong style martial arts beautifully choreographed robin shou who also plays liu kang the fight scenes are both mindblowing and graceful acrobatic enough make olympic gymnasts weep this is what made the original so fun but unfortunately for the sequel we are without the frenetic directorial style of paul anderson instead they got john leonetti the cinematographer for the original mortal kombat not good choice while the fight scenes are brutal and eyepopping the rest of the movie looks like standard made for tv fare the acting is subpar could endure if it were not for the directors style the special effects the treatment of the story and characters mr leonetti should go back lighting in my opinion could say dozens of bad things about him he way overuses slowmotion he has no eye for action he cannot get even mediocre performances out of actors and so on but far his worst move was the way he treated jumping apparantly everybody can now fly hell am all for the occaisional gravity defying flip kick and whatnot but not when it happens every few minutes and is done so poorly better jumping and acrobatics has been seen in xena warrior princess in short they should have gotten paul anderson back or at least let robin shou direct unlike the first one whose sfx were vibrant and somewhat realistic mk as special effects are bland fake looking and overall just plain bad counted at least half dozen times that bluescreening was painfully obvious had this movie been made in the it would have been groundbreaking but in todays industry it does not even look finished now for the _really_ bad parts admit am an avid fan of the mortal kombat series the games are amusing diversions an easy way work off stress and anger the first movie was mindlessly fun thrillride this could have been really cool movie it is not the writers apparantly deemed it necessary lower the target audience from teens preschoolers some of the plot elements are just plain stupid how stupid take for instance how our heroes move around they use giants spheres the roll around underground supposedly at thousands of miles per hour oh boy even worse is the treatment of secondary characters blink and you will miss em most characters had more depth in the video games if you thought batman robin was bad about this you as not seen nothin yet good of the characters are introduced kick somebody around bit then either die or are forgotten about there is no explanation at all for this and for the final blasphemy the fight that all the fans were waiting rabidly for the fight hyped be the most intricate of the movie lasted about minutes and then just sort of ended it almost made me weep sum it all up rent it on video and fastforward through everything except the fight scenes

in the astronauts wife charlize theron plays young woman nervous demeanor pixiehairdo and demon spawn unwittingly growing in her belly if only her name was not jillian the makers of this embarrassing bit of scifi shlock could have come up far more appropriate title rosemarys species what shame it is see such gifted actress as theron oscarworthy in the devils advocate struggle the lamest ripoff of screendom classic in recent memory ok maybe the astronauts wife deviates from rosemarys baby turf for its setup finds our heroine terrorized not satans minions but her possessed husband johnny depp shuttle pilot whose mission mishap leaves him um changed man predictably he and the missus get it on in sequence best described as unpleasant his evil seed impregnating her twins and realizing that great bowfinger line about alien love therons advocate character faced similar dilemma the horror there resonating strongly astronaut provides only artificial anxiety last years equally noodleheaded species ii spun similar premise about the breeding habits of an extraterrestrial on earth but at least that movie more or less knew it was garbage the astronauts wife is grave and humorfree passing its increasingly silly story off as fullfledged serious right down an ambiguous finale that is not even going satisfy those who have stayed it thus far heres hint it involves lots of water electrical equipment special effect from the abyss and the tots who doubled up as adam sandlers costar in big daddy draw your own conclusions directorwriter rand ravich coats the proceedings in dynamic sights masterminded legendary t cinematographer allen daviau but too often favors the films visual presentation over the story he is trying tell this bodes horribly for each dramatic development like the surfacing of suspicious nasa official speed joe morton instigate jills slow and stupid comprehension of the truth his hypererratic behavior is probably supposed give wife paranoid edge instead he adds the phoniness theron and depp are certainly beyond this junk and will get other chances prove themselves this fall she as part of an imposing ensemble case in the john irving adaptation cider house rules he in the lead of tim burtons eagerlyawaited sleepy hollow undeserving of such talent the astronauts wife manages be derivative dull and uninvolving despite its seemingly ripe potential for unintentional laughs in space no one can hear you scream but in movie theatre everyone can hear you snore

for good ten years or so super cool chow yun fat has enjoyed god hood status in the hong kong action scene now he has followed in the footsteps of director john woo who launched chow is super stardom in the acclaimed better tomorrow moving had some reservations about this move and it would seem was right have them chow plays hitman who is doing jobs in order repay debt his final job requires him kill policemans seven year old boy this he refuses do and runs however he is forced into violent confrontation when his family are threatned and replacement killers are brought in do the job cue around minutes of various and quite frankly tedious shoot outs take place in various locations some thought had gone into making them bit different but unfortunately they end up being just plain boring the car wash scene found myself laughing at how stupid it looked tut tut the emphasis during the constant action seemed be on the accompanying music could have sworn one piece was ripped out of bruckheimer movie and not on the content mia sorvino passport forger is dragged into the affay and also provides lame love interest as well as being rather handy gun director antoine arqua has clearly not observed chow is excellent acting capabilties and simply requires him mutter few lines of broken english and look flash as he stands and shoots chow is trademark of twin pistol shooting is saved for the finale in fairness is quite good and there is not even toothpick in site and as for making chow shoot like cop well that is damned unforgiveable round up the replacement killers is pretty darned lame first outing for chow it would appear he has left asia for minute pop video this is not what we wanted at all considering john woo was the exec producer did he have no say so at all watch the killer again and weep at the difference review chris hill there is room at the top they are telling you still but first you must learn how smile as you kill if you want be like the folks on the hill

libby parsons ashley judd has the perfect little life rich husband cute son and house on the ocean but when her husband nick bruce greenwood takes her sailing she awakes find him gone and her hands covered blood just as she makes it the deck and picks up the bloody knife lying there the coast guard arrives in response distress call her vanished husband sent she is convicted of his murder of course and leaves her son matty benjamin weir her best friend annabeth gish time passes and the friend disappears matty during their last phone conversation libby hears matty yell daddy and realizes that her husband is still alive libby serves six years growing harder and driven the desire kill nick based on the theory that because of the double jeopardy amendment she can off him impunity when she gets parole she is sent halfway house run travis lehman tommy lee jones former law professor who ruined his life drunk driving accident after little breaking and entering and some destruction of property libby jumps parole and lams it across the country looking for nick and matty travis pursues naturally double jeopardy is watereddown version of the fugitive jones sleepwalking through his wellworn pursuer persona although libby never leaps from bus that collides train she manages get into few nailbiters chased down the beach jeep chained car that plunges into the ocean sealed in coffin that add some much needed thrills an anemic slowmoving script character development is thin travis intriguing backstory is mentioned couple times but has no effect on the story think they only made him former law professor so that he could verify the doublejeopardy theory when libby gets the drop on nick it is long way go for one line there is considerable sexual tension between travis and libby hey there is something the fugitive did not have but it never goes anywhere libby is tvmovie everywoman but judds intense performance draws us in and makes us forget that her character has no distinguishing characteristics this is judds most prominent role date and she proves that she can light up the screen let us hope gives her more work next time around the quality of director bruce beresfords movies seems depend on luck when he has good script and strong cast he turns out oscarcaliber work like breaker morant driving miss daisy and tender mercies when he does not we get double jeopardy screenwriters david weisberg and douglas cook previously collaborated on the rock script probably benefited from the numerous uncredited rewrites bottom line ashley judd tries hard but cannot save this predictable bore

as far as mystery men is concerned the burning question is less is it really as bad as it looks from the trailer the answer there is an unequivocal yes and more how in the name of sweet jesus did firsttime director kinka usher get such firstrate cast act in this muck mystery men features greg kinnear as the heavilysponsored captain amazing and geoffrey rush as his arch nemesis singular casanova frankenstein veritable police lineup of hot talent plays the superhero wannabes of the title who join forces get amazing out of tight spot when frankenstein puts the screws on champion city there is william macy as the mildmannered shoveler hank azaria as the cutleryflinging blue raja no knives but phony english accent that is just as sharp ben stiller as mr furious whose only power seems be his ability get hot under the collar janeane garofalo as crazed bowler her fathers skull interestingly preserved wes studi as rhetoricspouting cowled avenger and kel mitchell as the token and adding insult injury invisible black guy bringing up the rear so speak is paul reubens yes that is pee wee herman paul reubens as well let us just call him the gas man the production design is overblown the special effects are overdone and the script based on bob burdens dark horse comic book series is overbaked the appealing actors are uniformly good and stiller is even stellar but they cannot begin save mystery men it is just one big mess you are better off renting the video and pressing fastforward get the funny bits believe counted three

the swirling sick feeling hit me just few minutes into heartbreakers ray liottas character was making out his secretary when his new wife knocked on the door of his office while scrambling collect himself he frantically shouted her just wait sex er mean sec was struck wave of revulsion thinking geez did not lines like that die when threes company was canceled over the next few minutes as the barely double entendres and lingering cleavage shots grew more numerous realized that the mindset behind heartbreakers predated threes company suddenly had an outofbody experience as my internal wayback machine swept me the mids all across america the counterculture was growing like wildfire but there was scant evidence of it on tv while young people were challenging traditional values on the streets frustrated teenagers like me were stuck at home sulking while our parents enjoyed the latest bob hope special women in skimpy bathing suits would prance onscreen while hope made growling noises and leered at their breasts on another channel dean martin made wisecracks about booze and broads and peter lawford decked out in love beads and nehru jacket purred suggestive oneliners as he ogled the gogo dancers the adults laughed and laughed heartbreakers reeks of that stagnant mentality from its lingering shots of jennifer love hewitts vahvahvoom breasts its leaden screenplay paints women as haughty schemers and men as drooling buffoons too sexobsessed realize they are being manipulated in addition liotta and hewitt the cast includes sigourney weaver gene hackman jason lee nora dunn and anne bancroft cannot imagine what drew performers of their caliber this project perhaps they thought it was parody of the sniggering sex comedies of the if so they were sadly mistaken the story revolves around motherdaughter conteam it opens the marriage of max weaver dean liotta new jersey chop shop operator having withheld sex until the honeymoon max pretends pass out on their wedding night the next morning she feigns illness sending very horny dean off the office where he ends up in the arms of his new secretary just as the two are about get overtly physical max bursts into the room and catches them the horrified bride dissolves the union garnering healthy cash settlement along the way of course the secretary was really her daughter page hewitt and the whole thing was setup the women move on but an irs agent bancroft catches up them and demands huge amount of money cover unpaid taxes in desperate need of funds max and page head for palm beach replay the scam their mark this time is william tensy hackman in hideous makeup decrepit tobacco tycoon obsessed the joys of smoking max starts put the game into action but page is so repelled the old man and angry her mom that she slips off enact her own score targeting jack laid back young beach bar owner who is worth fortune complications arise when page realizes that goodnatured jack is stirring actual emotions in her steely little heart as if that was not enough dean reappears on the scene revenge on his mind the attempt weld romance onto caper comedy served only remind me of the infinitely superior fish called wanda will not bother compare the two suffice say that everything done right in wanda is done wrong here heartbreakers is soulless inept and at minutes at least halfhour too long sigourney weaver and jennifer love hewitt throw themselves into their parts but have nowhere go the metallic characters gene hackman is utterly wasted in onenote onejoke part that has him doing nothing but smoking coughing and waxing rhapsodic about smoking and sex poor jason lee is stuck in the ingenue role and the normally charismatic actor comes off as merely bland ray liotta manages squeeze tiny bit of humanity and humor into his walking clich but only bit the low point in the has weaver employing russian accent bad enough make boris and natasha wince while doing halfassed slapstick broken off penis from statue bear in mind though that this is merely the worst segment of movie made up of nothing but low points if you remember bob hope specials fondness this might be your cup of tea as for me am going watch fish called wanda now and try forget ever saw heartbreakers

american pie alums jason biggs and mena suvari star in this summers attempt capitalize on the youth market looking for comedy about young people they can relate that combines generic cute coupleness and zany comedy it is about an student biggs as paul who gets scholarship some college in new york city who sticks out like sore thumb and falls for dora suvari ditzy heroinchic goth chick who has no ambition or selfrespect whatsoever and allows herself be pushed around just like hickboy paul is so we have got fishoutwater formula mixed meetcute romantic comedy ideally should make for good movie unfortunately the atrocious screenplay and boring direction clueless auteur amy heckerling successfully manages screw up everything about the these characters are totally unrealistic and unbelievable it is as if everyone under age is stoned raver there is no background or details anyone or anything it is just bunch of cartoon characters running into each other not mention the story itself is virtually nonexistant and contains so many plotholes it is like swiss cheese even the basic editing is bad if you are looking for romantic comedy stay far away from this one because it is neither romantic nor funny saw this in packed cinema on opening night and the audience barely laughed at all if you have seen the commericials you have seen all the funny parts are all from the first five minutes

last summer featurelength version of the avengers hit theaters the tune of unanimous critical panning based on the famous television show the was an enormous boxoffice flop and huge disappointment for warner bros year later the studio is up their old tricks again the unnecessary revival of the robert conrad program the wild wild west but it sounded promising the same tagteam of star will smith and director barry sonnenfeld who both contributed make men in black such financial success is at the reins again and costar kevin kline is attached the project as well as substantial budget spice up the special effects mean what could possibly go wrong the answer is just about everything wild wild west is cinematic abomination that was so entirely pointless begin that it is never given proper chance get out of the gate there are lot of fancy special effects and handful of distinguished actors who try desperately tunnel through the inane plot and make lasting impression but the script is so deliriously uneven the entire movie so off course that no human being or technical achievement has chance salvage it at square one we have bizarre case of casting will smith plays james west renegade cowboy who was originally played white actor robert conrad in the tv series my guess regarding the casting of africanamerican smith is simple one the actor cozy summertime release big bucks for all those involved smith is very talented performer who usually brings swift assurance any comic relief material but this is not an ideal role for him he is too much of joker heard that initial casting included george clooney in the lead role and frankly that sounds lot more plausible what makes matters worse is that smith goes through the role such selfassurance in his eyes you can practically sense his contentment the fact that he knows wild wild west will be huge hit at the summer box office the plot involves west and crossdressing government agent artemus gordon kevin kline who are assigned the president recover group of kidnapped scientists the trail leads the diabolical dr arliss loveless kenneth branagh man no lower body who speaks in dry witty southern accent loveless has taken the countrys top technical minds hostage so that they can assist in his deranged plan of total government control using lethal superweapons destroy entire towns one such weapon is an foot mechanical tarantula bearing eight spindly legs of thrashing metal and spewing enormous fireballs left and right the visual effects that bring this metallic bug life are spectacular seamlessly blending computergenerated imagery the western surroundings unfortunately all of these effects seem so detached from the story and can do little support the films plot deficiencies are undoubtedly the main problem wild wild west is running gag that never truly works most of the jokes usually care of smith die on arrival if it is one thing that could possibly be the saving grace it is the performances and even they are mostly offkilter and poorly delivered kline is admirable but he has little do but invent silly devices on the spot salma hayek is wasted as the romantic interest because she is viewed as little more than that window dressing look pretty and create conflict between west and gordon branagh an esteemed shakespearean actor and director adds marginal enjoyment the but even he is so utterly weird and overthetop rarely is so lost in itself as wild wild west is suppose there is always one turkey of the summer season highly anticipated bigbudget release that manages completely disappoint wild wild west is such movie and will probably go down as one of the biggest disappointments of but it is highly unlikely that this will go down in defeat at the box office perhaps after this audiences will be less assured when they see will smiths name stamped on summer movie after such hits as independence day and mib wild wild west is not an impressive addition the resume

at the outset of swordfish john travoltas gabriel shear is pontificating about the status of american cinema today basically he says it boils down lack of imagination among the majority of writers how ironic as travolta seems be describing his latest venture swordfish is loud violent and amoral it has the audacity justify murder and mayhem in the name of sustaining our way of life and how does travoltas gabriel plan do this robbing billions from his own government and using the funds outterrorize terrorists swordfish is very cynical movie it relies on an audiences perception of our leaders as ineffectual and duplicitous and on terrorists as nonhuman faceless entities not worthy of compassion or consideration the movies plot is preposterous enough illogical leaps that if the ever slowed down you would actually see how ridiculous it all is this is liveaction road runner cartoon moving so quickly that it is over before you can catch your breath ask any reasonable questions the storyline revolves around super hacker stanley jobson hugh jackman recruited gabriel crack the governments computer codes so gabriel can gather billions for his antiterrorist campaign talk about whackedout patriotism my objections swordfish are many the body count is high but that is expected in movie of this sort it is becoming bore watching anonymous soldiers police officers and government agents blown bits another example is the family dynamics between stanley his yearold daughter and his exwife stanley though having served time in prison for hacking is shown as loving and caring father forbidden his ex see his little girl audience animosity is immediately created for his former spouse showing her as drinker and smoker who also sometimes stars in her new husbands adult films thus when she is found murdered late in the movie neither stanley nor his daughter are allowed any time grieve in fact subconsciously many in the audience are probably glad she was killed then there is the sequence involving one of gabriels henchman holding gun the head of stanleys daughter coerce the hacker download the key computer program for gabriel children as pawns have become most unwelcome clich in recent films there is enough violence in the real world involving children without having make them onscreen victims as well yea it is only make believe but that does not mean you have tolerate it travolta is cool deadly charming and flamboyant as the nearcrazy gabriel his character is reminiscent of his villainous characterizations in broken arrow and faceoff jackman looks dour through most of the proceedings his only moment of any depth comes when he finally is able create the worm get inside the government database his sense of joy and accomplishment is one any computer whiz can appreciate halle berry is decorative and lovely as gabriels assistant while don cheadle is given little do as the head fbi agent hunting gabriel swordfish plays like comic book largerthanlife character in gabriel viewers align themselves him despite their uncertainty if he is hero or villain and maybe that is the movies underlying flaw there is no real hero speak of only those doing their upmost survive and that is not enough this is one swordfish that should have been thrown back in the water

it is probably inevitable that the popular virtual reality genre the matrix existenz would collide the even more popular serialkiller genre kiss the girls seen the result should have been more interesting than the cell as the movie opens therapist catharine deane jennifer lopez treats catatonic boy colton james entering his mind through some sort of virtual reality technique that is never fully explained after months of therapy sessions in surreal desert catharine has no success report meanwhile killer carl stargher vincent donofrio has claimed another victim his particular hobby is kidnap young women keep them in glass cell overnight and drown them he takes the corpse and soaks it in bleach then suspends himself over the body and jerks off while watching video tape of the drowning although carls been doing this for awhile he is recently become sloppy and fbi agent peter novak vince vaughn is closing in fast not fast enough though keep carl from sticking another woman tara subkoff in the cell or catch him before he suffers schizophrenic attack that leaves him in coma from the videos in carls house peter can see that the drowning cell is automated and will fill water forty hours after the abduction save the kidnapped girl peter has find the cell before the end of the day and comatose carls not talking so off they go catharine in the hope that she can go inside carls mind and find out where the cell is in time the focus of the cell in on the ornate interior of carls mind but the universe director tarsem singh creates seems more an exercise in computergenerated spectacle than an exploration of the psychotic personality for the most part it is style without substance in his own mind carl is decadent emperor in flowing robes ming the merciless as well as frightened boy jake thomas abused his father all in all the mind of psycho killer turns out be strangely dull place and kept wishing could fastforward the next development singh is best known for directing music videos particularly rems losing my religion and the cell seems very much like really long really slow mtv video the sound deleted singer lopez seems think she is in video as well she devotes more time posing in elaborate costumes than she does acting the premise had great promise the computergenerated world within carls mind could have been bizarre surreal universe governed insanity and symbolism rather than logic the first room catharine enters in carls head shows this promise she finds horse standing in center of the room suddenly sheets of sharpedged glass fall into the horse dividing it into segments the panes of glass separate pulling apart the pieces of the stillliving horse this scene is twisted disturbing and thoughtprovoking because the psychological importance of the horse and its fate is left the viewer ponder another element that should have been developed is the effect on catharine of merging the mind of psychopath their minds begin bleed together at one point in the movie and this should have provided an opportunity discover the dark corners of catharines own psyche like sidney lumets the offence or michael manns manhunter the cell could have explored how the madness of the killer brings out repressed darkness in the investigator however catharines character is hardly developed at all and lopez has no depth offer the role bottom line do not get trapped in this one

synopsis an aging master art thief his supplier and young buxom security consultant are all not who they first appear be or are they in this convoluted mess involving risky heist during the millennium comments this movie was boring plain and simple entrapment should not have been boring it stars sean connery who can still carry an action despite his age catherine zetajones likeable enough presence and ving rhames ultracool star of pulp fiction and mission impossible it takes full advantage of the yk computer bug fears current hot topic in the news in its storyline is set at the end of it has some genuinely wellstaged action sequences so what went wrong plenty unfortunately the major problem entrapment is its script it has beenthere donethat feel it nothing seems particularly inventive or original so the whole movie lacks suspense and drags it runs nearly two hours the screenwriters for example periodically use countdown the millennium as means of transition between scenes e days the millennium this device was used much more effectively in the overlooked scifi strange days the characters are not who they appear be at the beginning is neat at first but the device wears thin once the umpteenth surprise revelation is made entrapment in other words relies too heavily on the audience not knowing what each characters true motive is resulting in convoluted story leaves many scratching their heads in confusion the star power here is quite strong but the viewer cannot help but feel the actors are wasted in this production sean connery is given such mindnumbing lines as never trust naked woman ving rhames character seems like an afterthought he is not developed at all the camera zooms in frequently and leeringly at catherine zetajoness tight wardrobe this in and of itself is not bad but after while it has juvenile feel it at least the species movies hold no bones about the fact that they are exploiting the female body entrapment does the same under the thin disguise of plot development sean connery supposedly falls in love the girl while watching her in tights arc and pivot around laser beams the tagline for this movie reads the trap is set it sure is on those who spent money see this movie entrapment really is not that bad it is watchable would suggest however one waits until this is on cable or television see it

the first image in final fantasy the spirits within is computeranimated closeup of human eye it is beautiful piece of work remarkably detailed and quite convincing when the picture pulls back reveal the owner of the eye however things change the young woman has mesmerizing hair although it hangs too artfully even movie standards be believed the facial features are more detailed than any computeranimation seen date but the result is more reminiscent of very wellcrafted doll than anything human she is pretty but bland and not nearly expressive enough come off like person all the characters in final fantasy are like that of the core group the younger white men and women are all athletic attractive and indistinct like applicants for tv reality show the black man is taller and burlier and the aging scholar is bald wrinkles and beard none of them appear be based on individuals they all look like the products of general descriptions given police sketch artist it gets worse when they talk and move why is the sarcastic voice of steve buscemi he of the great twisted face and snaggleteeth coming out of the mouth of some dreary ken doll why for every fluid physical gesture do we also see herkyjerky puppetstyle motions more the point who decided fulllength computer animated movie featuring hyperreal their term not mine humanoids was good idea final fantasy is based on phenomenally popular video game have never played story straight out of japanese anime more often than not leaves me bored and depressed if you are fan of either please spare me your letters as will focus solely on the finished and not its source materials an expressionchallenged cast final fantasy mixes turgid action scenes heaps of mystical shit the result is ugly confusing and boring note the following reveals the basic plot if you want have fighting chance of making any sense of the movie suggest you read it earth is at war aliens that appear feed on human souls most of our planet is devastated humans living in few protected cities while the bulk of the survivors focus on military strategies aki ross voiced mingna and her mentor dr sid donald sutherland believe in more organic approach they operate on the notion quoting straight from the press kit that all life forms have signature spirit waves that can be identified and contained aki and dr sid collect series of organic specimens whose spirit signatures combined will form wave of equal and opposite intensity the spirit wave of the alien force the waves will in effect cancel each other out and disarm the foreign contagion they have collected six of the eight key spirits needed complete their wave they are on desperate hunt find the remaining two spirits before their time runs out are you still me there is only little more aki is infected the alien force dr sid has developed method of confining the contagion and keeping it from killing her but the defense wall will not hold much longer already the alien is communicating aki through her dreams aiding aki and dr sid are the deep eyes group of hardasnails types that would have felt at home the troops in aliens capt gray edwards alec baldwin heads the task force that consists of wise guy buscemi tough woman peri gilpin and gentle giant ving rhames throwing monkey wrench into the plans is the requisite dumb ass in this case general hein james woods who wants use the zeus cannon bomb the aliens back the stone age even if it destroys earth as well so there you have it like most of the anime have seen the plot combines apocalyptic settings lots of shooting and fuzzy spirituality all wrapped up in savetheearth bow but am bored apocalyptic settings understand why so many liveaction films employ them they are cheap but animated films can show anything so why wallow in an industrial trash heap the action scenes and shootemups do not satisfy either the humans move oddly and their facial features are so muted that the talented voice cast cannot bring them life in fact their efforts merely emphasize what we are missing aki is especially disappointing her lack of expression and flat delivery she looks and sound like brunet version of weena the eloi girl from the time machine drab color choices and aliens that appear have been created in jello molds sap the pizzazz from the big set pieces students of computer animation may be fascinated the technology behind final fantasy the spirits within but found it subpar across the board futurama does more effective battle visuals the kids in south park are far more expressive than these mannequins and any old episode of the contemporary version of the outer limits does better doom and gloom scifi so who needs this not me

plot token director alan smithee steals the only copy of his trio from the studio after they complete the final cut without him he threatens burn the reel if they do not allow him keep his vision critique wow really cannot remember the last time movie sucked on so many levels the comedy in this is pathetic obvious and dated oj simpson jokes galore the plot is uninteresting boring and bad the structure of the is annoying repetitive and pretentious the acting is pretty bad especially jackie chan who cannot act save his life the cameos are lame and seem forced and the ending blows chunks all in all this movie believes itself be clever humorous and edgy look behind the closed doors of but comes across as boring stupid and completely unentertaining piece of shite love see movies about shenanigans but this one bites the big one see it if you like watch really bad movies otherwise skip it because it will just have you hating every star that makes an appearance in it luckily for us all this mess only lasts about minutes and miramax honcho harvey weinstein plays leadfaced detective the way is there any reason why the studio or the producer could not have cut another version of the the way of all the filmed stock that was left over who knows who cares this satire sucks the bag little known facts about this and its stars ironically the original director of this arthur hiller also requested his name be taken off the credits and replaced the dgas alan smithee moniker this was after the films production company cinergi pictures preferred the cut made producerwriter joe plot rich guy who does not believe in love orders mailorder bride for himself that very evening the couple is married and fall madly in love soon thereafter but what is this one of them might not be the person they are pretending be wow sin indeed critique easily one of the worst movies that have seen all year too long too boring too predictable and too ridiculous for anyone interested in watching good movie what the hell were they thinking when they made this thing it is no wonder that the has been sitting on the racks for about year this felt like really bad tv movie of the week some nudity stuffed in from time time just wake up the audience have you ever switched channels and fallen upon one of those ridiculously melodramatic tv movies one that you just could not help but switch back from time time just make sure that it was not part of some sick joke well this movie is exactly like that only it is not joke it is not on tv and you are asked pay money see it say again what the shite were they thinking okay so where do start first of all the trailer of this gives away the movies main plot twist the betrayal so for the first half hour of the you are basically just sitting there watching these two lovers go through the motions until the betrayal occurs whoopee big surprise second of all angelina jolie is horribly miscast in this part why well it is like this not for one second do you ever believe that she is not nasty backstabbing woman mean it is like all of those people who complained about jack nicholson being psycho from the start of the shining well the same goes here every look in jolies eyes screams psycho then of course you have the case of the patsy husband man who just cannot seem figure out anything in time mean how boring is that for the audience you are watching this guy screw up time after time after time and somehow we are supposed feel sorry or care about this dude no thanks and if we do not care about him and we really do not care about her she is beeyatch and as confused as we are about her actual motivations in the who the hell are we supposed care about in this well will tell you the only thing that was worrying about the whole way through this picture was whether or not would actually fall asleep before the end credits rolled no suspense no chemistry between the leads no real love or passion no sense of surprise plenty of plot holes for everyone and an extra moronic ending so why am even giving this rating of three points well it is actually pretty simple liked the locations in the movie and the groovy score but my primary reason for slipping three notches onto this bedpost is for the gratuitous shots of jolies boobies that is two points right there and another one for antonios ass hairless just for the record everything else in this movie was pointless boring and just plain stupid try imagining softporn movie but without the plot that is pretty much what you have got here low point in the careers of both stars oops almost forgot mention the crappy dialogue god oh mighty make it stop where is joblo coming from american psycho cruel intentions eyes wide shut fatal attraction playing heart under suspicion what lies beneath what women want whipped

not great twelve months for either of the principals from this movie earlier this year nora ephron wrote and produced one of the years least likeable comedies called hanging up featuring bunch of
