annoying women ironically lisa kudrow played one in that as well who barely have time care about anyone but themselves ick real sweet stuff but her little unsuccessful project was nothing compared what john travolta went through earlier this summer entitled battlefield earth seemed be the only person on this planet who somehow appreciated the even if it was on cheese factor as everybody and mean everybody else pretty much classified the movie as one of the worst disasters of all time yipes another beauty so what happens when you put these two people in the same room and come out movie costarring the everversatile lisa kudrow uhhhm you guessed it not much plot in order escape major financial difficulties local weatherman hooks up his ballpicking lotto girlfriend and rigs the state lottery but as more and more people find out about their scheme more and more people demand part of their winnings and more and more problems arise critique simply stated did not laugh once during this entire picture for comedy it offered me few smiles bunch of nincompoops as characters miscast john travolta hamming it up and lisa kudrow in what can only described as sluttier version of her character of phoebe on tvs friends this was not as disastrous as thought it would be but it was pretty close thankfully the clips of travolta dressed up in goofy outfits dancing as the weatherman were left in the films trailer and not in this final cut and not unlike the worst movie of the year so far beautiful this also managed feature many unsympathetic idiotic and just plain irritating characters in its cast foremost was travoltas character who declined give us any reason care for him once in the entire movie and for me the casting choice of john travolta for this role was just plain wrong he did not fit the part just saw him in get shorty the other day and thought about how perfect he was for that role cool calculating roughneck certain hip suave je ne sais quoi in this he looks like he is trying be funny trying be bad trying be good we are not supposed be able notice that and when we do at least in my case consider it wrong choice in casting add that lisa kudrow boring us yet another one of her patented dumb blonde routines but this time dressed in sexier outfits michael rapaport stretching one small acting muscle play the guy who is not quite up at the same speed level as everyone else and truckload of empty comedic bullet shells and you have got yourself an extremely quiet audience anticipating punch lines that never quite materialize the only real good thing that could say about this is that its story was actually halfinteresting and never really bored me also liked michael moores perverted cousin character and loved and say it again loved the character that bill pullman played give this dude his own movie he played lazy cop man who tries everything not do any real work he fakes injuries get off duty tries avoid arrest situations so that he will not have fill out any forms now there is base of humor sadly the filmmakers decided bring him into play only about half an hour left in the and there is not much else can say about this movie folks on the whole it was lame included slew of unlikable characters fiddling around in pool of unfunny lines and very little of interest for any target audience but get somebody write up movie featuring that lazy cop played pullman and am there

the stereotypical american male has an undeniable fetishistic love of sports cars producer jerry bruckheimer plays upon that attraction movie so loaded testosterone and laced titillatingly shot after frenetic shot of powerful muscle cars sleek foreign road huggers and iconic speed machines that many males will leave the theater in an orgasmic haze gone is seconds is an orgy of maleness gone horribly awry cage is legendary retired car thief memphis raines do not you love cute movie names who must call upon his time worn skills save his thickheaded brother ribisi from being killed seems murderous crime boss eccleston fetish for wood insert your own joke hired brother kip steal ridiculous amount of expensive exotic autos fifty cars be exact poor kip screws the pooch and bungles the job badly if the cars are not delivered in three days bossman has casket carved out just for kip literally if only someone could save him hmmmm wonder what memphis is doing in order give the some emotional heft there are several subplots designed tug at our heartstrings or give us the thrill of yawn excuse me dramatic tension shadowing memphis is an old law enforcement foe lindo who is looking send memphis away will he catch him there is old flame sway jolie who had her heart broken memphis years ago will they get back together shortsighted thrill seeker kip idolizes his brother yet resents him for moving away from the family will they reconnect raines old mentor duvall has long since left the life of crime will memphis get him finally caught as he pulls him back into the life one more time can you answer all these questions correctly in seconds without seeing the first will bet you can following the opening credits fill you in on the accomplishments of the raines family through montage of old photos we was taken full throttle into the splendor that is memphis he is first shown living the good life teaching young children drive gocarts in later scene as misfit brother kip knowingly tells memphis he has the stolen car situation under control all the while making breakfast metaphor is made of shakespearean proportions just as pan of grease flares up kip clueless how quell it big brother memphis calmly and efficiently throws some salt on it looks like everything might turn out alright after all you know this because the music swells on the crest of violins that is about as strong as the characterization gets is shame bruckheimer has real talent for loading his movies an obscene amount of talent given the task at hand monumentally underused jolie portrays an empty headed sexpot whose idea of sex revolves around cars and memphis or maybe it is just the cars duvall trots out his ornery but sweet old codger outfit am sure he is still laughing at taking paycheck for this one lindo projects warm hearted but tightly focused detective that almost transcends the material the biggest waste of resources is vinnie jones who plays mute accomplice of memphis without saying word he is easily the most charismatic person in the movie like blast of nitrous oxide he attacks each scene straightforward zeal too bad his minutes onscreen are so few somehow bruckheimer manages attract top acting talent high concept poorly written movies gussies up the lots of gold hues and pleasingly stylized action and they sell like proverbial hotcakes every time something clever happens it is counterbalanced something so overtly wrong that it jerks you back into realizing you are watching movie there is innovative usage of black lighting that goes from being novelty part of the plot it is counterbalanced an extremely feeble attempt at humor having an asian american repeatedly failing drivers test imagine the yuks there is segment where one of the thieves shows another his cool fake fingerprint trick it is countered the lame semisubplot of car being stolen bunch of heroin in the trunk the ramifications are never explored then there is the ridiculousness of the many cops who actually shoot at fleeing cars not only is it stupid but it is against the law this is movie made of pretty but tepid car chases strung together just enough character interaction move the plot along gone in seconds aptly describes how long it will take for this marginally entertaining but empty leave your memory

first and foremost think this movie comes grief at the hands of the pg rating it is been given for those of us who have not read the james lee burke novel that heavens prisoners is based on do not rabidly go out and buy tickets movies featuring the combined talents of alec baldwin and eric roberts feel vaguely depressed the notion of swamps gangsters louisiana accents plots subplots more plots and well really just want see teri hatcher naked this is one movie you are going worry the price of admission over hopeful still well let me share my moment of sheer panic and then the cold enervation of the big letdown when semirobed hatcher purrs alec baldwin what do you think of my butterfly butterfly asked myself what butterfly and then it hit me the scene had been snipped damn you godless pg rating show us her butterfly we want see the goddamn butterfly so no naked teri hatcher forget about that okay now heavens prisoners is about exalchoholic excop dave robicheaux alec baldwin who is trying discover life anew running bait shop and boat hire business his loving downtoearth wife annie kelly lynch everything dull but hunky dory until plane carrying illegal immigrants crashes almost ontop of the couple while they are on their boat the plane nosedives into the water and sinks but from its wreckage robicheaux rescues little pixiefaced salvadoran girl whom he and his wife immediately decide adopt what they do not realise is that the planes pilot was also drug dealer and that the plane had been sabotaged the latters erstwhile colleagues when robicheaux discovers this he predictably against the advice of his wife wellmeaning dea agent and two gangsters who rough him up begins poking his nose where it do not belong we know that the man deserves all the misery he is going get the question now is whether or not you want be dragged along for the ride through tedious meandering yet utterly suspenseless plot an unlovable hero as your guide as dave robicheaux alec baldwin is fat no seriously this is not the svelte thinking mans hero of the hunt for red october it is an outofshape guy who does not look too good in rooftop chasing scene he is also unconvincing in the movies dramatic moments acting what as far as can tell is steven segallike economy of expression threequarters of the way through the show while you are probably waiting for the next scene in bar where robicheaux contemplates succumbing the temptation of the whiskey bottle getting drunk and beating up someone or getting beaten up you will want beat on him little yourself on the other hand mary stuart masterson some kind of wonderful fried green tomatoes benny joon cast as downandout stripper who has her fingers broken is quite breath of fresh air just the right mix of cynicism warmth insecurity and humour be the movies only endearing character eric roberts as bubba rocque always believable as the womanabusing bad guy who knows how box see final analysis coincidentally also directed phil joanou is believable here as the womanabusing bad guy who knows how box and lest we forget teri hatchers role in all this this being her rather wellpublicised paid vacation from playing lois lane on tvs adventures of lois clark she is totally ridiculous as rocques manipulative and seductive cajun wife coming across as devious as mildly disgruntled au pair who is trying get back at an employer who has not been giving her enough days off it is probably safe say that her day job beckons and at the end of our day none of this is really worth hrs and minutes of our personal misery the flying inkpots rating system wait for the video little creaky but still better than staying at home gotcha pretty good bring friend amazing potent stuff perfection see it twice

it is amazing how comedian can have the some of the funniest standup around but completely fall flat in the movies take adam sandler on the basis of his first two cds they are all gonna laugh at you and what the hell happened me he is the best thing hit comedy since robin williams but when you put him in front of camera it just is not the same kind of enjoyed happy gilmore and thought that it warranted marginal recommendation but his latest the waterboy is about as funny as root canal seriously am willing wager than there were more laughs in saving private ryan than there are here in fact found this movie be more depressing than comedic the first half hour generated not one smile in me it is scenes of emotional abuse towards adams character of bobby boucher not only the cruel football players but also his very disturbed mother kathy bates what is the world coming granted after the gets rolling there are few mild chuckles throughout am even willing admit that it actually had me laughing once or twice but not nearly enough sustain the waterboy for it is nearly hour and half running time you are all familiar the plot because you have seen it at least million times before everyone picks on the hero until he shows hidden talent and leads the underdog team victory over the champions in the process not only winning the respect of his teammates but also getting the woman he loves and believe me am not giving anything away saying that sandlers team wins if you would actually feel any degree of suspense watching this movie then god be you the only things that keep this bomb from getting the big banana are the winning performances from henry winkler as the insecure coach and the severely underrated fairuza balk as bobbys love interest mean they should be lending their talents some loftier purpose but they do extremely well what they are given here kudos both of them my advice adam is try and follow in the footsteps of veteran comedians like williams and steve martin who made very smooth and successful transition from stage screen rely more on actual comedy rather than strange voices and rude noises make people laugh or maybe even show what dramatic talent he might have like jim carrey did the recent truman show the obvious and considerable talent that he possesses he just cannot keep going on like this

according popular opinion films greatness is determined time take for example casablanca great even today it is still as powerful as it was when it came out and still as romantic and tragic another example would be star wars had very very healthy box office gross despite the fact that we had all seen it about billion times before but as rewatched independence day when it came out on video after being the number one hit of kinda felt like it was not as cool as when had first seen it had liked it when saw it the first time was my original view and basically saw it as good escape but when rewatched it felt cheated thus the curse of the event independence day is like that kid who come out of nowhere and makes everybody happy at once except for couple kids the critics in this situation but after while this kid becomes annoying and you just wait for the next one well this kid is the event in my little analogy and when rewatched independence day not only did it not look cooler at all on the big screen but felt insulted the whole time there are too many gaping craters in the plot and you just are not sure if it is comedy or hokey drama one scene you will see hilariously nebbish scene between jeff goldblum and judd hirsch the next you will see bunch of military uptight guys walking around saying corny lines the worst is scene between brent spiner and bill pullman where spiner is sayinig something innocently funny but is barked like junkyard dog bill pullman who gives him the most unitentionally funniest speech since the end of glen or glenda now this annoying kids problem is that in the process of trying make everyone like him all at once he shows he has no balls and independence day has no balls it plays it safe everywhere it throws in ton of action that is borrowed from other superior films the chase scene between the alien ship and will smith is straight out of star wars mean is not that devils den and the aliens are about as anticlimactic as demi moores breasts in striptease they are these octopus men boring freaking octopus men mean come on the aliens in were more interesting and you did not even see them basically the plot is straight from bmovie from the aliens come earth and we wonder if they are hostile or peaceful okay it is an interesting topic but it is not handled greatly now they are not and somehow computer geek jeff goldblum figure out they are using our satellites as countdown destruction yep these aliens are not only heavily armed they are stupid too they also use the same kind of computer as we do but that comes about later the president bill pullman who is under attack for being wimp decides this would be nice time be belligerent and he decides he will stay in the white house the aliens have covered do not care if it is bob freaking dole in the white house get him out of there do not care if you have inject him sodium pentathol just get him out of there later on he is stupid and wants fly in the attack on big alien ship think it is time for impeachment for this guy he is more senile than reagan on pot then there is cocky pilot will smith who is the only person survive the counterattack on the second day and becomes moses in leading his children the elusive area the films only sign of being brave his girlfriends stripper sharing subplot striptease in that she has do it for her son come on she has fighter pilot boyfriendsoontobe fiance think she can quit that job and get more respectable job at long john silvers she is also the few the proud the lucky survive the igniting of a as well as her dog who narrowly survives there are some bright spots they tossed in enough old homages keep me laughing the best one is when jeff goldblum nicely named david turns on his computer and picture of hal comes up and says good morning dave and they even played e s it is the end of the world as we know it and feel fine at the beginning and judd hirsch steals the actually acting great he is stereotype but just loved the man anyway but there are no real subtle comic moments will gets way too many oneliners and he has no one play off of execept jeff towards the end and the two do great as said this has no balls it is just aiming for crowd pleaser and that is what it is but after couple months we all move on the next event while intaking little films and couple indy ones for good measure but at least the indy ones last for lifetime this ones short on batteries

trying satisfy every kind of viewer it is possible that sphere may end up pleasing no one action lovers will be bored what they will see as an interminably boring setup audience members who crave more intellectual fare will be disgusted the films sudden collapse into mindless storytelling and the ending is an insulting copout somewhere out there maybe there is small cadre of filmgoers who will appreciate spheres dubious charms but am not among them sincerely hope the novel is better than the movie no longer read anything either michael crichton or john grisham because if the finished motion picture product is anything go it is hard understand why the rights were optioned sphere is the kind of first class mess that only topline director an alist cast can create expectations high and how could they not be considering that another barry levinsondustin hoffman collaboration the excellent wag the dog is still playing in theaters something this bad cannot help but look even worse the last time bigname bigbudget displayed this level of ineptitude was last years batman robin and everyone knows how that movie was received sphere starts out little like an amalgamation of contact and james camerons the abyss but somewhere along the way it collapses into the cellar another recent science fiction effort event horizon science and philosophy are used good effect during spheres first hour give way mindless confusing action sequences attempts at characterization fall apart intelligent writing is evident early on is replaced hackneyed drivel special effects take over as the plotline devolves into incoherent silliness but all that is just in preparation for the ending is inexcusably awful this is the timehonored deus ex machina device used its worst effect left the theater feeling cheated the way crichton and his screenwriters had chosen end the there is some promise but it is all in the setup we are introduced norman goodman dustin hoffman psychologist who once wrote report for the government about what do in the event that crashed space ship is discovered when one is found in the middle of nowhere feet below the surface of the pacific ocean norman is called in be part of the welcoming committee on the team him are beth halperin sharon stone biochemist who was once his student and lover harry adams samuel jackson mathematician who earned his first doctorate at the age of ted fielding liev schreiber an astrophysicist who is awed the opportunity explore alien technology and harold barnes peter coyote the government operative in charge of the mission together the five descend into the bowels of the ocean where they rendezvous temporary sea base on the ocean floor from they will attempt make first contact for while sphere had me fooled into thinking it was going take an astute approach the manmeetsalien situation the overall scenario is not without promise and several plot twists such as the revelation that the enormous craft is actually an american space ship apparently from the future offer intriguing possibilities then right around the onehour mark that is the time sneak into the theater next door and check out whatevers left of titanic the virtually nonstop action begins and once it starts the script becomes superfluous this might be acceptable if director levinson generated some legitimate tension but instead he relies on loud overbearing music strange camera angles and quick cuts make things exciting additionally because none of the characters are wellformed common failing in anything penned crichton who is more interested in technology than people viewers do not develop much of rooting interest it makes sitting through sphere frustrating and pointless experience what about that alist cast not surprisingly the most energetic performance is given samuel jackson but his harry is not person he is walking plot device spouting occasionallywitty dialogue dustin hoffman is not lively or particularly good it is ironic that this may be his worst work in decade has arrived in theaters on the heels of his best actor nomination for wag the dog sharon stone and peter coyote are both flat their characters exhibit little evidence of emotion automatons would have been as effective then there is queen latifa who despite getting fifth billing in the credits ahead of liev schreiber who boasts at least quadruple her screen time has less than handful of lines and almost nothing do other than inflate the body count like think that levinson and hoffman recognizing how uninspired this movie was likely be chose make wag the dog as sort of penance the lowbudget picture was filmed during spheres lengthy preproduction phase if that is the case forgiveness is granted am less inclined look favorably upon crichton although he has few enjoyable titles on his resume jurassic park and the levinsondirected disclosure come mind even if his novel was butchered in the adaptation process crichtons credit as producer disallows him absolution he was willing participant in creative travesty no wonder sphere is being released in february in the midst of the early years cinematic wasteland it deserves no better than get sunk the unstoppable titanic should plow sphere under on its way ninthconsecutive weekend atop the box office heap

shakespeare in love is quite possibly the most enjoyable period piece ever made for the silver screen it is both humorous and romantic in very unique blend that can successfully entertain any audience for the nearly and and half hours that it occupies that is however not say it is good quality production or anything of the sort shakespeare in love is an incredibly cheap illusion that truly pans out be very little quality or original work the finest sign of this may be the plot in looking back there seems be little more than thin predictable plot that is only carried the portrayal of people that we revere in our history books philip henslowe geoffrey rush owns of the theatres in london it is at the peak of the royal theatre era and queen elizabeth the recently damed judi dench appropriately enough queen elizabeth ii is very much fan however directly quote the he has cash flow problems through long set of events it becomes apparent that his entire life is dependent on his next show doing well enough pay off his debts so mr henslowe employs the young playwright william shakespeare joseph fiennes pen comedic production however the young writer has severe case of writers block and blames it on the fact that his love life is struggling as well he has the title in mind romeo and ethel the pirates daughter even that joke loses steam after while but cannot seem put words paper then as only could have it through long set of twisted events he meets viola de lesseps gwyneth paltrow and falls madly in love thus curing his writers block there are many other little issues that mr henslowe encounters but they all pan out be much ado about nothing the first realization that reached in watching this is that one of the messages given is that show should not always be credited it is author ironically that could not be truer here the great scenes that will sweep audiences away are not the scenes that fit in the plot but rather the recitals of shakespearean lines actors playing actors one of the most breathtaking moments in this does not involve the character of shakespeare or queen elizabeth or even the theatre owner but rather young children named romeo and juliet who chose end their own lives in the name of love so it is that am offended the fact that marc norman and tom stoppard are credited writing this production and the name william shakespeare is no were be seen beyond characters name in the credits the acting in this entertaining yet poor is often thin the point that it would not have survived even in queen elizabeths theatres joseph fiennes may just be the worst of fall though he is tragically unbelievable and comically bad gwyneth paltrow is little more than satisfactory in her lead position as well however the supporting cast does almost save the day geoffrey rush is nothing short of incredible and judi dench is breathtaking they both seem have shown that as proven actors they could survive in this of weak links you will also find very good performance ben affleck in his first real role since good will hunting no armageddon does not qualify as real acting and rupert everett was cute in his small part as well but not even they could save this sad excuse for so it remains plagued poor performances when all is said and done shakespeare in love is only worth the trip if you want be entertained however as the so kindly pointed out entertainment may be fun but it is not necessarily quality and this certainly is not quality perhaps this may be best compared john grisham novel as dear friend of mine often does compare things his work simply put it is farfetched poorly crafted but very entertaining

at times you would think edtv would be an entertaining mean who can resist the story of your average joe becomming celebrity having his life filmed every minute of every day but this average joe ed perkuny matthew mcconaughay is sappy lifeless creation that wanders around trying solve everyones problems and settle his own mcconaughay is awful especially because he is trying pull off his usual charm week beard and torn jeans frankly he had more charm in the devestating flop the newton boys he overacts in every way his overexaggerant body language obsession kissing women every second he gets the chance and that cliched scene where he loses someone in his life and drops his knee and cries the rest of the cast is very good especially martin landau as eds stepfather who plays cute role as the closetodeath old guy that makes all the witty comments jenna elfman is good but little overemotional her main problem is that she keeps getting sucked into bad films e cannot hardly wait and krippendorfs tribe woody harrelson as eds brother ray does his usual eggheaded role his comic wit as well he wrote book entitled my brother pissed on me elizabeth hurley is perfectly cast as the easy slut and dennis hopper in quick cameo as eds biological father is nice choice ironically coming after the role he turned down as christof in the truman show ellen degeneres stood out as the executive who after awhile decides the show must not go on much the opposite of the head exec rob reiners opinion hate compare this the truman show but the fact is was ashamed see this movie it felt that had dropped from college kindergarten after seeing truman and ed edtv had no real wit or genius it was typical extracting the tv part of the movie you have the simple plotline man steals brothers girlfriend girlfriend leaves town man gets new slut girlfriend feel like he can move on slut breaks up him real girlfriend comes back and voila you have romance got so restless during this movie almost walked out the only reason it does not drop below c grade is because of the fine supporting performances adam almost lost my nose and like it like breathing through it jack nicholson chinatown

five years after his directorial debut based on stephen kings writings called the shawshank redemption writerdirector frank darabont returns the big screen another prison based on the famous scribblings of stephen king unlike the latter this one is big long laborious bore plot sevenfoot death row inmate is discovered have secret healing powers critique this is slow drawnout boring uninteresting unexciting predictable and topped couple of onedimensional evil characters its only positive attribute lies in its actors who all do credible jobs and its message of hope and belief in miracles the real miracle of my night was the fact that did not fall asleep during this straightforward unimpressive about guy special powers who we never truly understand or care about of course much like all other death row cell blocks this one is filled decent inmates who all happen be misunderstood except for one cookiecutter crazy guy who is evil personified and let us not forget all the guards on death row who also happen be angels from the heaven above except for one cookiecutter crazy guard who is also evil personified and is there any reason why there are about six guards when there appears be no more than three inmates am supposed identify anyone in this or even more importantly am supposed give rats ass about anyone in this well if was sure missed that boat because the only thing that ended up caring about during this entire picture was the obscene amount of fat that tom hanks has been able burrow under his loose chin furthermore there is absolutely no reason in the world why director frank darabont needed take three hours and ten minutes out of anyones life present this story in fact the story is empty within itself truly did not get anything out of the other than the fact that there is guy on death row who has special powers heal and we are left wondering if he should still be executed or not wow how interesting the plots utter predictability is also at fault here one guess as whom is get healed the gentle monster in this we are told that one certain lady has tumor early on in the movie whip out those thinking caps kids hmmm and wonder what will happen those two cookiecutter evil guys who have nothing in their system but hate and negativity hmmmm now think hard here boys and girls what crock am guessing that this was supposed be some threehour exercise in spirituality but unfortunately for me it was neither spiritual or the least bit engaging in fact it was one big bore did not see the point of the movie did not see the point of the story and certainly did not see the point in tom hanks big doublechin all in all bad movie starring some great actors doing solid work especially michael clarke duncan as the man of the hour john coffey give that man an award or something

synopsis small town thug convinces dimwitted highschool student spy on his girlfriend who is babysitting three unruly kids for their alcoholic parents on friday night while this is going on the thug the father the boyfriend and kid reaching the onset of puberty all have fantasies about the babysitter comments say this movie is bad would be quite an understatement am not sure what writer and director ferland was hoping accomplish the babysitter suspense family drama humor erotica elements of each of these genres exist in the yet it fails successfully achieve any of them instead the babysitter is dull lifeless movie manages bore and ultimately irritate its viewers suppose this could have been watchable if it were not for the fact that the characters are universally unappealing alicia silverstone is completely wasted playing jennifer the babysitter her character has absolutely no depth at all and her sole purpose in the movie is be the object of the other characters fantasies everyone else in the seems be in competition see who can stoop the lowest level the time the ends the parents are alcoholics who become increasingly obnoxious as the movie proceeds the father played t walsh fantasizes about the babysitter the mother fantasizes about her husbands best friend none of these fantasy sequences trust me are things that need be seen but we see them anyway complete cheesy makeout saxophone music the thug in the meantime proves that he is evil through his annoying habit of smashing halfempty beer bottles all of sudden and for no apparent reason the most absurd character however is the babysitters boyfriend who seems catatonically braindead the thug in manipulative iagolike manner though he does not really need try hard manages talk the boyfriend into bingedrinking smoking grass running away from cops and playing peeping tom on his own girlfriend in matter of minutes incredible of course the boyfriends original plan for the evening was try not laugh sit in an empty diner and read catcher in the rye d salinger if the goal of the babysitter was be suspenseful then it fails there are surprisingly few tense moments in this and nearly all of them come at the final minute that time however the audience is so tired of the inane characters that no one truthfully cares what happens any of them no suspense occurs in the dream sequences either because every single one of them is obviously dream sequence from its inception if the goal of the babysitter was be humorous then it also fails found nothing even remotely funny about the boozing parents who seemed at times be played for laughs if the goal of the babysitter was be dramatic then once again it fails the characters are onedimensional and uninteresting finally if the goal of the babysitter was be titillating the type of destined be played ad infinitum on hbo at in the morning then it fails as well the dream sequences are not erotic they are too brief and outside of one very short scene contain no nudity cannot completely trash this movie the first minutes or so vaguely resemble an interesting and the conclusion sports halfway decent fistfight the other minutes though are drag silverstones character at the end of the movie turns her boyfriend and asks what were you thinking asked myself the same question having spent cents renting this turkey

working in the motion picture industry must be constant source of frustration for frontline african american actress like jada pinkett smith despite being one of the freshest talents available pinkett smith has often been relegated playing thankless supporting parts low down dirty shame the nutty professor the problem is of course that there are not many good roles available for black women take away the likes of waiting exhale set it off soul food and eves bayou and all that is left is chance be someones girlfriend local whore or murder victim as result for pinkett smiths first opportunity atop the marquee she is stuck in stupid formulaic romantic comedy the unpromising title of woo actually woo the latest directorial effort from daisy s mayer party girl could have been worse than it is the offers few funny albeit juvenile moments and the onscreen relationship between pinkett smiths woo and tommy davidsons tim is appealing on those rare occasions when the two are not forced play it dumb for the sake of an endless barrage of cheap gags unfortunately huge portions of the movie are insulting the intelligence of anyone tripledigit q the situations are painfully contrived the main characters are lifted right out of sitcoms and the supporting players are so incredibly stupid that wondered whether they all participated in some kind of free lobotomy lab experiment woo is spontaneous energetic young woman who has been looking for love in all the wrong places her latest relationship testosteroneoverdosed drugdealer came an abrupt end when she refused wear beeper now her transvestitemedium friend celestrial girlina predicts that she is about meet mr right and that he will be virgo later that day woo is given an opportunity go out on blind date tim shy man penchant for neatness and order who just happens be virgo it is not love at first sight however things get off rocky start when tim makes an awkward pass and they get even worse when the pair arrives at swanky restaurant enjoy quiet dinner in the onehundred year history of motion pictures there have been ton of bad white movies about mismatched lovers so suppose it is only fair that we get black effort of the same low caliber as in all romantic comedies we know from the beginning that woo and tim are going end up together the question is are their courtship rituals entertaining in good entry the genre the audience becomes caught up in the love story no matter how familiar it is in woo the constant reliance upon unfunny moronic humor sinks the project for those who enjoy spotting continuity gaffes there is huge one in woo involving corvette broken window that miraculously repairs itself added that is the mystery of how the car looses its top sadly that is one of the films most enjoyable sequences and the entertainment value is entirely unintentional despite exuding charm from every pore there is little that pinkett smith and davidson can do save their characters or david johnsons script since it misses the mark so much better name for woo might have been whoops

there is scene early in jakob the liar that hints at how much better it could have been the scene is set in jewish ghetto in poland circa where onetime cafe proprietor named jakob heym is walking resolutely through the streets fists stuffed into coat pockets one side of him residents scavenge for food in the street the other side german troops beat group of jews jakob however never stops moving it is an efficient effective setup for the character who is clearly nobodys idea of hero at the outset he is man who has responded the horror of his surroundings withdrawing from them excising his moral peripheral vision the setup is critical because fate will turn jakob into reluctant savior after visit german commandants office and moment alone turnedon radio jakob learns that russian troops are quite near when he brings this first news of the war in years his fellow jews they become convinced that he must have radio is punishable offense in the ghetto the good news brings hope the ghetto the everyday specter of suicide vanishes private man of limited creativity finds himself burdened creating stories of russian military progress just keep his neighbors alive this promising story of an ordinary person doing the extraordinary is burdened from the outset casting the ordinary person in question jakob heym is played robin williams am of the depressing opinion that williams is growing less assured as an actor in his serious roles every passing year compare his dramatic scenes in the world according garp and moscow on the hudson what dreams may come or patch adams and see how much more mannered he has become or at the very least how much less sensible at choosing material jakob the liar depends on the notion that jakob has struggle craft his fictions but williams always looks like he is struggling _not_ craft them when he improvises radio address winston churchill for ailing yearold orphan lina hannah taylor gordon he seems relieved that he can finally get wacky oh yes and then there is that little girl some viewers will undoubtedly consider the heros fanciful stories for young charge too reminiscent of life is beautiful but those scenes are not problematic because they are familiar they are problematic because they are jarring and distracting introducing cutesy relationship into that should not have been about cutesy relationships jakobs character arc may be about his willingness act for the benefit of others but there are plenty of others without poor little lina every scene her feels contrived pulling jakob the liar away from its central story of hope coming previously hopeless people it is pleasant surprise find that jakob the liar is much grittier production than you might expect from hollywoodized holocaust combining the weighty subject matter dark humor in some effective ways director peter kassovitz working from jurek beckers novel crafts some nice scenes between jakob and the other townspeople and draws solid performances from armin muellerstahl as oncerevered doctor and bob balaban as barber drifting into depression there are just too many things going on that prove distracting whether it is the sketchy romanctic angle involving liev schreiber as an earnest former prizefighter or williams incongrous presence or sweet but utterly irrelevant little girl jakob the liar deals too delicate subject for such fumbling and has too compelling central character waste and after one wonderful early scene you can see the wasted and fumbled away

first troy beyer wrote the critically panned a s now she makes her directorial debut writing directing and starring in this subpar about women talking about sex though not without redeeming qualities this is bad the basic story follows three single friends jazz beyer lena randi ingerman and michelle paget brewster in their search for love jazz has an idea for local talk show it would feature women talking about sex and dating she and her friends make demo tape of interviews the women of miami the itself is sprinkled these real interviews throughout both as part of the plot and as commentary on the situations of the main characters the fact that they are real provides refreshing break from some of the more melodramatic moments in the there are several moments of bad acting corny dialogue and emotional overextension in lowbudget independent from firsttime director these faults can sometimes be forgiven if the screenplay is fresh and solid that is not the case here the script suffers from random plot developments there are four or five of these turns in the plot each one raising the question where did that come from at one point character has lifelong reconciliation her mother we are supposed be moved but since the scene is completely unledup we really do not care if she and her mother get along we have never seen her mother before we never see her again who cares what is worse these sudden developments are supposed engage our sympathy at another point character announces that she cannot have children apparently this is devastating we would not know this because she never talked about having kids before but we are nevertheless expected be devastated for her the scene feels like an afterthought its emotion manipulative and shallow these scenes grow worse and worse culminating in an absurd climax two scenes were played such overwhelming melodrama that found myself laughing one scene is lovers spat between two minor characters the other has the main characters expressing their copious grief cleaning house in wails of despair and clouds of ajax thinking on these scenes it is hard for me admit that the has redeeming qualities but it does first it is original we men often wonder what women talk about when they are alone in groups and imagine this gives me pretty good idea it is something do not think has been the subject of second the interviews of the miami women are sincere taken together they form mosaic picture of miami beachwalkers and bistro diners the mosaic is made of sound bites and stereotypes but each tile is some womans real experience neither the picture of women nor their picture of men is truly representative but the point is that both sets of generalizations are telling in their own way at some level the stereotypes that emerge can be called true can imagine some people liking this when its characters talk about their likes dislikes skills and thrills but on the whole it is pretty bad and that makes it even harder forgive the bad acting corny dialogue and emotional overextension will give beyer one more strike and then she is out rated almost got an nc for explicit sexual dialogue and nudity

susan grangers review of mulholland drive universal focus whatever david lynch is selling am not buying from the writerdirector of blue velvet and twin peaks comes another dark mysterious thriller that opens an automobile accident on mulholland drive the serpentine street that twists high in the hills dazed beautiful brunette laura elena harring emerges and stumbles down hill slipping unobserved into sstyle apartment as the tenant leaves for trip the next morning dewy blonde naomi watts from deep river ontario arrives in la dreams of stardom in her suitcase her aunt owns the apartment and the two women meet the brunette has amnesia so the blonde tries help her discover her identity along her latent lesbian lust meanwhile hotshot director justin theroux whose wife is in bed the poolman is forced cast certain actress in his new and there is an assassin mark pellegrino roaming the city the tortuous paths of these various characters and others named cookie coco and cowboy intersect at various points but the plot remains elusive because midway through the story lynch has the brunette and blonde play two different women in an alternate reality leaving huge wad of cash blue metallic key paralyzed mogul and lot of questions that go unanswered elena harring and particularly naomi watts are gifted actresses effectively making the subtle switch the same cannot be said for former g dancer ann miller who is stiff and selfconscious speaking like most lynch players in staccato tones on the granger movie gauge of mulholland drive is frenzied frustrating originally designed as an episodic tv pilot this surreal triumph of suspenseful style over substance is packaged as puzzle several of the key pieces left out

georges polti once wrote paper called the thirtysix dramatic situations in he asserted the fact that all drama could be defined no more than thirtysix different situations this may be the modern restatement of the biblical prophecy from ecclesiastes there is nothing new under the sun the faculty the latest movie from dusk till dawn director robert rodriguez certainly proves this in typical fashion there is not measureable fraction of original material in this unworthy outing drawing elements from both the puppet masters and invasion of the body snatchers screenwriter kevin williamson of scream credit gives us horror tale set in middle america ohio one eventful fall making use of cast of unusually stock characters williamson designs an alien invasion that will not be done independence daystyle but rather through the back door parasitic aliens take over the faculty of rundown high school and soon have infested most of the student body leaving it up the ensemble of principal characters win the day the lack of gusto is the movies major stumbling block even though the genre has seen movies that have lack for quality such as this they have been saved an energetic approach this casts more than shadow of doubt on williamsons ability who enjoyed success the wes cravendirected scream but could not pull anything solid in for this outing or know what you did last summer although he designs the faculty more of scifi bent than his typical slasher picture it still comes down the same results throw the stock characters in steel cage match and see who comes out alive on that level the main roles are played virtual unknowns only the recognizeable elijah wood deep impact is at the front other than that the screen veterans are saved for the minor roles of the alien teachers perhaps williamson has it in mind champion these upandcomers the fame that their scream and last summer counterparts achieved but do that they would all need star in their own wb television show about the horrors of puberty la dawsons creek needless say the acting is far from top notch nor does necessity ask that it should be there is moment or two of genuine horror but unfortunately williamson and rodriguez did not take the story far enough in the scifi direction make any use of it in sum the faculty was just one long shot that did not pay off

the most popular trend of the last couple of years has been the twist ending watching one of these movies everything seems make sense until suddenly you are blown away an unexpected surprise when the ends there is moment of confusion then recollection then some more confusion then possibly second viewing for clarification this is description of an ideal twist that perfects everything it sets out do and more good surprises make movies fun watch then there are the bad twists you either know what is going happen ten minutes into the movie am talking about you reindeer games or you did not guess the ending because it is so outrageously stupid screwed perfectly suits the latter description what starts out as dumb guilty pleasure should be fun mock group of friends ends complex finale way too much going on the writers of man on the moon and the people vs larry flynt scott alexander and larry karaszewski leave milos forman behind and take stab at directing whoops screwed is an inane christmas carol gone berserk few genuine laughs and many acting embarrassments norm macdonald stars as willard filmore hard working chauffeur who just wants little respect from his rich old insidious boss miss crock elaine stritch when he overhears her plans fire him on christmas day willard is convinced his best friend rusty dave chapelle kidnap crocks beloved dog and hold it for ransom of one million dollars too excited pay any attention the hapless losers plan goes awry when the dog escapes and returns home now crock thinks willard has been kidnapped and the two friends realizing they can make even more money decide stage the fake kidnapping of course everything that could go wrong does the first fortyfive minutes of screwed is harmless entertainment guilty pleasure that should be enjoyably bad but the convoluted script eventually builds into disaster that is impossible bear the more idiotic these characters get the more reckless the script becomes at one point wanted get out of my seat and yell at these characters no you idiot am not just talking about willard and rusty who were extremely annoying am also talking about the cops in this monkey could have solved this case within an hour but these guys headed murder ones daniel benzali were just too clueless forgive they give real cops bad names also poor danny devito apparently does not know how turn down role these days looking almost identical his penguin in batman returns every time he appeared on the screen had shake my head in disbelief he just did not belong in this movie macdonald and chapelle are veterans at these kinds of movies but devito made the much worse than it already was gross out humor is certainly not his forte if you are fan of norm macdonalds other chaotic comedy dirty work you might actually love this nearsequel otherwise do not get screwed out of your hardearned money

spice world is just one long promotional for the british girl band the spice girls sure there is hint of humor in there every once in while actually there is couple of pretty good jabs at the spice girls but overall who cares not me if you do not know now the spice girls sing songs of love and friendship and responsibility and girl power yet dress like streetwalkers from lower middle class neighborhood in spice world they ride around in their big tour bus whining about having do photo shoots and give interviews amazingly all the talk they do about keeping commitments and upholding responsibilities only really applies fun things things they want do not things they are required do keep earning money and they keep babbling about girl power when they should really be talking about cleavage power mean if all it takes is girl power then why are they only one thread away from bursting out of their skimpy outfits the is pg but really only some very minor dialogue changes and scene extentions you would have yourself one raunchy adult the way there is something in the opening credits says based on an idea the spice girls wow they got idea credit certainly wish that was new trend in giving credit for simply having the thought say girls let us make movie the supporting cast fares well roger moore the real james bond mockingly plays the clichespewing chief of the spice girls and darn it all he is fun watch mark mckenney also is good as screenwriter trying pitch ideas the bands manager richard grant one question though george wendt you would think that spice world would envoke one of two reactions in people if you like the spice girls you will like them even more afterwards and if you cannot stand them like me then spice world will really make you sick oddly the audience saw the roughly twelve yearold girls sat in silence for the entire well not the two who sat directly behind me they kept muttering this is stupid over and over again maybe there is hope for humanity after all pg

i read the new yorker magazine and enjoy some of their really indepth articles about some incident they will take some incident like the investigation of mysterious plane crash and tell you what happened in detail it becomes real education in what agencies get involved and how theories are suggested and what kind of pressure the investigators are under and just about any other aspect you can think of frequently get the feeling that the article sounded exciting but am being told in more detail than really wanted know often get the middle of story and say ok it sounded good but now have invested more time than am willing spend on this subject is different medium it is visual medium that slows down the telling of stories much more than people realize frequently am surprised find out how short script is and how much of the pages are empty space the magazine article and the script are two very different media the insider is adaptation of the vanity fair article the man who knew too much marie brenner it is too much an adaptation of magazine article slowed the pace of it really verges on being tedious at least at times for years the seven big companies knew that they dealt in an addictive drug that caused host of unhealthy sideeffects but they pretended for the public that it was unproven and they did not really believe it the business was incredibly profitable and the proceeds translated into the political power squelch and discredit any political movements against big tobacco the tide turned when former vicepresident of one of the companies was convinced the cbs minutes news team tell the public how much the tobacco companies really knew about the health effects of smoking the resulting pressure stop the story created small civil war at cbs who were the major people involved what were their motives how was the story almost killed how did it get aired anyway that is the story covered in surprising detail the insider this all could have been enthralling but it is not the sort of thing that stylist like michael mann would be likely do well and in the end he failed make long story short the needed director who knew how make long story short the opens the cbs minutes team in iran the assignment interview terrorist we get taste for their personal style and how they get the upper hand they go from being one newsman blindfolded at the hands of the terrorists the actual interview mike wallace played christopher plummer there the news team under producer lowell bergman al pacino are ordering around the terrorists and getting away it this seems have nothing do the main line of the story but later when the tobacco industry is so much harder manipulate than committed terrorists we have wry irony on who really has clout in the world terrorists can grab the headlines but the tobacco companies have the real position of power incongruously intercut the iran interview sequence we see jeffrey wigand russell crowe dejectedly returning from work his home we discover that he has been fired and his career brought complete halt unexpectedly he had been very profitably rewarded vicepresident in charge or research and development at brown and williams tobacco now he was unemployed and needed money support his family rather than support him his wife liane diane venora demands of him what are they supposed do for income meanwhile the minutes team trying do story on fires started cigarettes have obtained some data they do not understand they offer wigand just interpret the data wigands severance agreement swears him secrecy about anything he knows about tobacco dealings but he is reluctantly he stretches the severance terms he is willing read some documents from another tobacco company and interpret them for bergman in spite of the secrecy wigands former employers seem immediately know wigand is talking minutes and he is warned off former boss thomas sandefur played michael gambon in an all too brief but deliciously sinister role and so the game begins wigand is irate at his negative treatment for what he still considered continued be loyalty his agreement and his former employer meanwhile someone is playing very rough wigand and his family the examines wigand and the pressures placed on his family as they are caught between two powerful giants wigand has always wanted make tobacco safer and has natural sympathies getting the story out he and his family are assaulted psychologically and financially the giant tobacco industry that had never lost legal fight al pacino is given top billing but the wigand family is the core of the insider the story is told slowly and in just bit too much meticulous detail the is minutes and is an extremely demanding for the audience the musical score pieter bourke lisa gerrard and graeme revell is one of the worst in recent memory it puts ominous chords under some scenes and using voice in ways that become distraction that gets in the way of the storytelling also disturbing is the casting of christopher plummer as mike wallace plummer and wallace are such different types and wallace is too wellknown for even so good an actor as plummer play him convincingly this might have been really engaging experience under another directors control michael mann was the wrong person helm this and the insider lacks intensity because of his style rate it on the scale and on the scale

i should have known damn it should have known ewan mcgregor codename eye is pointing hightech riflely gadget at fat bald businessoriented american engaging in illicit sexual activities in window across the street we get the requisite electrogreen throughthesight view we the audience seeing high tech riflely gadget of course think that eye is going assassinate the target but instead he pulls the trigger and the rifle takes twenty or so hazy lowquality photographs eye then proceeds fax and email everyone in his targets office all right so thirty seconds in was slightly befuddled this seemingly pointless riflecamera but was still open minded maybe there is really good reason for it have got reason believe you see admire lot of ewan mcgregors previous work and he is obi wan ke frigginnobi for gods sake and director stephan elliots last movie priscilla queen of the desert was quirky little delight there is some genuine talent involved here think at the twenty minute mark there was still spark of hope in my heart eye has been assigned investigate the leader of his organizations son still have no idea what this organization was british intelligence national spy ring private investigation who is apparently stealing from his trust fund he has received his assignment from d lang through an elaborate and expensive teleconferencing briefcase when eye tracks his target an expensive looking secluded house he witnesses mysterious and beautiful woman ashley judd take knife out and proceed stab the poor bastard ok that is odd think myself this could be interesting then she starts cry and through her tears exclaims merry christmas dad for the first time so begins our tale of obsession or something the rest of the movie involves ewan mcgregors eye character following ashley judd around every corner of the united states totally and completely obsessed this woman from afar throughout his entire professional life he has been voyeur so when he falls for someone the only way he can handle it is watch and drool through telescopes and cameras fine that is lovely premise suppose but gosh darn it if you are going go there you better have some sort of explanation and that is precisely where this fails this is the kind of movie that pisses me off it is an abortion collection of halfformed and wasted ideas that amounts absolutely nothing in the end it pretends it is something that it is not surreal and deep psychological character study wrapped in hightech thriller here the filmmakers have confused surreal and deep vaguely unclear and crammed full of insultingly obvious metaphors never even for an instant had the foggiest idea why eye would fall so in love this woman who changes wigs and kills people the movie offers only two explanations neither of make lick of sense explanation number one the obnoxious presence of eyes imaginary daughter who was taken away from him his wife some time ago tells him he should not leave ms judd explanation two the end of the has been beaten into our heads through imagery and dialog and even the title of the movie beauty is in the eye of the beholder whoo hoo that helps thanks bunch case closed that is as deep as it gets folks there is an attempt at an explanation in the final minutes instead of tying everything together ends up being as profound as clever sixthgrade mad lib there are secondary characters that move in and out of the picture and serve little or no purpose except make the audience wonder what the hell the point was my personal favorites include the prisonmatron modeled after austin powers frau farbissina who apparently taught ms judd everything she knows about wearing wigs jason priestleys awfully played dirty desert vagrant who tries emulate dennis hopper la blue velvet but fails miserably and the copwhoseesashleyfleeinganaccidentsceneand thenwantstopayforsex butisshot each one in this sad little parade is little more pointless than the last the script pays no attention the laws of time and space any time one of the frequent location changes occurs the camera zooms in on souvenir snow globe and minutes weeks or years could have passed bewilderingly inane stylistic decisions plague the whole affair one character passes glass of cognac another in slowmotion closeup awash in lot of bass ewan mcgregor at one point takes up residence in bell tower just so he could be repeatedly awakened and deafened the giant bell jason priestly starts philosophizing about sharks then laughs maniacally cut random guy eye patch iguana out of focus iguana comes into focus wow man when found out afterward that this was based on novel it came as no surprise me there are plenty of elements here that if extended and fleshed out more would have made for decent story and would not be surprised if found out there was an hour and half of footage cut from this movie lying in landfill somewhere or waiting in the wings for the dvd special directors cut not that anything would ever possess me purchase such thing find out what was missing the last ten or so minutes featured conversation between the eye and the judd that was supposed be some sort of revealing exposition some guy in the back of the theater was talking on his cell phone and this time did not particularly care all that much because what was happening on the screen was steaming pile of unholy crap the audience around me chuckled and whispered sentiments similar what was thinking someone near cellphoneguy did eventually yell shut the hell up but it was lot funnier when we thought he was talking the screen

as bad as mimic was it definitly scared me mimic continued the frightening trend of taking foreign director who shows lot of creative ingenuity and style and completely flushing it when he comes america make movie director guillermo del toro was recently imported from mexico after he made the award winning and inventive horror cronos that movie worked because it took an unconventional story unique characters and well written plot and dialogue create truly scary movie in mimic del toro does not bother give us anything original the plot is stupid combination of aliens meets species meets jurassic park the characters have been recycled from few hundred other movies there is nothing new in mimic it is just bunch of old tricks that rarely work at the end of the movie you are stuck wanting your money back maybe the worst thing about the movie is that del toro followed another annoying trend of recent movies he forgot turn the lights on do not understand why suspense movies lately have follow the seven trend and be set in dark dank areas watching mimic was tempted several times yell at the screen turn the lights on the switch is your right use common sense just do it you will be able see the monster in the corner there is scene where mira sorvino is standing in subway station while the lights are flickering on and off it looked like the light operator was having seizure and sorvino did not even notice she just stood there looking like she was having deep thoughts hmmm think bean soup would be good for dinner tonight mimic has lot of incidental shock tactics boo just kidding and follows them up the real scare but nothing in this movie scares you the audience in the theater never jumped during suspenseful moments think they were bored too should not blame del toro he is not the first successful foreign director come and make bad movie hong kong director john woo made two of the best action films of all time the killer and hard boiled then came america make the stupid broken arrow french directors luc besson la femme nikita and george sluizer the vanishing followed woos lead and made dumbed down versions of those movies robert rodriguez who directed the terrific low budget el mariachi came and directed the horrible highbudget desperado do not know why foreign director who shows such talent in his country cannot make good american movie woo finally broke through and made faceoff but it still is not up par his earlier films get the feeling producer sits in his office chews on big smelly cigar and says the director welcome america bet you must be tired after being on that boat for so long do you speak english now know you think you have made good movies in the past but now you are in america so things are little different here just remember what the american audience always wants and you will be fine they want see at least one big breasted woman characters that they have seen thousand times before because change scares americans and you always need cheesy feelgood ending wrap things up if you do not make that kind of movie you will be shining my shoes in no time

darren jason biggs wayne steve zahn and d jack black have been best friends since the fifth grade like the three musketeers they have been together through thick and thin but when darren meets an attractive but coldblooded and manipulative psychiatrist judith amanda peet the long time friendship is placed in danger it is up wayne and d rescue their best friend in saving silverman silverman has its heart in the right place but the story newcomers hank nelken and greg depaul is too lightweight sustain the tale of the battle for darrens soul based on their experience of friend making major marital mistake the story is centered on the three life long amigos when wayne introduces darren judith he does not realize that he has opened pandoras box of disaster for himself and d judith was once in relationship where her boyfriend was the dominant figure until he died in kick boxing match since then she has sought new mate someone she can boss around and mold into her own vision enter darren silverman once they realize the magnitude of their error in judgement wayne and d try everything they can including threats and bribery get judith free darren nothing works until the duo come up plan kidnap judith and get darren back together the girl he called his one and only pretty sandy perkus amanda detmer the only problem here is that sandy is about take her vows become nun things spiral out of control as judith repeatedly attempts escape while wayne and d play cupid the boys even bring their idol neil diamond into the picture help resolve things thinking about it this is real mishmash of contrivance and coincidence that is held together solely the comedic efforts of steve zahn and jack black the pair is able elicit the films only laughs their goofy antics and childlike behavior they are relegated providing slapstick guy humor and the two are more than equal the task steve zahn has been steadily honing his comedic acting skills and gives some complexity wayne the brains of the gang jack black has the bigguy moves of chris farley giving d an amusing physical presence the neat thing is that the two actors are able get fresh laughs from stale material the rest of the cast does not fare as well though jason biggs is the straight man of the musketeers and gets very little do though having watched his previous films american pie and loser am not sure what attraction biggs actually has amanda peet is caustic as the manipulative judith there is no humanity at all her character as she singlemindedly strives recreate darren into her minds image she is monster that wayne and d must defeat save their friend unfortunately there is no dimension her character amanda detmer brings nothing or gets nothing as darrens one and only lee ermey as the psychotic coach made bad decision taking this role tunemeister neil diamond gives goodnatured cameo perf as the boys idol and savior production values are on par the rest of the lackluster and noninvolving director dennis dugan has track record for broad comedy films like big daddy and beverly hills ninja but falls flat saving silverman the movie year has yet provide us good sink our teeth into at least saving silverman we get couple of funny perfs from zahn and black too bad that the rest of the lacks their level of humor kick boxing deaths and conflicted nuns are not the makings of good comedy give it c

an intimate characterdriven drama about troubled youth at crossroads in his life read the press notes for _reach_the_rock_ am not really sure what that statement is describing because those words bear little resemblance the slow completely uninvolving bore sawat least it certainly does not describe what goes on for most of the alessandro nivola plays robin fleming troubled directionless yearold who has penchant for breaking storefront windows in small town police sergeant phil quinn william sadler takes him in and what ensues for the first minutes is tedious series of sneakouts and sneakins where robin slips out of his jail cell breaks window then returns all without quinn ever noticing also added the pointless proceedings is some wouldbe humorous shenanigans involving quinns dimwitted deputy ernie attempting engage in clandestine patrol car sex his girlfriend donna karen sillas half hour if even that long remaining director william ryan and writer john hughes yes john hughes of youth films and _home_alone_ finally approach something close point turns out robin still pines for his high school sweetheart lise brooke langton who has long gone on her life and hughess main concern at long last reveals itself as tired live in the present and for the future message most moviegoers however will likely be asleep that time wide awake however is the cast who individually tackle their showcase dramatic scenes energy and skillthus revealing the _real_ purpose behind this listless enterprise serve as series of acting exercises such glorified workshop may have its rewards for the actors but it leaves audiences booby prize opens october

vampires is rude chauvinistic movie where women are portrayed as pawns of abuse present only pleasure men feed vampires readied be bashed or beaten till ones sensibilities is shocked the low iq and mentality of this regressive movie make matters worse the buffoons that go hunting vampires are all rednecks and deserve have their heads bitten off if not their bodies carved in half the dilemma of hating the heroes as much as the villains makes one wish that the hand of god would suddenly appear and blast both parties into oblivion james wood portrays jack crow man obsessed killing vampires whose soul reason for living is based on revenge they killed his parents but this is not good excuse for being more obnoxious than the vampires as for adam baldwin he is nothing more than stooge who is ordered beat women when the director shouts action and the script should have been reworked avoid much offence against the female sex as for the claims that the catholic church created dracula well that is the second most sacrilegious suggestion outside the fact that priests and monks bear the brunt of the vampire fury enough blood spilt make the inquisition look tame an awful movie on all counts my suggestion is bring back buffy and bury this group of incompetent rude vampire slayers

synopsis blond criminal psychologist sarah chooses copulate greasy tony the mysterious puerto rican rather than bearded cliff the wisecracking neighbor upstairs in the meantime someone sends sarah rotting flowers puts her name in the newspapers obituary column and kills her cat comments never talk strangers colossal waste of time moves slower than molasses in winter arrive at conclusion should be obvious the audience minutes into the one would not think that two genuine movie stars antonio banderas evita and rebecca de mornay hand that rocks the cradle and the acerbic comic genius dennis miller saturday night live would be involved in such celluloid backfire as this turkey not only are they in it however but de mornay executive produced it what was she thinking never talk strangers centers upon sarah psychologist examining the illtempered max murderer soon stand trial she receives sudden visit from her father elicits flashbacks of some tragedy in her early childhood two men woo her tony the security consultant wins her over so they have passionate sex replete cheesy saxophone music lot of psychobabble is thrown around about multiple personality disorder but the movie asks its audience not derive the obvious conclusion between mpd and sarah and instead offers several male characters as red herrings minutes the running time of this cinematic mess thus seem like hours good chunk of never talk strangers is spent upon sarah and tony why would the careerminded professional sarah feel attracted the walking steroid black hat called tony that is one of the films mysteries are never answered regardless of motive de mornay and banderas strip down and have sex several times in what passes for eroticism they also manage go out before copulating occasionally in one of the stupidest scenes of the tony takes sarah carnival that is right outside his dingy apartment that way they can hurry back and have sex quickly also apparently the weather changes quickly in their locale they are at this outdoor carnival one day before having sex the next day they are out playing in the snow before having sex the filmmakers attempt produce suspenseful plot interspersed tony and sarahs character development someone is out get poor sarah though most of the audience should have figured out who before any of this starts rotting flowers writeup in the obituary and beaten neighbor are just few of the bad things happen her suspense cliche number one also occurs whenever someone is stalked in thrillers any means if the stalked has pet that pet will die oftentimes even further the cliche the murdered pet is cat suspense filmmakers for some reason just do not like cats sarah in never talk strangers receives package and lo and behold discovers her mutilated cat within suspense at its very derivative as stated before never talk strangers is poor excuse for whose sole purpose seems be exploiting banderas and de mornays bodies as often as possible comedian dennis miller is completely wasted here he is not given lines that are suitable for his persona and does not even appear all that much maybe in way he is lucky for that early on in the movie sarah tells tony after meeting him in supermarket that she had been advised never talk strangers allow me advise that you never watch this stinker

a sensuous romantic comedy about as appealing as your average lightweight tv sitcom there is no special ingredient on the menu for what is dished out its the kind of stuff have seen before and was made nauseous its silly idea of love and what it thinks is funny the plans exploit the beauty and sweetness of its delicious star pen lope cruz who plays brazilian chef magical touch for bringing out the spices in her preparations the aromas just sensually waft from her cooking pot but who cannot get on looks alone in this transparently predictable story pen lope was wonderful in pedro almod vars all about my mother but here she is so visible in such stale story where she can only smile and tease the audience having us see constant barrage of cleavage shots as she bends when cooking that she somehow looks ridiculous as if she got egg all over her face the best you can say about her is that she is not blame for this picture being so off this exploitation of sex without even delivering nudity or sex is in my opinion worst than raunchy that delivers what it says it will the story is all about the love motion sickness and cooking ability of isabella cruz who is born in bahia brazil and learns cook at an early age from her parents cook cure her motion sickness her parents tried every remedy until they went spiritualist who prayed the goddess of the sea for her cure she is able control it now as long as she does not drive car ride elevators follow in dancing and is the woman on top when making love in other words she has be in control of things in her small fishing town she falls in love handsome macho latin waiter toninho oliveira murilo ben cio and marries him they open up successful restaurant where she slaves away in the kitchen but he gets all the credit for it even though he is loafer one night she catches him in bed another girl and decides leave for san francisco we do not see her in flight so cannot tell how she handled her motion sickness problem unless she flew the plane she visits her friends apartment monica harold perrineau jr who is crossdresser blending right into the san francisco scene cast away her love for the irresistible toninho she calls her
