spiritualist friend and gets her cast an irreversible spell freeing her from ever loving him again her luck changes when local tv producer cliff mark feurerstein gets whiff of her cooking and storms into her cooking class as if were in spell and presents her her own live tv cooking show you can really write the script from here on yourself as the despondent toninho begins realize what good thing he had but things continue go bad for him there is curse he caused on the fishing in his village there is no chef replace his wife as the restaurant is about close for good so he comes san francisco figuring he can charm her again he brings along him his guitar playing musicians the ones he used when courting her when he serenaded her under her window he sees his wife on tv monica as her sidekick the yuppie tv producer chasing after her and sees that she is no longer charmed him when he sneaks on her tv show set and tries woo her his musical group and him singing corny love songs her the ratings go up and he is hired as regular on the show the show gets so big that the network honchos come onboard taking it national but they want change the ethnic flavor of the show get rid of monica because he is freak have isabella cook tabasco instead of the brazilian peppers she uses and they change her ethnic dresses lowcut vanna white type of sexy dresses cliff her wouldbe boyfriend acts creepy and sides the network bigshots even though he loved everything she did these tv scenes were not only bad stereotype scenes of tv honchos they were revolting it was an insult ones intelligence am sure that am not spoiling the ending for anyone when tell you that toninho reforms his macho ways and together they cook up meal that breaks her spell of loving him again if the was not terrible enough monica and cliff act on their attraction for each other and become lovers it was so awkwardly done that it had no sense of truth or humor it this might as well have been made the same network guys featured in this because it does not look or feel like an almod var the type of it aspired be but more like that was interferred from above its more like futile commercial that is more annoying than charming and more dull than chic as it searches for box office heaven

let me just start this review off saying am huge fan of professional wrestling and have been for fifteen years am not too fond of ted turners world championship wrestling however and am even less fond of it now after seeing this ridiculous excuse for wrestling movie tonight the plot concerns two losers named gordie boggs david arquette aptly cast as neandrathal and sean dawkins scott caan who are so obsessed professional wrestling that they believe everything they see on wcw monday nitro is something more than flashy show when they finally get see their hero wcw world champion jimmy king played oliver platt personally would have gotten wrestler play king he ends up getting screwed over evil promoter titus sinclair wasted palitaliano in role originally meant for reallife wcw president eric bischoff before he was fired and rehired six months later and if anyone reads this who knows bischoff they will agree me that the role of sinclair had his name written all over it they embark on quest find him and help him get his title back when they find him they discover in horror that jimmy kings real life is nothing like it is on wcw tv king is drunken atlanta native rather than an english king after convincing king that they do not care that his persona is not real gordie and sean sneak him back onto wcw monday nitro after sinclair agrees book him in main event steel cage match for the wcw title and his job back in las vegas at wcws payperview gee whiz there are so many things wrong this movie do not know where begin yes do the characters of gordie and sean show you what eric bischoff wcw president who thought up this project thinks of wrestling fans he thinks of us as idiots who take everything wrestlers do seriously he actually thinks wrestling fans are dumb enough believe this is meant be taken seriously got news for you eric nobody above the age of four is dumb enough for that this is you know not know he will probably cover arguments up saying it is not meant be taken seriously but it is because that is how big an ego bischoff has there was documentary made in wrestling shadows that documented the owner of the world wrestling federation vince mcmahons screwing bret the hitman hart out of the title this movies storyline is basically comic ripoff of that plot the poor mans wayne and garth thrown in eric bischoff is trying make vince mcmahon look bad the character of titus sinclair but any wrestling fan knows titus is more like bischoff than mcmahon and that vince did what he had do bret hart the movies main wrestler jimmy king has an english king gimmick and the audience cheered big for him no wrestling fan actually enjoys characters like that in this day and age we want bad asses today why make this comedy instead of an emotional rockystyle drama know wrestling is not sport but you can still get behind guy who struggles as wrestler and finally makes it in the end in the movie gordie starts up an illfated romance nitro girl sasha the lovely rose mcgowan what she sees in that freak marilyn manson will never understand only find that she has hospitalized kings trainer for sinclair would not it have been easier just have them fall in love instead of doing the typical spygirlforthebadguy cliche hate that last but certainly not least there was not one single moment in this movie that could not predict would happen nor did laugh once either the world wrestling federation should have been the wrestling company make the movie for these reasons they are the better promotion they have better and younger talent performers and wrestlers they give their fans what they want and do not treat them like idiots they are winning the ratings and they are the promotion everybody cares about simply put they could make movie hundred times better and they could do wrestling movie the right way the only good thing about this movie was they played outtakes at the end and if spoiled it for you good saved you from wasting seven dollars

battlefield long boring and just plain stupid battlefield earth review michael redman copyright michael redman in my midteen years had horrendous reoccurring nightmare behind the wheel of car was driving down straight road in the middle of desert no scenery except the horizon line and the converging parallel lines of the highway no matter what did the view did not change travelling but not getting anywhere each time awoke in sweat terrified you do not have be carl jung understand that dream powerless make changes trapped in boring situation no hope of rescue this is the stuff of nightmares whether we are asleep or awake this is exactly how you will feel minutes after battlefield earth begins for all of its flash and style ron hubbards science fiction epic is the earliest and best entry for the dullest summer of dull and stupid in the year the psychlo aliens have ruled our planet for years humans either work as slave labor in mining operations or live as barbarians there is no hope the future is bleak then the psychlo make mistake and capture feisty jonnie goodboy tyler barry pepper who organizes revolution against chief of security terl john travolta and the alien race it is an archetypal postapocalyptic plot full of promise considering some of the talent involved and all the millions thrown at the screen it is difficult see how it could have failed so miserably but it does the story is so full of holes that it falls apart within minutes of the opening credits are we really supposed believe that after millennium of looking for gold the psychlo never discovered fort knox or that fighter planes are still in pristine condition after all that time and gassed up or that the cavemen become such expert pilots in seven days that they can easily down the advanced alien ships or that the psychlo spy cameras somehow do not notice that their slaves are missing for days travolta prances across the screen hamming it up for all he is worth and is almost entertaining almost the rest of the actors are wooden mannequins trying not laugh while delivering lines that no person mananimal or not would ever utter some of the _looks_ good but it also looks so familiar race of large hulking apelike creatures has taken over the world while our cities lie in ruin sound like something charlton heston might be in the psychlo look like overweight klingons in gear from dune the final air battle between the air force fighters and the psychlo ships in their hightech city is something george lucas might have been associated it is too loud it is too oppressive it is too slow it is too long far too long and on it goes the list of the problems battlefield earth is endless it is difficult find anything in the that does work oh yeah the color scheme is nice the real question is how this movie ever got made could it have something do the fact that ron hubbard was the founder of scientology and that john travolta is member of the church that might explain why travolta bought the rights the novel years ago but it does not give us clue as why firsttime screenwriter corey mandells atrocious script was used or why the highprofile project was entrusted roger christian who had never before directed major or why no one looked at this thing before it was released and realized there might be problems the one bright spot is that no longer will kevin costners the postman begrudgingly admit as guilty pleasure be the big budget science fiction failure battlefield earth has the honor sewed up often reviewers will recommend that you skip mediocre films and wait for the video that is not the case here you can act now and make the decision not see it on the big screen or on the small one do not hesitate strike now while the iron is cold

hey have got great idea for movie ok here it is we will get tim allen pull angry faces for about two hours or so what is that sounds too boring ok how about this then we still have tim allen pull faces for about two hours but half of them are angry looks and half of them are am in pain looks what is that that still does not sound funny you how about if we through in some ewwwww looks still not funny if you answered no that does not sound funny then ding ding ding you are absolutely correct for richer or poorer is moronic farce about rich married couple played tim allen and kirstie alley who seek refuge in an amish community after their bumbling accountant wayne knight best know as newman on tvs seinfeld gets them in trouble for tax evasion what ensues is badly scripted and horribly directed minutes of cinema hell what makes this all wrong is that nobody seems have what the needs namely talent backing up the married couple is brad and caroline sexton allen and alley popular snobby duo who seem totally in love everyone else but in reality are on the brink of divorce just as their marriage seems be hanging from it is final thread brad discovers that his accountant bob lachman knight has been engaging in illegitimate deals in the sextons names the irs catches on but since everything points back the sextons and not lachman there is nothing much do except run away and join an amish community first time screenwriters jana howington and steve lukanic give us couple of chuckleoutloud moments and even some decent laughs here and way over there but there is so much cringe at in this horribly made that you will likely miss the laughs while regurgitating popcorn alley is absolutely unwatchable and the chemistry between her and allen is about as believable as my chemistry homework from tenth grade inform you was total s allen and alley are in no way convincing as tycoons nor are they very convincing as an amish couple this entire movie is one bad illconceived notion that should have been curtailed from the very beginning the amish in this movie are also flimsy and unconvincing it is such trite stereotypical script that imagine the actors that were cast noticing that they are all predominantly tv figures were probably the only ones they could get bryan spicers directing does not help one bit either in fact listing spicers filmography includes the first power rangers movie and the big screen adaption of mchales navy is more of an insult than r sum now that have pretty much run for richer or poorer into the ground will let you in on the best thing about it it bumped seven films up notch on my worst of movie list that is right thanks this ranking at number for the years worst six films are now not seemingly as bad and smile like yours previously inhabiting the number ten spot now does not have suffer the ridicule of making my bottom ten list if you look at it in that respect for richer or poorer will end up making someone happy after all

even the best comic actor is at the mercy of his or her material as this subpar submarine comedy proves down periscope stars kelsey frasier grammer as an inept navy captain who is given command of his own ship as part of corrupt officers james coburn plan get him out of the navy like any lame emsemble comedy the officer assigns him group of misfits like the guy who wants be kicked out the fat guy who eats all the time the beautiful woman who does not belong there lauren holly the secondincommand who does everything the book rob schneider the crazy old guy who freaks everyone out harry dean stanton and so on then comes the transparent plotline first grammer has fix up the delapidated korean war ship the navy has given him and that comes courtesy sad sight gag montage that includes guy mop knocking schneider overboard after the ship is fixed up come the early drills where everyone seems completely inept like the electrician who cannot connect wires so instead lets the current run through himself every time grammer gets on the phone finally and this covers the final hour of the movie grammer has lead his men and holly overcome the other ships in wargames exercise and he has be clever rebel do it in scenes that stretch all levels of believability first they are singing louie louie like bunch of drunk sailors throw the radar of the other ship off then thirty minutes later they are making whale mating noises throw the radar of the other ship off the whole while evil captain coburn is overacting underwater cursing grammer as most people watching the movie probably are too it is all predictable without any original humor redeem it the jokes are right out of mchales navy and other cutrate sitcoms of the past there is one scene where schneider looks through the ships pantry in disgust holds one food can up and announces this expired in yelled back at the screen so did these jokes watched this movie the whole family and everyone hated it my mom was so bored she brought out the coupon book midway through and around the start of the second hour started writing my will the blame cannot really be placed on the stars though kelsey grammer is good in this he just does not have anything work his character is said have gotten so drunk one night that he had welcome aboard tatooed on his penis grammer probably did something even worse got really drunk and agreed appear in movie he knew nothing about same for holley save the penis part who is likeable in down periscope just because she is so gorgeous as for schneider whose character is downright annoying there was nowhere go but up after surf ninjas although he is still in the depths of the comedy ocean after jumping the snl ship my theory is that down periscope is one of those movies that got the green light before the script was even written as formula comedy okay it is police academy in the navy frasier at the helm and the chick from dumb and dumber and after everyone was signed on turned into disaster judging from the video box most other movie critics agree me the only quote the down periscope copy writers could dig up came from the prevue channels jim ferguson guess even jeff craig from second preview who said tank girl kicks butt without ever seeing it did not like this

movies do not come much more ridiculously titled than still know what you did last summer but since the movie in question is best described as ridiculous the title sort of works as warning more than sillysounding mouthful blurt out the ticket vendor this horror sequels moniker also contains grievous oversight that anyone who saw the original will be able spot what you did _last_ summer you actually did the summer _before_ last summer and since knew about it _this_ summer as well as _last_ summer it is really illogical say that _still_ know what you did _last_ summer the filmmakers would have at least made sense the shorter still know the longer still know what you did two summers ago or the appropriate stupid people getting hacked bits that last suggestion is the preferable one since the characters in this do things that are the polar opposite of smart for example if your roommate is plagued terrible nightmares as result of being stalked and nearly murdered not long ago would you sneak into her room late at night and hide in the closet even if it was just locate and borrow cute little dress probably not but that is precisely what college student karla pop diva brandy does best friend julie jennifer love hewitt resulting in the first in long line of phony frights julie you will recall was one of the sole survivors at the end of surprise hit know what you did last summer after slasher grudge bear it is _long_ story began trying pick off her her buddies and various others in their coastal carolina village in this installment the plot picks up as karla wins trip the bahamas and julie yet racked guilt decides that maybe tropical getaway will help ease her mind yeah right their island paradise has room of course for one more in the form of the stillalive killer muse watson from the first he sports the same gortons fisherman getup heavy hat and rain slicker that mask his identity but why he is still trying stay anonymous is mystery this movie never solves though suppose his hookhand would look funny protruding from the sleeve of leisure suit in sense that is the movies glaring flaw everybody knows who the bad guy is thus evaporating the level of paranoid tension nicely sustained its prequel the murders and attempted murders in that were vivid and scary but trey callaways derivative still know screenplay makes the fisherman just as dumb as his pretty potential victims when julie lays blissfully unaware in tanning bed giving him perfect chance wreak vengeance once and for all what does he do he twistties the lid shut and cranks up the uv rays you would think he would want her gutted now instead of skin cancer victim later even prequel summer lovers might balk at how little there is here beyond sporadically amusing absurdity and few neato shots of blood flowing from toned teenage flesh the innovative gallows humor that scribe and scream wunderkind kevin williamson injected into know unfolding story is sorely missed replaced the grating antics of white rastafarian cabana boy who smokes weed and tosses off slang like yo you will cheer not shriek when he ends up pair of hedgetrimmers firmly implanted in his chest if know what you did last summer however effective was just the kind of movie that those subversive scream flicks poked fun at then the deadly still know what you did last summer deserves fullblown roasting on mystery science theatre

synopsis humorless police officers life changes when he befriends supersmart superadorable golden retriever named einstein and cute young blond scientist unfortunately einstein shares psychic link bigfootsized apecreature trained the blond scientist be an unstoppable killing machine and this rogainenightmare is loose and after the dog and the girl meanwhile group of white chainsmoking guntoting nsa agents in sunglasses and business suits tries kill all the other characters in the movie comments watchers reborn cheaply made directtovideo turkey is the fourth sequel the first version of dean koontzs bestselling novel watchers technically this should have been called watchers but it seems that this cycle of horror movies much like many other sequelcrazy series has decided drop the numbers from the titles even the star trek movies dropped the numbers from their titles after star trek vi the makers of watchers reborn probably want fool unsuspecting video rental customers into thinking this might be good movie instead of crappy fifth installment of series should have died long time ago this really is not good movie have you ever rented movie and recieved sinking feeling about it when you watched the previews preceding the feature presentation well any hope viewer may have had perhaps because he is fan of novelist dean koontz or actor mark hamill will be dashed the time he is seen the trailers tagged on before the beginning of watchers reborn they are awful these commercials cover films like strange stripper movie called shadow dancer some weird crap about dead indian teens and wolves and an action movie called detonator starring scott baio scott baio what idiot dreamed this movie up after surviving these abysmal trailers the person finally gets watch the movie he rented watchers reborn maybe it will not be that bad he may say himself perhaps just perhaps the bottomofthebarrel fluff advertised before it is greatly misleading watchers reborn after all is based on that cool book dean koontz wrote decade ago it stars mark hamill luke skywalker himself from that terrific star wars trilogy lou rawls is even in the mix unfortunately the force is certainly no longer mark hamill he looks very sick here and this movie shares only basic plot elements watchers the book the latter is really too bad koontz is hack writer producing way too many thrillers for his own good but he is still my favorite hack writer koontz has writing style is succinct and suspenseful people who read many of his books however often complain of repetitive plot devices it is definately not koontz book if there is not psychic superintelligent dog or psychotic killer who likes ripping out peoples eyeballs watchers has all three devices may explain why it is arguably the most popular of koontzs books the idea behind koontzs novel though highly implausible is very interesting basically biological war machine is created smart dog can be released in battle track down its target and then relay the targets position psychically large creature designed kill in handtohand combat silly but kind of neat too am sorry do not mean ramble on about matters not directly linked watchers reborn the movie suppose just do not want talk about the movie itself this turkey is really cheesy no one in this movie can act including mark hamill and it is difficult seeing the aged luke skywalker stumble around trying be the hero the cheese factor is only increased when he is involved in an implied sex scene the blond biologist geneticist zoologist whateverthef kshe issupposedtobe whom he befriends mercifully the filmmakers opted not do nudity be honest the only halfconvincing actor in the is the golden retriever who plays einstein you know movie is bad when dog outacts all of its human counterparts find it difficult relate how laughable the action sequences are in this movie and the creature yes the creature out after poor einstein is some guy in furry suit and mask poorly imitates the werewolves in the howling this creature is shot about times but it is okay the creature has the ability kill people swinging his arms around and pushing oh he can also rip body parts off allowing for many scenes of fake hands and arms being thrown around cheesy gore that is another main element of watchers reborn it has many bloody scenes are thoroughly unconvincing and only increase the films campiness rather than its suspense ultimately gave watchers reborn star and half because bad horror scifi buffs may get few kicks out of the films silliness though this will tax even their patience it is an minute but it feels like four hours also hate admit have survived far worse than this anyone who has sat through the christopher lambert and natasha henstridge debacle known as adrenalin fear the rush will know what mean finally could not help but think that watchers reborn would work well as bot fodder for the creative folks behind one of my alltime favorite shows mystery science theater this thought alone helped me survive watchers reborn smile on my face rated watchers reborn contains dozens of bloodspattered bodies and unconvincing gore it also has violence obviously would not recommend it for the little kids but am sure even young teens would make it through this movie okay instead of watching this however recommend reading koontzs book trust me it will be time much much better spent

you should have heard the old guys in the crowded bathroom following the odd couple ii sneak preview they were as happy group of men as have ever encountered what great movie exclaimed one gent at the urinal everything was so true yeah laughed man standing next him drive as slow as that one guy did my kids give me holy hell for it and peeing is big part of my day just like felix chuckled another fellow as he fastened his trousers up around his nipples and prepared rejoin his wife if you are over and in the habit of driving at least miles per hour below the posted speed limit neil simons the odd couple ii may be just the for you others will likely be less charitable while the odd couple ii is amiable enough neil simons shockingly lazy screenplay feels like slappedtogether tv reunion show suffering from wheezing situation comedy setups and jokes straight out of the borschtbelt simon once the toast of broadway has apparently shifted his sights from the great white way the neighborhood multiplex in branson missouri the contrived story involving the marriage of their kids provides the excuse for reunion between oscar madison and felix unger who have not seen each other in years the former roommates fly into california from their respective homes for the wedding and quite literally run into one another at the airport they take off in rental car for the ceremony in san molina get lost and have series of wacky adventures on the road jack lemmon and walter matthau reprise their roles as felix the neat freak and oscar the slob while there is an undeniable chemistry between the pair the impact of their reunion is lessened the fact that they have headlined three films together since grumpy old men grumpier old men and out sea still the two veteran actors are fun watch matthau whose magnificently rumpled face looks like big pile of laundry eyes has field day as oscar the crown prince of the curmudgeons lemmon looking pastier than usual is fine as the ever annoying felix who still punctuates his chronic whining occasional allergic honks of phnah phnah despite their bickering the characters have real affection for each other providing welcome respite from the nonstop barrage of insults that marked their previous three films together unfortunately matthau and lemmons charm is not enough compensate for simons hack script would not pass muster even on upn sitcom one contrived situation follows another lathered enough stale one liners supply dozen wouldbe comics on openmike night at the local comedy club if someone drags you this and you find yourself as bored as was try entertaining yourself counting the product placements burger king gets one as does the el pollo loco taco joint but budget renta car really hits the jackpot between script references their business and shots of signs and stickers bearing their company name could not keep count of all the plugs did however keep track of some of the swearing came up four goddamns three shitheads and two fucks the inclusion of those particular profanities seemed odd for aimed at an older audience but the theater full of seniors appeared have no problem them howling like crazy every time the boys let rip naughty word it is sad that writer of neil simons stature has grown desperate enough resort swearing for cheap laughs but not surprising when you look at what else gets passed off as humor in this tepid exercise one running gag involves oscar and felixs inability remember the name of the town where the wedding is be held at one point the men actually spend seconds just freeassociating riffing off variants of the word san the sequence is so creatively bankrupt that it is simply embarrassing one of the oldest maxims of filmgoing is beware of movies that use the authors name in the title neil simons the odd couple ii is no exception the rule while the production has enough minor pleasures warrant tv viewing on some lazy sunday afternoon it has no business playing in movie theater of course there is bathroom full of old guys who would strongly disagree every word have written and would probably whip my youngwhippersnapper ass boot one things for sure though they will never catch me in car chase

the army comedy genre has never turned out truly good movie if you do not count neil simons biloxi blues year after year more predictably cliched military movies come out most recently sgt bilko and none of them ever manage be anything more than rehash of the last thought stripes would be different ivan reitman as director bill murray as star and harold ramis as costar and coscreenwriter it seemed like it would be ghostbusters in the army instead it was bunch of unfunny crap in the army murray about as funny and sophisticated here as he was in meatballs plays loser cab driver who sees the army as his only chance for success and convinces his friend ramis enlist him so he does and we get the obligatory drill sergeant from hell headshaving and marchingsinging sequences more mindnumbingly stale here than ever the characters are even less original ranging from underachieving slob john candy incompetent captain john larroquette all the big name stars in stripes and even larroquette fall victim the lame rehashed material and are never really likeable murray in particular he only gets few decent lines in although those barelyfunny one liners pale in comparison the hilarious peter venkman character he played three years later in ghostbusters he was even better in caddyshack for crying out loud as lot of the late early comedies stripes is completely juvenile movie only child would like but is so sex obsessed no child should be able watch it am sure it seems funny on paper have candy pay over mud wrestle five beautiful women but while watching it all that was coming out of my mouth was the admonition dear god every few seconds stripes is not the playful kind of sex comedy either most of the time it seems downright misogynistic as when larroquette uses his telescope peer into the womens showers or murray lifts female p onto the stove and an iknowwhatyoulike look on his face says he is going give her the aunt jemima treatment means shoving spatula under her butt repeatedly you do not want stick around as the scene progresses and he uses an ice cream scoop on her genital region am not enjoying this the woman protests my sentiments exactly

mercury rising has numerous flaws but there is one that really stands out its central plot device is unnecessary that is right the major aspect of the that is supposed make it different from other routine government conspiracy action flicks could be dropped from the beginning and the movie would turn out exactly the same if not better this central device is the fact that nineyearold boy is autistic his name is simon and an evil government bureaucrat named nicholas kudrow alec baldwin wants him dead because he unknowingly cracked supersecret government code slipped into the back of puzzle magazine its programmers just see if someone could beat it simon is intended be the heart and soul of the and we are supposed feel for him because he is poor handicapped child thrown into violent unfair world against his will only renegade fbi agent played bruce willis protect him the fact that he is autistic does nothing for the emotional intensity or the plot necessities of mercury rising suppose the original novel upon the movie was based did much more this aspect of simons character and his relationship willis but here it is lost miko hughes the young actor who plays simon goes through the prescribed motions of being autistic he walks slowly drawls his words kicks and screams when he is touched and has hard time looking at other people it is difficult role for an adult much less young child play and unfortunately hughes never convinces us that he is not playing like he is autistic unlike dustin hoffmans performance in rain man or leonardo dicaprios in what is eating gilbert grape we are always painfully aware that hughes is acting however unlike rain man used its characters autism in unique and interesting ways build credible and touching story mercury rising could go right about its generic predictable plot simon being simply really smart but really shy kid hell he does not even have be shy in fact the movie might have been more interesting if he had had more active role rather than just being carted around under willis arm willis character art jeffries is disillusioned fbi agent who has been removed from undercover work and is now doing menial tasks like listening wiretaps rookies who are happy be doing anything he becomes involved simon when he is called check out murder scene at simons house where his father has apparently shot his mother in the back and then committed suicide of course we know that is not the way it happened happen because we saw an evil squarejawed government hitman meanlooking crewcut knock off the parents simon was able get away and jeffries finds him hiding in secret compartment in closet the rest of the chicago police department had overlooked jeffries who is accused several characters at different times of being paranoid although his actions never suggest it knows there is something more and he makes it his personal mission go against everything and everyone in order protect simon this is quite task because that same hitman who knocked off simons parents is crawling everywhere attempting kill simon at the hospital on the highway and every other place he goes late in the movie jeffries is forced enlist the aid of pretty young woman named stacey kim dickens who he meets at coffee shop of all the hardtobelieve aspects of the movie this is the worst can believe in the decency of the human heart but staceys character is far too accommodating not only does she agree watch simon while jeffries runs off solve the mystery she lets him into her apartment at two of the clock in the morning when she knows the police is after him and then lets him leave simon in her apartment means that she has forgo business trip that is desperately needed pay the rent the grinding squeals of the rusty plot machine are almost overbearing at this point the movie might have been redeemed some good action sequences but even here mercury rising does not rise the challenge the movie was directed harold becker who has made some good suspense films including sea of love and malice but his talent is nowhere be found in this latest excursion there is one fight on streetcar between jeffries and another hitman played peter stormare that is so ineptly directed shot and edited that had no idea exactly where they were on the streetcar who was hitting who and where this hitman came from and how he knew where jeffries and simon were the grand finale takes place on the roof of tall building and features harrowing yawn scene where simon walks along the very edge of the building not because he has but because it is more suspenseful that way taken as whole mercury rising is an tepid confused movie that lacks style wit and any traces of sense of humor usually willis brings his personal brand of understated humor his roles but here he is too straight and serious this is because the movie wants be an action flick and heartfelt drama at the same time but it ends up failing on both fronts maybe the book was better but the way it is handled here is perfect case study in formula filmmaking guaranteed bore

i have never been star trek fan and tell the truth out of the five films in the series that have seen have disliked all of them do however always go into one of these an open mind and the ninth in the series star trek insurrection is no exception dropping almost completely the hardcore scifi element of the previous one in the series first contact insurrection tells the story of planet that holds only people known as the baku as well as the fountain of youth at the start of the picture the villagers go under attack second alien species known as the sona who want push all of the baku out so that their own race will not die out also attacking the baku is data brent spiner robot from the star trek enterprise after returning jeanluc picard patrick stewart and the gang on their space ship no one can understand why data was somehow taken over another force so several of the star trek members travel down the planet of the baku where picard meets up and starts fall in love one of the inhabitants sultry kind alien woman donna murphy who is over sixhundredyearsold but looks only be in her thirties star trek insurrection is completely unoriginal and cheaplooking installment in the series and is big step down from first contact at least appeared try make something bit different in insurrection however it plays like lowrent episode of the television show due the smallscale generic storyline and an emphasis on oneliners rather than excitement the was filled nearly nonstop comedy and worse yet most of it fell flatter than cartoon character that drops off cliff meanwhile when there were action sequences they were not at all interesting or inventive relying on that old reliable ticking timer that counts down very very slowly this plot device is seen in just about every action made nowadays is getting old fast are filmmakers so bankrupt of ingenuity and ideas that they must always have timer ticking away during the climax another element of star trek films in general is that picard seems always have have love interest but then she always miraculously disappears when the next is made two or three years later although donna murphy who falls victim this thankless love interest role here is actually one of the few characters that we get know in the minute running time alfre woodard was far superior in first contact she should have returned for this one but do not blame her for not wanting waste her time this movies disappointing and often lifeless screenplay michael piller star trek insurrection is perhaps the weakest in the star trek series although have not seen what is widely considered the worst star trek the final frontier insurrection is the type of safe sequel that will bewilder nonfans since it is so lowtech compared most of todays blockbuster action films although most of these are honestly not very good either and should disappoint the loyal trekkies since it could have easily been better if the makers had realized that the screenplay needed go through few more drafts on second thought they probably should have completely thrown the script out that way they could have come up story that at least had sign of intelligence and freshness

while the summer movie season approached its long awaited cessation we had yet another shoddy subordinate disposable celluloid superhero movie brought on the inexorable hasten from the major studios please kids everything they think kids will go for disburse their seven bucks and once again we have one of the worst films of the year the trend of the moment and bear in mind it is trend not movie is spawn and if you have seen the animated series on hbo you will recall it embodies the lost life of disfigured man an individual who has transpired the ultimate punishment he is been sent hell todd mcfarlane the creator of the spawn comic book must have had tough time sitting through spawn for his creativity and themes about resurrection and loss of identity were all being jettisoned in favor of reliable special effects style over substance ambience over anything else not only does spawn rely entirely on special effects the story about bewildered individual who must take on group of bad guys and find himself in the process is realized in such sordid incapable manner it becomes indigestible after while every character in this is lifeless vacuous and seemingly written depressed college student the story begins like in every superhero movie in this age man living an idyllic life al simmons michael jai white government agentassassin shares the love of his wife wanda theresa russell and daughter has tongueincheek wiseass partner terry b sweeney and is content the job his boss jason wynn martin sheen provides him the next element in the is the part when things go awry and as expected everyone turns the tables on poor al as the two are investigating their latest mission at some sort of biological weapons plant al is befriended jason and dies in gory and truly sickening scene inevitably it leads everyone the conclusion that he has passed away hence jasons mischievous mastermind plan conquer the world is just commencing its initial stages when al makes pact satan himself agreeing command the devils army take over the world and he gets see his family again so our pal al has been uplifted hell and while his transformation from normal guy spawn takes place his ol partner terry forms relationship his wife time passes and now spawn is present in the grotesque inner city the ghetto where cog nicol williamson teaches spawn how utilize his neat artifacts his motorbike armor etc this character is merely poor mans obi wan kenobi without all the mythological hoopla now the stage is set spawn the new enemy of evil vs evil and evil takes the cake doubtlessly john leguizamos deliciously heinous performance as the injurious clown working for wynn is the films relief point all this anguish pain halfbaked themes and putrid action scenes are invisible leguizamo who steals the show and derives joy from his character is basically compilation of soso one liners and then there is martin sheen whichever way you look you will find carving boards near his pitying and downright appalling last two years his selections calls for an immediate firing of his agent as the megalomaniac boss his caricature plays like bad dream out of bmovie scrambled and left in the shelf rot this is the man that starred in films such as apocalypse now and wall street would never thought would be saying this but at this juncture charlie sheens career is in better shape spawn is movie in realism or even an attempt draw parallel between the problems of the hero and real life is identifiable for most of the the vapid michael jai white consumes his time ogling jumping through roofs and performing all kinds of acrobatic exercises even batman and robin accomplished better it constantly reminded us we were watching superhero movie very bad superhero movie continually the kept on depending on special effects and sadly this is how pictures are being made perhaps no other movie better than spawn illustrates the deterioration of cinema through computer wizardry the filmmakers seem have forgotten every human element possible the quality of this is abysmal and insulting it is perceptible that director mark dippe attempted touch the psychological chord that tim burtons batman did touch the desperation of man whose life has all but evaporated in one spontaneous act but bruce wayne had human elements him he was pensive resourceful and had relationships made our perspective on him equally human the character of al simmons seems be longing for drastic change as if he is fatigued about being normal and as all superheroes batman superman the phantom they must possess an element of normal civilians make us think they are extraordinary none of this is present in spawn the fighting sequences are weakly executed the dialogue is pennydreadful and the art direction an odious duplicate of blade runners as an example of this films vastly creative imagination the writers of spawn decided include poor orphan boy who is abandoned and beaten and then rescued spawn so our emotions tend be little more sympathetic admittedly did laugh once in the and that is when todd mcfarlane showed up in an unexpected cameo as bum it is no wonder why so american children grow up no engrossment for art or literature besides blaming large portion of it on the laughable school system condemn the other part garbage like spawn movies that present no admiration no captivation no richness and vague interest in what children are being subjected and kids will continue see films like spawn simply because they are unable differentiate what makes an imaginative wondrous from an insipid and wasteful one children are not muppets and spawn unapologetically targets children

it is not bad thing update old stories it is done all the time in the oral tradition the difficulty this is not that the tale has changed it is that it is dry the new cinderella danielle drew barrymore is not sitting around waiting for her prince come she is woman of the late twentieth century albeit situated in sixteenth century france when her father dies she stays on in his house even though she is mistreated her wicked stepmother rodmilla anjelica huston she works day but reads sir thomas more firelight at night although the story is updated you know the plot danielle meets prince henry dougray scott goes ball disguised is later found out and they live happily ever after the movie is often like watching filmed play theater in real life is engrossing theater on the screen is usually lifeless there does not seem be much going on the camera can be star of films here it is coconspirator danielles convictions are compromised socialist and feminist she pretends be royalty get her man kind woman her last act in the movie is one of revenge the most enjoyable characters are the most cartoonish the fairy godmother standin leonardo da vinci patrick godfrey is fun watch as the eccentric old man who advises danielle huston is enjoyable in her overthetop wickedness in all fairness my companion loved the maybe it is one of those chick flicks that men do not like it is certainly date nearly the entire audience was couples oh well maybe it is good for something

i suppose it is unfair criticize movie like hudson hawk has been panned reviewers and moviegoers alike since it is release michael lehmanns actioncomedy was quick win the title biggest box office flop of all time or close thereof the movie stars bruce willis as renowned cat burglar hudson hawk who is just been released from sing sing prison after many years in isolation let me put it this way he explains i never saw et greeting him is his old friend and partner in crime played danny aiello who becomes the subject of many amusing fat jokes these are rather welcome in movie filled so many completely unfunny sight gags cartoonish villains and unbelievable coincidences it appears as if director lehmann did not know when stop all the absurd silliness and he piles on layer after layer of utter ridiculousness as the movie propels itself toward the finish line if at some point during hudson hawk you make the assumption that things could not get goofier you will soon be eating your words but am inclined say that this is not quite as terrible as it is box office numbers suggest it is fastpaced and entertaining if you have got incredible patience and warped sense of humor for the first portion of this review am going try and center on the positive aspects of hudson hawk wish me luck first and foremost bruce willis is good sport while am not entirely sure what he was smoking when he cowrote this script willis is quite aware that the entire project is big fat ugly joke he constantly gives deadpan reactions things that are very silly and outofplace means he has more than his share of deadpan reactions another plus is the appearance of andie macdowell as schizophrenic nun and love interest for the title character they meet when hudson goes on mission steal priceless book from the vatican and their relationship escalates in interest from there it is unfortunate that mcdowells onenote character is used just as an excuse for there be predictable plottwist and she offers absolutely no encouraging chemistry willis but now am rambling on again about the negative things are not enough of the charade for the most part hudson hawk is an excruciating experience it is stupid pointless and repetitive can only wonder what bruce willis fans thought after exiting the theater because this really does not have the potential please anyone action fans should take note that hudson hawk is composed of comedy and even the action sequences are skittery rushed and poorly edited and those expecting hearty laugh or two will find it difficult even smirk during all of the headacheinducing hijinks do not get me wrong this is not devoid of laughs it is too bad most of them are unintentional or just plain forced the impressive cast looks suitably embarrassed it is understandable see willis and aiello in movie of this caliber but as for the presence of future academy award winner james coburn am not entirely sure coburn plays former nemesis of the hawk who again comes into play and he looks unsure of his place the entire movie especially when he resorts martial arts during the final showdown and has fight willis that would look right at home in jackie chan things get more bizarre when we are introduced his team of rejects named after chocolate bars including future nypd blue star david caruso as the speechless cardflipping kitkat if that is not enough for you there is richard grant and sandra bernhard hamming it up as deranged couple on the brink of convoluted economic takeover their crotchbiting pooch provides couple of the big laughs here wait maybe the only big laughs am not sure what kind of movie everyone had in mind when filming hudson hawk cannot even begin start about the films absurd plot but let us not get into that suppose there is some amusement viewers could derive from the ridiculous premise if they were that desperate but hudson hawk never even has clue of where it is going from minute one and from there it is minutes of pure cinematic muck

if there were subject just screaming be made into it was studio the late steve rubells infamous new york discotheque came symbolize the taboosmashing excesses of the disco eras heyday easy drugs and even easier sex between everyone all set thumping dance beat so when miramax started production on __ last year the buzz of hype and resulting anticipation began an edgy as downanddirty as the club itself written and directed promising firsttimer mark christopher and starring some hot young talent salma hayek neve campbell newcomer ryan phillippe and mike myers in his dramatic debut my how easily does the worm turn hype turned into damage control when word got out about thhour reshoots wrapped only month ago rash of studioimposed edits that left virtually the entire cast and crew especially christopher unhappy and the very likely possibility that miramax would not screen the finished for critics at the last minute though miramax did decide screen the so hastily scheduled was the screening that myerss last name was misspelled on the invitation not mention the numerous typos in the press notes for media audience that came away noticeably less than impressed myself included and good reasonsomehow some way the supremely disappointing __ has made the historically hip haven of hedonism boring although christopher has distanced himself from the finished he still must shoulder some of the blame for __s lifelessness __ focuses for the most part on tightknit trio of employees at the club coat check girlaspiring disco diva anita wasted hayek her busboy husband greg breckin meyer and most prominently the freshfromjersey shane oshea phillippe who enjoys quick rise from busboy head bartender these characters are about as generic as those descriptions in focusing on the hired help christopher really missed the boat the exception of the flamboyant alwayswoozy rubell myers in wellmodulated turn the meaty stories be told at studio are not the workers but those of the people who went there party not necessarily the numerous vip guests but the wild eccentrics who managed be picked from the crowd the clubs famously hardass doormen and dance among other things the night away the rich famous and infamous the only taste of the crowd comes way of ellen dows feisty dottie disco and drugcrazed granny but she is peripheral character at best as such aside from the expected overhead crowd shots there is precious little actual _dancing_ in __ what is disco filmespecially one about the pinnacle of the movementwithout the dancing even whit stillmans _the_last_days_of_disco_ was not so much concerned disco as it was witty dialogue within group of hiptoonlythemselves clubhopping preppies featured at least one extended dance scene dancing is not the only thing glazed over in __so is the sex but that may not be entirely christophers fault from what have heard his original vision was something considerably more dark and daring starting the shane character he was conceived and actually filmed as wild morally ambiguous bisexual would have made an efficient springboard cover the pansexual pleasure palace aspect of studio legend but somewhere between principal photography and the final cut shane was defanged and quite literally straightened out consequently so was the aside from brief glimpse of erotic encounters toward the beginning of the shanes fleeting dalliance seductive socialite billie sela ward and an abbreviated bedhopping montage the sexual dimension is just about ignored shane in this incarnation is sanitized the point of blandness an idealistic dogooder who pines for frequent guest at the club julie black campbell worldly soap star yes heart of gold this tackedon romance would have been slightly less tedious if either campbell or phillippe made some connection each other or the audience they fail on both counts ultimately __s failure comes down three letters fun as in there is not any be had for the audience too much time is spent the boring shane and too little is spent on the club floor where all the action took place anyhow though whatever time is spent on the floor is not used very effectively when anita finally gets her big break and perform onstage at the club it should be euphoric height for her the crowd and the audience however the moment does not get chance reach that level for it is cut short moment of forced sentimentality also mars the films conclusion one of the lastminute reshoots strangely upbeat and wistful the resolution is wholly unconvincing and unsatisfying there is an interesting portrait of studio out theretwo of them in factbut __ is not one of them they are on cable tv couple of documentaries produced and vh these two fascinating looks at the club and all the sordid goingson within it show that there is still great disco movie be made the problem is after the critical and certain box office failure of __ the subject may have run its course

a hotshot lawyer gets an obviously guilty child molester acquitted and shortly after during the victory celebration gets offered an opportunity show his prowess in new york city the lawyer kevin lomax keanu reeves is not offered job yet he is asked simply pick jury he accepts the jury he selects work out well and before long he is offered job the firm making his decision easy is the fact that not only is he offered big money but gorgeous apartment he convinces his wife mary ann charlize theron make the move new york the first case given him is big test winless case concerning man who sacrifices animals in his basement the charge was health code violations and kevin once again shows his skill and earns an acquittal his new boss and partner in the firm john milton al pacino is quite impressed and takes kevin under his wing explaining many of his philosophies on law women and sex and angles the promise of blissful wealthy life kevins next case is dream case given him milton himself much the chagrin his colleagues defending triple murder suspect who has had history of problems the law although kevins career is taking off his home life is not doing very well mary ann is starting have numerous problems she is experiencing severe depression over kevins long hours and before long is having horrible dreams and hallucinations of people turning into ghouls their faces becoming horribly disfigured kevin does not help matters dismissing his wife he does not spend more time her as he explains milton that he needs spend as much time on the case as possible get it over then focus all of his attention on his wife not helping matters is the fact that kevin is having ideas about possible affair sexy lawyer connie nielson also working the firm mary ann falls deeper into her madness as kevin spends more time away from home kevin eventually looses control of his life and has institutionalize his wife and gets disturbing news from his mother judith ivey about the mystery concerning the identity of his father he also starts lose control of his case kevin learns that all of his problems have been caused the work of one man that man is his boss mr milton truly evil character who just may be the devil himself kevin must somehow confront milton and thwart whatever diabolical plan he has in store but how do you defeat the devil why is it that most courtroom scenes in the movies are absurd do filmmakers really believe that normal courtroom drama does not fit the bill and they have juice them up the courtroom scenes in this movie would never happen in real courtroom would not have been too bad if it were not keanu reeves trying pull it off give reeves credit for trying hard but throughout the movie never saw the kevin lomax character just an actor trying very hard play kevin lomax and coming up short charlize theron defines the term overthetop in her performance as mary ann lomax disappointment in contrast her good performance in days in the valley the only good performance in the movie is al pacino but kept asking myself what the heck he was doing in this mess maybe he felt it would be interesting playing the devil and you can tell he is having fun doing so but his skill as an actor cannot save the poor performances and lackluster script that surround him it is pretty standard stuff including the fact that the hotshot lawyer appears be the only competent person on the planet who can do anything right in the courtroom please read no further if you do not want the ending spoiled but have get something off of my chest in remember watching movie called wisdom emilio estevez and demi moore and the ending of that did the worst possible thing that movie could do what like call guess what it was all dream scenario in wisdom the two lead characters are killed at the end only have one of the characters wake up from an apparent and say gosh am glad that did not really happen considered it inexcusable the way the audience was toyed well the same thing happens in the devils advocate and although arguments could be made surrounding whether it was actually dream perhaps milton went back in time try different route for his plan since it failed and he is the devil but the point is that the last of the did not happen know it is stretch after all it is movie and nothing really happened but just get annoyed get toyed like that of course the dream ending could almost be forgiven if the story that precedes it was at least an interesting one as recall wisdom was decent the devils advocate is not the devils advocate directed taylor hackford john milton al pacino kevin lomax keanu reeves mary ann lomax charlize theron mrs lomax judith ivey eddie barzoon jeffrey jones christabella connie nielson written randy turgeon march

the spy game is up you can thank charlies angels the movie for that when did banality and pandering become okay just steal from hong kong the matrix and kitschy tv show from the mids and that is movie charlies angels is one of the worst examples of action homogeneity and shameless duplicity in any have seen in ages charlies angels is dumb just plain dumb as we all know three of the hottest females on the planet drew barrymore cameron diaz and lucy liu are three superagents working for the mysterious millionaire named charlie they all drive fast cars look ohsofabulous even in the morning and do not seem get scratch even when fighting armed men having buildings explode ten feet in front of them or flying through the air in matrix slowmotion and while the entourage spends minutes romping around in cleavagebusting wetsuits cleavagebusting waitress uniforms and cleavagebusting wet tshirts they scarcely succeed in resembling so much as group of annoying drunk sorority girls the kind who hit on everybody at party the actual plot revolves around the ridiculous story of millionaire computer engineer the great sam rockwell who gets kidnapped mysterious rival computer company of course the rival wants control of his new personal identification system involves such latterday buzzwords as gps cellular tracking and even mainframe the amazing crispin glover lends his acting chops as crazed henchmen involved in all the nasty things that happen the angels like battling each of them in many roundrobin matrix ripoff again fight sequences and harboring strange attraction slicedoff locks of the angels hair the coup de grace is bill murray as bosley serving as charlies manservant or more the point the angels pimp the rest of the movie comprises revenge arc enough costume changes fill three productions of les miserables carboncopy fight sequences that would lend credible evidence jackie chan and the wachowski brothers lawsuit for intellectual property theft and the strange transformation of sam rockwell into mickey rourkes longlost brother charlies angels starts off bang and ends up being soggy burrito left out overnight nothing is difficult plausible or believable in any of the angels actions it feels like the matrix mission impossible and cleopatra jones and the casino of gold all rolled into one diaz is knucklehead barrymore is the dangerous one mean and tough and about as believable as katie holmes in the role liu is just lucy liu looking good in skintight black leather suit the list of movies from charlies angels is directly lifted is equally astonishing the writers apparently ran the copier all night stealing scenes from armageddon lethal weapon ii all of jackie chans movies the great escape saturday night fever revenge of the nerds payback darkman dr no the matrix as mentioned and even tvs friends it is shame too because one of the many screenwriters john august was at the helm of last years favorite go then again what can you expect from director known solely as mcg there is no camp value in the no interesting main characters no invigorating action scenes no reason at all waste your time except ogle the hot chicks and enjoy the performances of few supporting players note next time let us leave the tv shows on the tv

i have always been fan of director neil jordan from his early work such as the company of wolves the crying game and interview vampire his latest the butcher boy is return his roots in ireland but unfortunately it is not successful homecoming told through the eyes of yearold irish boy francis newcomer eomann owens this peculiar follows him as we learn little about his decidedly unstable life his father stephen rea is an indifferent alcoholic his mother fiona shaw is mentally ill and always in and out of hospitals and francis himself delights in terrorizing the mother of one of his friends after he is forbidden see him anymore francis is the type of boy who always has lot say but mostly fluctuates between sarcasm and frightening honesty and it quickly becomes apparent that he may very well be little psychotic even capable of brutal murder the premise of the butcher boy is one that could have very well been turned into thoughtprovoking disturbing motion picture but somehow nothing works francis is in almost every scene but we learn very little about him as if the was distancing itself away from him when suspect we were actually supposed sympathize him this is definately not young owens fault however because he gives brilliantly accurate performance and is able also seem menacing as well the fact that we do not get close his character is because of the sloppy screenplay the supporting characters are no help though rea is wasted and has practically no scenes where he actually talks his son or anyone else for that matter he usually seems just be sitting watching the television throughout shaw has little bit more work since she has one touching scene in she talks francis in time of despair but is out of the picture just as we are beginning know her and singer sinead oconnor appears rather effectively as the virgin mary who occasionally gives francis advice the pacing is all off in the butcher boy although the story could have been dynamite it moves at deadeningly slow rate and found my mind wandering every once in while it is also very episodic because the developments in the story fly no satisfying payoffs at one point francis is sent away juvenile prison and an odd possibly sexual relationship begins develop between priest and himself but nothing comes of it would rather think of the butcher boy as brief diversion for director jordan rather than total misfire he has already proven be strong director but he lucked out this latest what could have been courageous unsettling character study of an emotionally disturbed young boy only manages be an ineffective uninvolivng bore

as you should know this summer has been less than memorable total of decent films it is not surprise that these big budget failures keep appearing that said you can pretty much predict what my opinion on the th warrior will be the is based on the michael crichton eaters of the dead in ahmed ibn fahdlan is banished from his country for looking at wife of king after tarveling for many months he comes across gang of norsemen who are forced pick men protect town from mythical monsters who travel in the fog so they start picking men and are left without thus ahmed is choosen so far it sounds interesting right not when all of this takes place in minutes after that they basically run around killing that alone shows how much script is needed for because once your story is introduced you have the rest of the start developing it obviously that is not the case here even if you are going into the expecting an action packed adventure you will be disappointed since all the action takes place in
