if were one of those arrogant critics who thinks his review has some great impact on the success or failure of certain films might say that review movies that do not look particularly good because am doing service my readers warning them against seeing it if that were true could put banner at the top of my site that reads shay casey seeing bad movies so you do not have but know that is bunkyou are going see whatever movies you want no matter what say so have tell the truth every once in while get nasty masochistic urge see bad movie you know the feeling when you are sick of seeing all these damn academy award contenders and you want see something you can have ball trashing mercilessly sometimes think that is why anyone goes see pauly shore movies ever admit it sometimes you like seeing bad movies so do so saw supernova truth be told supernova was not quite as bad as thought it might be maybe just felt sorry for the actors or maybe thought it could have been decent if the studio had not started tinkering the directors walter hill final cut causing him want his name removed maybe am becoming softy in any case did not find supernova as bad as the advance buzz would have me believe but it is still bad the takes place aboard the medical space vessel nightingale the crew includes captain j marley robert forster his new second officer nick vanzant james spader head medical officer kaela evers angela bassett medical technicians yerzy penalosa lou diamond phillips and danika lund robin tunney and computer technician benj sotomejor wilson cruz there are some attempts at characterization but all that means is that nick has shady past involving drug addiction puts kaela on edge yerzy and danika have relationship that requires them make kissyfaces at each other every five minutes and benj apparently gay is in love the computer apparently female do not expect any more explanation because you will not get it anyway the crew gets distress call from location deep in space failed mining operation had been sent during the dimension jump think that is what it is called but do not hold me it the captain is killed and the man who sent the distress signal peter facinelli is brought on board he calls himself troy larson making him the supposed son of man kaela once had relationship then bunch of really predictable stuff starts happening have you seen alien have you seen event horizon lame movie in its own right good then you have seen supernova postproduction cuts or not there is nothing original about this screenplay and nothing unpredictable either after all no ones going think for second that troy will not turn out be villain but the bigger problem supernova is that it can just stick the simple plot it is afforded numerous rewrites the script may be credited three people but it is gross underestimate have crammed this lean minute tons of extraneous plot threads that all remain underdeveloped was there something about limping robot shaped like fighter pilot did the ships computer learn something about humanity what was that glowing lava lamp artifact troy brought on board him and just what does the films title signify if anything as far as can tell it refers very small plot detail that is not developed just like the rest of these unnecessary story elements character relationships in this also make very little sense for some reason every person in this keeps having sex we get an unusually early sex scene between phillips and tunney within the first minutes bassett and spaders characters start off hating each other fifteen minutes and one bottle of pear brandy later they are engaging in some hankypanky when troy the creepy stranger shows up on the ship of course both female crew members will fall in love him every single shift in character interaction happens extremely suddenly is only one of the many obvious clues how much this has been cut the most prominent example however may be the fact that when the starts there are no opening credits furthermore the end of the looks like they took what were originally intended be the opening credits and spliced them in right before the real end credits maybe that is why the films title is mentioned twice during the end credits right between james spader and robert forster right after you get over the shock of not being told what movie you are seeing lest you decide walk out upon making that discovery you might notice that the movie seems have dropped you right in the middle of scene littletono introduction any of the characters or situations the rest of the movie feels like they skipped over the middle stuff in the character changes you know where they explain things and just went from point point point danika is thoroughly enamored of yerzy and is ready have his baby point tunney is now shagging troy and yerzy is unusually obsessed the lava lamp thing does not make sense since did not understand anything about these characters motivations did care when troy abruptly starts murdering them onebyone and he does knocking off three of them in about minutes not whit it is shame because this cast contains lot of talented actors looking for something do they do not find it bassett and spader say every line in the same monotone voice the same blank expressions on their faces sexual tension more like constipation maybe they are just embarrassed at having utter such howlers as this thing was made someone more powerful than god and whole lot less nice not that we ever find out who that is mind you the climax of their relationship taking place in transport pod is probably the films biggest foreheadslapper as troy peter facinelli inhabits the most obvious villain in history that no one ever suspected he awfully onenote but it is not as if he is given any more notes work the rest of the cast does even less tunney stands around looking cute then scared phillips broods cruz flirts the computer then they all die and star blows up or something but really was not paying much attention then supernova is pretty awful but am cutting it little slack merely because expected less than what got that is it if you expect it be good for whatever reasons you may have you will probably hate it more than will even the special effects are fairly unimpressive nothing you haven seen before and suffice say the script is not going save the honestly though what do you expect from about dozen writers and director who had his name removed and replaced pseudonym it usually results in bad movie and that is what supernova is

for timing reasons having do baby sitters we recently went multiplex and saw undercover blues would give it one half of star for guts anyone in movie this bad would have have guts later read ny times review that said kathleen turner and dennis quaid had gotten so plump they looked like they had the mumps in the show the script was the worst part they had characters who talked funny accents in an attempt make you laugh they had lots of great sight gags like two people trying go in door together and therefore bumping shoulders against the door turner and quaid both kept smiling like some idiots on game show the good news is that we were smart enough vote our feet and left buy some tickets and give them your worst enemies tell them the show is great and smile lot one of the top few films of this or any year must see excellent show look for it average movie kind of enjoyable poor show do not waste your money one of the worst films of this or any year totally unbearable review written on september opinions expressed are mine and not meant reflect my employers

the obvious reason for producing sequel an immensely popular movie is acquire continued profits the rationale is sound but in many cases of this and recent years the sequel is shoddy product that is exposed for the cashmilking vehicle it really is last years speed and scream as well as this years species ii have all been products that have been decisively less than satisfactory in some cases sequel can even discredit its predecessor as the latest neoslasher flick still know what you did last summer whatever uniqueness the original might have had now seems trite and overplayed when paired this abominable thriller julie james jennifer love hewitt and ray bronson freddie prinze jr are back from the original star in still know reprising their roles in typical fashion julie and ray experience rather predictable fallingout at the beginning of the movie leaving the door wide open for newcomer will benson matthew settle will and julie hit it off and along friends karla brandy norwood and tyrell mekhi phifer the foursome heads off radio stationgiveaway vacation in the tropics unfortunately things are not so peachy once they arrive and regularity you could set your watch the infamous fisherman muse watson is back his hook it is another bloody showdown complete cliffhanger ending there is not much that is original about still know and the market saturated genx thrillers like this one it is unlikely that still know will get any recognition other than that of bad sequel for diehard fans of the genre this will be required viewing material but the bottom line is that the material here is just recycled from the original know what you did last summer the aura of thrillerism surrounding the plot is not heightened skillful scripting or camera work but rather tense stringbased score and manipulative editing the man the hook ends up becoming very belittled this time around when the script gives him too many lines of dialogue he goes from being scary figure nutcase in few short and painful moments much of the mystery is dropped for the sake of getting the point the whole reason the plot exists julie and karla must guess the capital of brazil in order win the trip from the radio station is dead giveaway lessening suspense and creating hurryupandwait timing problem and whereas the killers identity might have been question in the first movie it is almost given here changes the dynamic of the movie drastically three or four teens run automatically from man in rain slicker they nonchalantly refer as the killer they are almost used it and the performances show it not hewitt nor prinze nor brandy nor phifer give decent show and so in the end it is left wide open for third movie and most likely brand new supporting cast god help us

i am dedicated fan of writer kevin williamsons work he always finds clever way spice up old material witty dialogue and fresh ideas that stem from his inventive brain teaching mrs tingle his directorial debut williamson has reached the end of his rope what used be intelligent about his films is hopelessly stale here the components are all there including an encouraging premise that all high school students can relate but where are the thrills the laughs both are supposedly absent from this draggy exercise in elaborate revenge and what shame that is loved the scream films heck even enjoyed the scifi goofiness of the faculty kevin williamson was the reason horror films were such big draw at the box office teaching mrs tingle black comedy that will leave gaping void in his optimistic followers may put an end his reign or perhaps it will encourage him spend more time perfecting script than worry about his directing duties still have my faith but fear the name of kevin williamson may soon be forgotten echo of the past the title character of his pet project is vicious uncaring history teacher who is played deliciously overthetop british actress helen mirren mrs tingle is basically every students worst nightmare heartless human being bent on distributing poor marks even the most hardworking of her pupils the principal michael mckean is horrified of her and she is unanimously despised among her fellow staff members enjoyed the fact that everyone in the hallway quickly steers out of her way mirrens performance is one of the very few delights in this distressingly hollow black comedy that goes down like flat soft drink in other words it is poor substitute for williamsons best work the plot is big problem here material that could have been enjoyable is rendered totally ridiculous poor handling on the part of the director the likable katie holmes plays leigh ann an overachiever hoping get college scholarship but typical mrs tingle says her history project she worked on for countless hours is laughable later on while studying in the gymnasium classmate barry watson offers her photocopied duplicate of mrs tingles final exam leigh anns best friend marisa coughlan encourages her use it alas the old hag herself finds the three scheming and snatches the test and prepares talk the principal in the morning in the morning how convenient the three students head mrs tingles house attempting set the facts straight and clear leigh anns name things get out of hand and the teacher gets knocked unconscious in tussle the plan is tie her bed and try get some reasoning out of her of course not everything goes entirely plan besides pointless subplots involving the football coach jeffrey tambor horribly wasted there is little way of actual progress there is no urgency the situation little tension or laughs are involved the humor is completely inconsistent after many of the jokes the theater was so silent could have heard fly sneeze you continue await some momentum in the story something that could possibly revive the slow pace moment like that never arises williamson also does handsome job of wasting some of the key supporting players including the talented mckean and larry sanders vet tambor and the beautiful vivica fox has one lifeless scene as caring guidance counselor and then williamson disposes of her character entirely on the plus side holmes and coughlan are admirable the latter giving frighteningly believable exorcism impression and molly ringwald has an amusing cameo appearance as substitute teacher while everything is pretty lifeless teaching mrs tingle remains watchable there are few promising ideas that pop up now and again but anything remotely interesting is squandered the inane script mirren is easily the best reason keep watching she is convincingly evil and fun watch but even her gifted delivery cannot save individual scenes that flounder in boredom if there is one word for the movie surrounding her it would be disappointing basically kevin williamson is his worst enemy here his uneventful direction prevents any aspects of his screenplay be appreciated not that his writing here is especially good we will see when rookie screenwriter ehren kruger writes the third installment in the scream franchise this christmas whether williamson is for real

a that means well but is too pushy in promoting its belabored point and too sentimental be compelling as drama it is jeroen krabb melodrama about community of jews in antwerp in who cannot forget their bitter past the heroine is an attractive carefree nonreligious yearold chaja fraser who wants forget her jewish roots getting involved in student demonstrations screwing student rebel leader and living her gentile friends away from her nagging mother gebrecht and her selfabsorbed eccentric father schell her parents are survivors of the holocaust concentration camps and her home life is filled angst her mother is in denial about the past always busying herself cooking soup and baking cakes and complaining about everything while her father is more openly loving but has recently been absorbed in searching for two suitcases filled mementos family album silverware and his old violin he buried them in garden during the war while fleeing the nazis but cannot locate them now due all the changes in the city out of frustration after quitting her job as dishwasher and facing eviction from her apartment she reluctantly accepts job as nanny an hasidic couple that an old man in her parents apartment building mr apfelschnitt topol tells her about the hasidics are ultraorthodox they do not go the cinema or watch tv adhere strict dress codes and strictly observe their religious laws chaja is at first put off the way they expect her follow their rules but soon finds the wife mrs kalman rossellini be kind and she becomes attached one of her children yearold named simcha monty who does not talk the stern mr kalman krabb is not friendly her and considers her be whore because of the way she dresses hammer home the point of how antisemitism has not gone away there is barrage of overdone and uninvolving scenes sneering concierge bradley who keeps making nasty remarks about jews and tries make things inconvenient for them preventing the jewish family from using the elevator the is done in its hamfisted script as the story adapted from carl friedmans book the shovel and the loom goes from one false note another until it gets lost in all the goo of its sentimentality it starts off telling chajas story of how she is lost jewess trying find her identity then her nanny role as she loves mute child stuck in an insulated environment and then it makes it story about the lingering effects of the bitter past that cannot be forgotten the effort seemed heavyhanded as the kept delivering too many obvious messages that it ponderously kept delivering through the stock characters the supporting cast consists of all wooden characters who give their roles cartoonish flavoring chajas parents are given no human shades while the janitor villain was particularly annoying role that was onedimensional and falsely acted the only ones who fought through the script and showed some feelings were fraser whose effervescent face was expressive of both the trying times she was going through and the joys she felt but most admirably showing how she could be so mistaken as think that she could forget her roots while rossellini gave warm performance of woman suffering in silence but is strong in accepting her faith topols reassuring performance as the wise man who says all the right things fraser acts as the true voice of the filmmaker in explaining all the sufferings common sense the brazenly uses little simcha get across its agenda of pointing out how the patriarchal world can be cruel when it cannot love it starts out showing how under chajas loving care he is taken the duck pond and soon starts jabbering away beginning saying quack quack and then going on ask the four questions during passover seder but showing how the boy is so terrified of his strict father that he wets his pants in his presence refuses speak because of his stern dad and eventually becomes the victim of tragic accident the thereby exploits the boys sufferings and his story just becomes tiresome and not sincerely done felt did not just see movie but attended lecture for the whole minutes of this serious but unappetizing story it was the kind of movie that you hoped would somehow end soon as it seemed be in the habit of rehashing its same viewpoint unnecessarilythe message it keeps sending was already received in the last shot where father and daughter are hopelessly digging for the lost luggage one has the impression that no one in the learned anything about themselves or the past that seems strange since thought that was what this was supposed be about unless was mistaken and the films real aim was make us cry over simcha

the tagline for this is some houses are just born bad so did not expect too much from this but had preserved little spark of ope as entered the theatre thought liam neeson cathrine zeta jones and jan de bont thought mabe it will be fun and in fact the beginning was rather intriguing but the end of it thought why liam neeson and cathrine zeta jones jan de bont these great actors are basically helpless this muddled mess that defies any rationality here is the story in the monstrously overdecorated mansion known as hill house visitors are tricked an unknown doctor liam neeson into being guinea pigs in fright experiment under the guise of an insomnia investigation among them is sophisticated bisexual cathrine zeta jones cynical dope owen wilson and gentle and emotional lady lily taylor actually the doctor is researching the primordial fear reaction and intends plant disturbing ideas in his subjects and watch what happens but he gets unexpected help from the house itself it rumbles hums and belches forth remarkable sights portals become veiny stainedglass eyeballs fireplace guarded stone lions gapes like sinister mouth filmy cherubic spirits take shape under sheets and billowy curtains but the computerized spooketeria rarely feels real placing an emotional wall between audience and screen the second half of the is basically about the main heroine running back and forth from the sinister lamps and evil furniture is that exciting or what the worst thing about it is that it did not have be bad it is based on great book the haunting of hill house shirley jackson adaptation of the book was scary and intelligent it played the greatest fears of our sub conscience the blair witch project that cost less than an old car managed shock and terrify the audiences from their senses and mill budget de bont and screenwriter david self make hash out of perfectly lovely piece of terror de bont has style of filmmaking so out of line the material that it is in itself frightening he is the master of the extravagant special effect and the big visual adrenaline rush but why give him more serious material in the end haunting will only haunt its fledgling studio dream works skg and de bonts career as director yet it would not be fair say that everything is bad the effects are truly impressive and the house is wonderfully decorated beautiful mysterious magical and spooky but this is where the good things end the music is blaring the floors moving the ceiling morphing and the pictures on the walls screaming and all of this every second every moment of screen time is absolutely without life it is nothing more than special effectsextravaganza visually impressive but intellectually hollow thriller that simply does not engage at first you do not know what is going on is this part of the experiment are these hallucinations projections of the subconscience paranoia but in the end it shows out that this is actually happening the house is actually possessed it is at that point when all your hopes for good entertainment disappears out of the window for ever sat in anticipation for decent climax and that is what got believe hichock once said that it is better wait for climax than see one this may be true and it might actually work but there is only one problem jan de bont is not hichock and the things that he shows are not scary only stupid they are impossible take seriously any paralells that you might have heard before linking this picture kubricks the shining are absolutely baseless shining had class style story acting but most of all talent and originality haunting has only special effects and art direction boast of and those elements alone are not enough make it good casting good actors for small pale parts only makes things worse but guess that no matter what or other critics say or write most of you will see this anyway even if the tagline would say some films are just born stupid

porter stoddard warren beatty is successful architect married successful fabric designer ellie diane keaton for twentyfive years they and best friends mona goldie hawn and griffin garry shandling are about face marital crises in most well known for its torturous path the screen town and country town and country has pedigree befitting it is title an all star cast photographed oscar nominated cinematographer william fraker and mouthing the words of screenwriter buck henry the graduate under the direction of peter chelsom funny bones after years of reports of budget overruns and reshoots and the racking up twelve different release dates the media has been prepped for beattys next ishtar so is it that bad the answer is no but it is not very good either the major problem town and country is that it is unstructured and random stoddard is immediately established as philanderer having just bedded flaky cellist nastassja kinski next scene finds him and ellie celebrating their anniversary in paris mona and griffin then mona spies griffin hustling redhead into motel and begins divorce proceedings buck henry cameos as both couples divorce lawyer ellie thinks she is overeacting but sends porter support mona on trip check out her familys mississippi manse the two childhood friends end up in bed together making us wonder why they would never become couple begin back home their second coupling is interrupted ellie bursting in tell mona she thinks porters cheating on her porter goes off on trip griffin sun valley idaho have more comic misadventures wacky women as griffin attempts tell him that he is gay the four friends along every woman porters dallied all end up back in new york city somewhat happily ever after although the begins promisingly resembling woody allen take on new york city wasps too many strands drift off into nowhere the stoddard household is huge containing two adult children josh hartnett the virgin suicides and tricia vessey kiss the girls their colorful bedmates and maid who is just imported her shirtless boyfriend from the rainforest back home after an amusing early scene that has porter overhearing three bouts of lovemaking while in search of nocturnal snack the six supporting players are dropped except for an outofnowhere appearance the formerly forgotten son porters romantic misadventures women other than mona are equally mishandled once the marital discord begins the seems as if it was editted machete stopping and starting never regaining its rhythm while beatty gets off few tart observations his character is mostly passive and bemused maybe we are supposed feel sympathy for an adulterer who does not initiate his own sex romps keatons ellie has trusting nature that is result of her own self involvement resulting in an unlikeable character hawn smartly recycles her mature sex kitten wives of the out of towners and the first wives club while shandlings relegated true second banana status kinski is bland and unmotivated andie macdowell takes weirdly unappealing role and does what she can the screenplays most bizarre subplot finds charlton heston as her rifle toting billionaire daddy and marian seldes as her alcoholic wheelchairbound foulmouthed mother heston and seldes are fun as is jenna elfman as sun valley bait and tackle salesgirl who brings porter and griffin halloween party oscar nominatored cinematographer william fraker gives the nice look but director chelsom shows none of the quirkily and blackly humorous depth he brought films like hear my song and funny bones the script is this films weakest link it is telling that most of the few laughs come from oldfashioned physical slapstick and the sight of beatty in bear suit while town and country is not exactly painful sit through it mostly just lays there

there have been bad films in recent years mr magoo was far the worst ever made the spectacularly bad blue in the face the horrible baby genuises and now woke up early the day died it may not however be the worst movie made but it certainly ranks as one bad movie the films acting if that is what you want call it is well mediocre me loaded sensational cast you would think that the cast would at least save the bit boy was wrong after escaping from mental institution the thief played billy zane goes out in the real world and finds that it is pretty harsh and gritty he turns burglary survive robs loan back kills the loan officer and runs thousands countrywide man hunt is on for him catch him and bring him down he ends up in cemetery where he puts his money in coffin keep it for later comes back and realizes that someone took it and put it somewhere now he is determined kill all the visitors at the funeral earlier that day until he gets his money back ultimately leading finale that is less that satisfying was based on longlost script ed wood have only one question no dialogue only music and movement where exactly is the point the moves along at rather slow pace but does have one advantage the soundtrack is catchy and vibrant except the first song can be offensive some it opens fun innovative opening credits sequence and quickly goes downhill after that some of the low points are when the thief steals womans purse and then she faints sandra bernhard as dancer and tippi hendren as deaf woman whom the thief kills the music of psycho come on people get some new ideas already what is even worse is that the has no plot at all well certain extent it does but who cares the time the middle of the arrives we are bored out of our mind and ready for something fun and exciting happen woke up early the day died is perfectly bad it shows us how low filmmakers get sometimes just when desperate make movie even the huge cast talent the is waste of my time and certainly waste of yours

it would be hard choose the best american political thriller some people would probably pick the manchurian candidate and others myself included would pick seven days in may both those films were tense exercises in chills the two films came out within two years of each other and both were directed the same man john frankenheimer but that was and respectively for most of the rest of his career frankenheimer has turned out some decent films but has shown little of the promise that those two thrillers showed each of those films had memorable characters and tense plot they had almost nothing in the way of chases or gunplay the thrills all came from the plot ronin is like made another man somewhere behind all the shooting and explosions and car chases there are the rudiments ofa plot but we see only tiny pieces of it we get clue here and one there as what is going on but d zeiks screenplay is bit obscure the begins explaining that ronin is masterless samurai when samurai has failed in the job of protecting his master from death he becomes ronin much like gunfighter in the american west if you miss the opening do not worry this will explain again what ronin is sam played robert de niro is the modern equivalent of ronin he is free agent who seems have really good instincts about how stay alive the world of professional killer he clearly was in dangerous business at one time and now he seems be drifting around on his own somewhere in france sam is recruited from montmartre bar dierdre natascha mcelhone of the truman show an irish woman be part of an action steal mysterious metal case dierdre is very tightlipped about what is in the case sam joins team of four others vincent jean reno of the professionalleon and mission impossible spence sean bean tvs richard sharpe and also patriot games and goldeneye and gregor stellan skarsgard of breaking the waves and good will hunting also along is larry skipp suddeth the group seems know their business particularly sam but each is in his own way cold and professional his own field of expertise their only human side seems be in tensions among the members of the team the story is not very easy follow it is never clear who is doublecrossing whom and who is working for whom somehow russians who may or may not be the russian mafia and irish radicals are involved trying get their hands on certain metal case some very good actors are involved in this one wonders what they saw in the script the characters are mostly onedimensional professional killers they know their work and seeing their thought patterns adds some interest the but for this group deep feeling between two people is teaming up another killer so that neither is killed the end of the we never really got know anybody maybe that is the secret of why such good actors took parts since these are not very demanding characters create in addition the above characters the also features jonathan pryce and michael lonsdale the latter of moonraker and of the superior thriller the day of the jackal as revival of sort of action that was popular in the i was hoping that there would be something here grab onto and enjoy unfortunately there are no deep characters and little make us care who eventually ends up the metal case or why they want it rate ronin on the scale and on the scale nonspoiler incidentally the tale of the ronin has been filmed multiple times usually under the title chushingura or as the ronin also one frequently sees in japanese art the image of man breaking down door huge mallet this is the first blow of the ronin

the main problem martin lawrences pet project thin line between love and hate like any fatal attraction variation where the protagonist is man is that his character is an irresponsible jerk and if that is the case it does not seem do anything except justify the womans actions that is especially the case in lawrences darnell wright he is one of those macho guys women lined up mile long now do not think condone this just because am male my philosophy is if you are one of the few heterosexual males lucky enough get your hands on beautiful kind girl you should treat her like princess and respect her darnell does not think like this he sleeps these girls once and dumps them and the period in the he discovered that his newest target beautiful wealthy brandi web played nicely whitfield who runs successful real estate business is out kill him for dumping her for his childdhood friend mia king found myself thinking am supposed feel sorry for this guy after all it is largely darnells fault if he is lining up all these women you would think he would have enough common sense think it would backfire on him one day as his mother says it does but he does not so you get the sense that he is not only irresponsible but also pretty dumb you especially get this sense that he is dumb after brandi tells him she killed her husband for allegedly abusing her would put my pants on in two seconds after that now brandi is psycho bitch but it is hard not agree what she says darnell during the finale about guys like him treating her like garbage one final flaw though is letting brandi fall for darnell begin brandi is classy intelligent woman an mba from harvard who initally resists darnells immature play as she calls it as any woman like her would in real life but all of sudden she says yes but when you listen darnells four letter word vocabulary watch his actions you wonder why such an intelligent woman would fall for guy like darnell period much less have such an unhealthy obsession for him lawrence can be good when he wants but in order prove it he needs let other people write and direct his movies look at this movie four writers as result it is too long two hours when it could have easily worked at ninety minutes and it has lot of subplots and characters that appear and disappear as quickly as they came makes me think the writers did not get along all of is not necessary there are some bright spots though whitfield regina king della reese and bobby brown all do what they can lazily written parts and they help it out lot and there are some funny parts like for example the scene where reese attempts fight whitfeld for harrassing her son and damaging her property but they are just not enough sustain the

capsule lesbianism examined in the same hushed and reverential tones reserved for terminal illness potentially interesting idea made stagy and boring claire of the moon is such an impossibly serious and sober movie that was waiting for someone sneeze just break the ice it is perfect example of what my wife calls an f movie where f means so ing earnest movies like this need wit and brashness be absorbing claire is one strained speech after another written delivered all of the energy and spontenaity of dmv clerk claire takes two women claire and noel both writers and throws them together in the same cabin at womenonly writers retreat claire wrights light comedy while noel is scholarly authority on porn and sexual behavior obviously the two of them are going have plenty talk about and for the entire one hundred and twelve insufferable minutes of this movie that is all they do talk the movie sets up its microscopic plot beatadeadhorseintoglue obviousness the evening talks at the camp are chaired motherly type named maggie selfprofessed lesbian and when noel owns up also being lesbian claire looks like she is been hit sockful of wet sand the movie then quickly degenerates into lots of scenes where noel glances at claire significance and claire looks out over the water reflectively ugh the most amazing thing about the movie is how people so intelligent can talk so much and yet get so little through their thick heads all of this of course leads up scene of complete inevitability claire and noel in scene that should have come an hour earlier because then the movie ends without even the benefit of reflection about what is just happened we never get hint about how any of this has changed anyone only how they felt about things that did not even happen yet the problem claire is not lesbianism as such but the leaden way it is handled why is it that any serious better word would be adult or at least thoughtful examination of sex in movie almost always winds up producing movie that is unwatchably boring the way this movie deals lesbianism we might as well be watching an overheated docudrama about aids many other movies have used the same subject in ways that are thousand times better more engaging more creative more intellectually and artistically interesting look at john sayles lianna or the interesting and littleseen desert bloom both of them have more life and vibrancy than claire what this movie needed was good swift kick in the pants

the great actor james woods once said and am paraphrasing if sex is not messy then you are not doing it right truly profound statement and one that could be made for the entire mad slasher genre just replace sex your mad slasher for those uninformed souls the mad slasher genre or subgenre is melding of horror and exploitation elements put the service of plot that follows an identical outline usually masked but always crazed killer stalks and kills attractive teens la halloween urban legend is mad slasher flick but one that is so sanitary bloodless and nudity free that its irony laden dialogue and beautiful though not overly talented cast it more closely resembles an overlong wb television special for makers gore is one of the two weapons they have at their disposal in stale frightfree horror movie as stephen king once said again paraphrasing if you cannot scare your audience gross em out if you cannot do that make em laugh alas urban legend succeeds only at the latter though not intention actually find the fact that this became minor success million domestic box office gross more frightening than anything in it it seems that audiences tastes have been whittled down such degree that any movie even claiming be scary is given the benefit of the doubt the promotion for urban legend sure promised thrills but how can anyone three digit iq argue that it provides them unfortunately these kinds of flicks will continue be produced because people no longer have expectations one idiotic superhyped blockbuster flick after another has desensitized audiences the point where films do not need do anything more than promise good time without the added pressure of delivering if anyone disagrees would love for them explain the box office successes of shit like batman and robin wild wild west and godzilla but forget all that it goes without saying that mad slasher films or any other exploitation offshoot will be made without an ounce of craft especially considering the sheer volume that are produced allow me present you the real fault of the mad slasher the lack of enthusiastic exploitation these flicks are not harnessed any lofty aspirations so why not break free and give your audience bloody good time sadly out of the literally hundreds made would estimate that maybe three are at all worth while and urban legend would certainly not be included amongst those three despite its considerable production value and the absence of any boom mics slipping into frame it is just as awful as any no budget entry in the slasher sweepstakes as far as the possibility of some good natured exploitation urban legends setting alone offers myriad of promising possibilities it takes place on college campus is always an appropriate playground for the crazed killer you see the campus is community made up almost entirely of young people all in the midst of strange hormonal surges percolating beneath the surface all those young people are growing up together going through all kinds of inexplicable emotional highs and lows so naturally some weirdness is expected all the better for that elusive crazed killer coupled the copious amounts of scantily clad coeds running around and the introduction of little exploitation into the proceedings should be relatively easy task but alas urban legend is not only idiotic and clich full it is way too clean slasher flick for the whole family no nudity little gore and much stupidity this is the kind of movie where the killer drags dead victims from the scene of the crime for no reason other than dunno exercise it is the kind of movie where the villain calmly purses runninglikethewindprey yet still manages catch that prey through some really awful editing techniques it is the kind of movie where characters run into each other just as loud clash reverberates on the soundtrack really wish filmmakers would just retire that whole loudnoisejumpscare thing yes the audience jumps momentarily frightened but would not anyone if loud sonic boom suddenly infiltrated quiet room lost all hope for the possibility of any genuine scares in urban legend about ten minutes in when caught glimpse of the killer apparently filmmakers are running out of creative ways disguise their mad slashers in scream it was ghost mask scary enough in know what you did last summer it was fisher mans rain slicker in the middle of summer no less and in urban legend the disguise sinks the level of mel brooks parody the villain wears an oversized parka fury hood ooh scary intended conceal hisher identity for urban legend humbly suggest donald duck costume though must admit urban legend does have winning premise for what could have been somewhat entertaining exploitation the films killer slices and dices comely college students the tune of famous urban legends you know like the babysitter gets threatening phone calls only find that they are coming from inside the house will not spoil the surprise as what urban legends are used after all the does offer fine am cable viewing if you happen be intoxicated enough sad say it does not include my favorite urban legend fairly graphic antidote concerning richard gere and very unhappy gerbil now that would be scary before leave you would like bring your attention the third most irritating thing about the the first being the lack of craft the second the lack of exploitation its characters all of whom are just about the most annoying group of people have ever spent an evening only jared leto looking like carbon copy of rob lowe from back in the day and alicia witt as the resilient heroine avoid vexatiousness the most annoying of the bunch is tie between noxima girl rebecca gayheart and sitcom star michael rosenbaum as supremely irritating lout so irritating actually cheered his painful death and am not cruel person ironically those aggravating sacks of human waste provide the only entertainment in the if viewed as vicarious fantasy urban legend can be mildly entertaining after all this is movie that features the kind of faux hipsters cannot stand getting slaughtered is at least better than watching an entire about people cannot stand not getting slaughtered

the premise of turbulence is am sure very familiar us all we have seen it before in passenger executive decision and countless other flicks that are good in there own way you know terrorists take over plane ask the police on the ground for what they what and so on turbulence starts out convict ray liotta being accused of crime you think there is no way he could have done it he is so open and kind he is taken in and is subsequently transported on commerical plane la this is already problem there is no way that convicts would be transported on the same commercial flight that normal passangers would be on anyway it is christmas eve and everyone is waiting get la and spend christmas eve there well convict one manages stop the flight in its proverbial tracks and liotta still as calm as ever takes the other convict out he also has eyes for lauren holly flight attendent and seems grow closer her the plot stops here did not like this movie because it seemed be rip off of every other airplane movie have ever seen at one point mr liotta looked exactly like jack nicholson in the shining am serious it was like they stole for every other movie down t the only reason did not give this stars is because it had some okay stunts do not even bother

a movie laced good blend of action comedy and heavy dose of musical celebrity guest appearances sounds pretty gourmet but even the best ingredients can be thrown together in the wrong way creating dismal and unsatisfactory product eighteen years after the blues brothers hit theaters blues brothers is being unleashed minus half of its original duo the late john belushi and nearly all of its original charm dan aykroyd reprises his role as well as his cowriting credit as elwood blues the sharp dressed con man who wreaked havoc on selfproclaimed mission from god along his brother jake and their blues brothers band nearly eighteen years ago as we begin elwood is being released from state penitentiary along the news of his brothers death in prison years ago completely on his own elwood decides trace his roots back the orphanage where he spent his childhood only discover that everyone he has ever known has passed away but elwood is not completely without family it seems he has halfbrother of sorts not real brother mind you just the illegitimate child of his bluesman pseudofather curtis cab calloway from the first who has also passed on despite inklings from mother superior mary stigmata kathleen freeman do otherwise elwood seeks out his only remaining family in an effort start up an all new blues brothers band working as police commander cabel chamberlain joe morton has an immediate disliking for elwood who nonchalantly fills cab in on his mothers affair years ago and then goes on steal his wallet following elwood around is the lonely orphan buster evan bonifant who quickly learns become minielwood when bartender mighty mack mcteer john goodman joins the group the blues brothers band is complete and once again the group travels the country crashing cars blowing things up and obstructing peace more than just solid blues rock meanwhile cabs personal vendetta against elwood leads him on an impassioned manhunt for his nexttonextofkin from this point the movie turns into series of music videos few bits of acting in between those hoping for an interesting andor funny yarn are given too many musical interludes while those heavily interested in the music are given too much of story only the extremely avid blues fans should attempt getting thru these two hours for those people it may be worth it for luckily there is much more music than shoddy attempts at acting but when the story does intrude upon the festivities the is heavily bogged down unfunny jokes musicians turned stiff actors and the pointless year old buster attempting add some sort of home alone cuteness the whole thing appearances musical legends such as aretha franklin james brown eric clapton and whole slew of others are the high points of the but they also confirm why these people are musicians and not actors blues brothers is deserving of one whole star simply because if you really really love this kind of music you might kind of sort of like this movie many many scenes are nauseatingly unfunny and if you do not have passion for very deep bluesrock you will be bored out of your skull much of this seems nothing more than aykroyds selfserving vanity project but no matter how much fun aykroyd may be having this none of the excitement is passed on the audience and seeing three guys in threepiece suits goofily dancing around poker faces can only be funny for so long unfortunately those two seconds are over about fifteen minutes into the

if only austin powers the spy who shagged me had been just half as original zany silly and totally enjoyable as its predecessor it would have easily been one of this summers biggest pleasures if only in fact the spy who shagged me is the exact opposite of the original instead of refreshing the audience one clever parody after another the filmmakers bombard us usedup tired jokes taken directly from the first one take the scene where austin powers again played mike myers but only fraction of the giddy enthusiasm he displayed previously confronts henchmen on the side of cliff after being pushed off the ravine the bad guy is of course assumed dead but suddenly we hear pleading voice coming from down below he is only injured similar scene played very well in the original international man of mystery but here was insulted it did the filmmakers really believe the audience would laugh at ripoff apparently overestimated the intelligence of the average moviegoer considering that the has pulled in over million in domestic theatrical grosses alone do hear the sound of franchise heading our way having said that though still cannot deny the its merits the basic plot was delightfully silly enough sustain my interest somewhat dr evil mike myers in the second of his three roles having constructed time machine goes back the year in an attempt snatch austin powers mojo do not you just love that word whilst he is cryogenically frozen when austin gets wind of this after great intro explaining the absence of elizabeth hurleys vanessa kensington he too travels back in time reclaim his sexual drive accompanied the hottotrot felicity shagwell played heather graham this sounds stupid know but in the movie it starts make some kind of weird offthewall sense and it worked for me then there is minime verne troyer petite clone of myers dr evil exactly in size troyers persona alone gains the an extra halfstar contributing one particularly hilarious scene where he attempts nibble on his own minimr bigglesworth just try ignore the fact that at he would make dr evils height rise just over feet no matter however there are only about four hearty laughs throughout the entire hour and half the most notable being the now infamous tent scene and that just is not enough warrant even minor recommendation if there is in fact an austin powers they should just kill off secret agent powers and put the emphasis on dr evil and minime unconventional yes but there is no denying that it would make for better movie

in the series of the erotic thrillers that flooded the videoshelves in the early came this frenchcanadian coproduction max fischer the movie is set in paris where its hero struggling american author david mirkine judd nelson at the time specialised in playing losers and people at the edge of sanity suffers terrible writers bloc he manages overcome crisis after beginning romantic relationship beautiful model anabelle laurence treill unfortunately she hangs out in jet set circles gradually makes mirkine pathologically jealous her connection powerful david caravan pierce brosnan would make mirkine step the line between reason and sanity and put in motion whole series of violent and tragic events although few pseudoerotic scenes and some elements of the plot do indeed make this an erotic thriller drama would probably be more appropriate genre label pacing of the is simply too slow thrill the viewers and those patient enough sit through its entirety have wait long time between any interesting or significant developments low budget also becomes painfully visible and physical attributes of laurence treill are the only thing worth watching in this unfortunately this has too little of those supposedly erotic scenes so those who wanted watch erotic thriller have all the reasons feel disappointed instead they would have settle pointless slow scenes involving nelson brosnan and laurence treills attempts of serious acting all of those definitely not worth spending hour and half of someones precious time

tvs buffy finds herself on the other side of the supernatural spectrum in simply irresistible sarah michelle gellar that neverceasing crusader against neverending evil every tuesday night on the wb network here plays downonherluck chef suspected of dabbling in witchcraft after her flailing restaurant receives help in the form of magically scrumptious meals taste test results some vampire slaying though out of place would have really livened this excruciating movie up simply irresistible is actually quite easy deny disaster of culinary and other proportions pretty much from the opening on gellars amanda finds herself falling for harried henri bendel exec tom sean patrick flannery of powder around the same time she discovers an uncanny ability mystically manifest emotions in her cooking secret ingredient that arouses both his interest in her and the publics in her tiny tribeca eatery all this love and sorcery have lot do the telekinetic crab that also figures into the story tale that at times plays like an american spin on mexican classic like water for chocolate several differences one like water did not have telekinetic crab and two like water was good simply irresistible on the other hand is about as challenging as an easybake oven amateurishly staged scenes cancel each other out in their badness from an embarrassing seduction in literal vanilla fog an impromptu dance sequence where tom and amanda do their best fred and ginger though fred and ginger never took part in anything this garish the intrusive musical score distracts from the flat dialogue at regular intervals but it is not like you are were going miss much in fact take away the few instances of salty language and this has madefordisney channel written all over it but majority of simply irresistible resistibility factor has less do the aforementioned overkill than the bland leads tom and amanda are so thin and ambiguously defined that there is just no fun rooting for their inevitable happily ever after nor do the otherworldly powers that serve bring them together make sense so we are left hohum relationship based on enchanted eclairs it is not going last long people perhaps sensing this the filmmakers have piled on weird supporting characters for acting vets like betty buckley dylan baker and patricia clarkson but they do not go anywhere either in fact nothing in simply irresistible goes anywhere save for gellar and she does not go somewhere so much as you wish she would go _somewhere_ like better movie already proving major talent relatively few big and smallscreen roles she is the sole reason this overcooked souffle is not completely fit for the garbage disposal looking smashing in her todd oldhamdesigned duds and investing much more in her perfunctory part than she ever gets in return it is certainly dish best not served in it is current condition but one can only guess that without gellar simply irresistible would be strictly unwatchable

the th warrior reeks so badly of melodrama and poor acting that it carries worst scent than canines least appetizing residue the best part of the would be close contest between the closing credits and brief moment in the middle where the screen goes entirely white and you hope that the has slipped and caught ablaze in the projector my vote goes for the ending credits where you can start trying put the awful experience behind you ibn fahdlan antonio banderas is an important official who is banished from his home for sleeping another mans wife he encounters group of norse warriors who convince him join them on mysterious journey be taken men fahdlan is chosen as the th and last warrior in moment that is so desperately overacted and overdone that numerous persons at the screening attended broke out into laughter the movie proves be new low point for banderas who is acting seems closer that of his role as the lover and caretaker for dying gay man in philadelphia than that of warrior in the films supposed pay off scene he exclaims was wrong these are not men line intended be the most memorable quote of the production unfortunately banderas delivers it in fashion that makes chevy chases career look like oscar material the based on michael crichtons best selling novel eaters of the dead was shot under that name some three years ago and after numerous rewrites not only does the dialogue seem completely phony but the plot is incredibly difficult follow at the same time the th warrior makes you think about numerous questions questions like why do the characters always have perfect lighting on them even when it is pitch dark why does no one ever have blood cover both sides of their face but rather just one side and finally will the manager give me refund minutes into the minute man invites of the warriors come me there is woman who can help unfortunately there is nothing that could help this the most appropriate ending would have been for the men join hands form chorus line and break into rendition of springtime for hitler

i have heard it called jaws claws and that is fair summation of the plot though that tag line does little quantify quality director stephen hopkins blown away predator and screenwriter william goldman maverick misery would have you believe that this is an epic historical drama about man against nature based on what really happened in africa the railroad workers trying build bridge the th century they have stacked the deck two big stars val kilmer michael douglas bigger production design beautiful photography academy award winner vilmos zsigmond and score so overblown that it makes the lion king soundtrack sound like chamber music the movie does not make lick of sense though either as an epic or as your basic boofest in fact some of the bits are so laughably ludicrous that you may think you have stumbled into the sequel mystery science theater the movie how about the three guys rifles who trap lion and then cannot even hit the damned thing or the hamonwry acting of michael douglas who chews more scenery than the animals ever do or my favorite lions so agile that they can even climb onto rooftops

billy crystal reappears in yet another high concept comedy he tries infuse some life into it but it gets bogged down sentimentality and lack of sophistication sammy billy crystal is struggling agent at the end of his ropes he is separated from his wife serena kathleen quinlan and down his last serious client in lowbudget shooting in romania but in turn of bad luck sammy wrecks his car only be mysteriously saved giant gheorghe muresan but this giant has heart of gold he leads solitary life helping out the monks at local monastery his only longing is for his long lost love lilianna joanna pacula who has since moved america sammy seeing golden ticket convinces max become an actor represented sammy of course and come back america and so sam and max bounce from pathetic job pathetic job sammy dangling meeting lilianna as carrot before maxs nose but slowly sammys deceptions begin haunt him but will he develop conscience before the innocent max becomes disillusioned the humor in my giant is not the worlds greatest mostly it falls under the category of boy he is so big and that can only go so far no matter how hard the talent tries still its slightly amusing parts are longed for when the movie gets bogged down in sappy moments the films best moment and that is not saying much is bit part steven seagal playing himself between executive decision and this all of seagals best roles have been cameos maybe he should consider change of work steven seagal the character actor gheorghe muresan is not natural actor at all and his thick cottonmouthed accent certainly does not help in fact the only thing he adds the role is his immense stature originally the concept was designed several years ago for andre the giant andre also had hefty accent but he displayed knack for comedy in the princess bride something muresan should have studied for some pointers why does billy crystal continually get caught in these pathetic comedies he is proven that he can be much funnier than these formulaic films allow him be and yet like glutton for punishment he keeps coming back that does not mean we have

movies can do the two big es very well educate and entertain in the best of all possible worlds they accomplish both on the red planet they fail entirely in the near future manned mission is sent mars observe primitive plant growth this does remarkable job of demonstrating exactly how exciting watching algae grow would be after some mumbojumbo about an ecological disaster on earth and an interminable wait reach the fourth planet the ship falls apart almost as fast as the movie does the ground crew of people you could not care less about is trapped on the surface without food water or air and stalked deadly rogue cyberdog the one potentially interesting character carrieanne moss spends her time alone in the orbiting ship talking computer attempting graft esque space mysticism terminator robot horror first time director antony hoffman cannot seem figure out what is going on neither can we did not he have anyone who could step back from the shooting and make sure there was coherent story could not he have used the money saved only having pay half dozen actors hire scriptwriter there are so many missteps every opportunity create dynamic tension is thwarted plot holes and lackluster direction why introduce the theme of faith vs science if the crewman who could comment on it disappears early only die _offscreen_ the audience begins the waiting for something happen two hours later they are still waiting despite our greatest hopes there is no life on the red planet

alexander dumas the three musketeers is one of the most oftenadapted literary works and for good reason the swashbuckler is legend rather than just story perhaps the musketeer new that reimagines the novel in the spirit and style of the matrix is one adaptation too many it is just awful spiritless silly and unforgivably boring transforming the timeless classic into mishmash of oldastime clich and incoherent repetitive action sequences this time dartagnan is played calvin klein model justin chambers who cannot even pronounce his characters name as boy he watched his father get killed febre tim roth lackey of powerhungry cardinal richelieu he vowed have vengeance after undergoing intense training under an expert swordsman he goes looking for his enemy on his quest he embroils himself in struggle for control at the highest levels of the french government the royal musketeers have lost their gusto what their jobs being taken over the cardinals own guards only few loyal swashbuckers remain among them athos and portos who are only figureheads in this movie together dartagnan they fight extricate the queen catherine deneuve from the traps that febre and richelieu are trying plant oh and as an afterthought dartagnan falls in love the poor maid at the local inn mena suvari just thought would mention that now look do not know whose idea this was but whoever is responsible deserves severe tonguelashing have nothing against modernizing classic works of literature at the very least they can inspire viewers actually read the book but films as dull as this have no positive side effects director peter hyams known for such masterpieces of modern cinema as timecop and end of days has jettisoned everything that was great about dumas masterwork the sense of excitement cause and camaraderie instead we get impressively choreographed but somehow vacuous uninvolving action sequences that emerge from emptiness and lead nothing when the musketeers finally get holler all for one and one for all could have sworn that was dumas rolling in his grave that felt maybe the reason for the utter lack of suspense here is the hyamss tone is unreasonably dark and brooding when you consider the readers digest condensed version of the story that he gives us it is as though anything that may have been construed as fun was purposely expunged from the production the joylessness of the proceedings from the oppressively shady lighting the mechanical fight scenes can be felt in every frame chambers cannot act suvari roth and deneuve can but are not given the chance and when push comes shove the use of stunt doubles is distractingly obvious though at least roth gets play villain without having wear an ape suit some movies seem sloppy and careless clearly made for quick buck the musketeer we get the sense that it was meticulously crafted be awful the is intricate stylish and precise hitting the wrong note every single time

in this remake of the japanese monster godzilla is transformed into jurassic park copy who swims from the south pacific new york for no real reason and trashes the town although some of the destruction is entertaining for while it gets old fast the often makes no sense severalhundred foot tall beast hides in subway tunnels sports secondrate effects the baby godzillas seem be one computer effect multiplied on the screen lame jokes mayor ebert and his assistant gene are never funny horrendous acting even matthew broderick is dull and an unbelievable love story why would anyone want get back together maria pitillos character there are other elements of the that fall flat but going on would just be waste of good words only for diehard creature feature fans this might be fun if you could check your brain at the door could not michael redman has written this column for years and has seldom had more disorienting cinematic experience than seeing both fear and loathing and godzilla in the same evening

when first saw the preview for cruel intentions turned my friend and said dangerous liaisons for kids it was clear me that the would be an obvious chunk of plagiarized nonsense owing everything it is stephen frears masterpiece imagine my surprise see that writerdirector roger kumble has given credit his source material choderlos de laclos is recognized for his novel les liaisons dangereuses in the opening credits and was impressed in fact was much more impressed this recognition than the actual is an appalling excuse for movie it is kiddieporn hackwork complete earthy sextalk and fullyclothed handjobs suppose this kind of movie was inevitable all the teen highschool angst movies coming out there was certainly room for pretentious and laughable movie about bunch of teenagers who think they are smarter and more beautiful than all the other people on earth combined cruel intentions is mess in every possible way and it fails primarily in the way expected it hated all the characters and hate everything they do also hate ryan phillippe so perhaps my opinion is not as objective as it could be phillippe plays check out this name sebastian valmont wow is not that memorable name could just say it over and over again sebastian valmont it kind of rolls off the tongue in the spirit of phrases like sanguine vapors and velvet sandwich sebastian valmont is the coolest guy who ever walked the earth there is no woman he cannot have no material object out of his reach he has all the money all the sex all at his fingertips and luckily his parents never enter into his life no in the world of cruel intentions adults do not really exist the ones who do are irritating sebastian valmont lives his stepsister kathryn merteuil sarah michelle gellar the bitchqueen of the universe and also the woman every man wants since these two rich kids are so bored they only thing they can do is challenge each other meaningless sexual liaisons kathryn wants sebastian valmont devirginize cecile caldwell selma blair naive dorkchick who has somehow wronged kathryn but it is too easy for sebastian valmont he wants nail annette hargrove reese witherspoon the paradigm of chastity and beauty so sebastian valmont and kathryn make deal is too explicit state here but dear god sebastian valmont actually begins fall for poor annette hargrove dangerous liaisons is great movie because the characters are all believable and because of its masterful acting cruel intentions is bad for many reasons but it lacks both believable characters and masterful acting kathryn merteuil is simply hateful witch girl so loathsome that would probably enjoy pouring hot lead on her she is supposed be mean but glenn close gave the character some depth in dangerous liaisons gellar while aesthetically pleasing is onedimensional and utterly repulsive witherspoon has truly beautiful face but her character is not the moral staple she is supposed be sure she will not have sex until she is in love is this really moral issue but she does some things in the last few scenes that are more than little reprehensible but cannot forget mr phillippe who continues exceed my expectations his impenetrable invulnerable blandness have give him credit and say that he did in fact manage change his facial expression about three times during the course of cruel intentions and there is one point in the in he shouts thereby defeating my hypothesis that he is vocally monotone true he is bad but it does not help that he has no character work kumble has drained all the interesting aspects from this character leaving us sexcrazed lunatic who is supposed be sympathetic because he falls in love moral flower and shuns the wicked bitch the fails in every other way too first of all nobody talks like this even the intellectuals know do not bother this kind of pointless and pretentious yammering for while the movie looks like it might play itself for laughs but it ends up taking itself so seriously that there is no way we can join it cruel intentions also manages come off as softporn in more than one scene earlier mentioned fullyclothed handjob this occurs between kathryn and sebastian valmont both of whom are intended be hateful at this point in the movie so if we hate them then what is the point of an extended sex scene titillation of course it cannot even work under the pretense of meaningful love scene because we hate the characters it is interesting note some of the parallels between cruel intentions and dangerous liaisons kumble is clearly familiar the earlier many of the scenes have similar tone and there are moments in frears that kumble imitates almost completely such as the last scene in spoiler warning the antagonist is humiliated in front of her peers but kids do not act like this nobody acts like this in his translation roger kumble forgot character development and sympathy some pretty crucial elements the result is picture of confounding badness kiddieporn mess that thinks it is really deep and profound will give cruel intentions credit for realizing its influences but that does not change the fact that it is awful

everyone knows that old rule never work children and animals in this latest horror flick mimic case it is never work children and genetically enhanced killer animals instead as mimic features both of these and succeeds in doing nothing except mildly engaging the audience the begins in new york where we see children dying from mysterious disease is being carried cockroaches dr susan tyler sorvino creates genetically enhanced bug the judas breed however is designed kill all cockroaches the bug does it is job the cockroaches all die and the terror is gone three years later appears on the screen and we discover that the judas breed is back bigger than ever and ready kill the spin on this bug however is that it can mimic it is predator and in this case it is humans that should teach us for squishing all those bugs what should be roller coaster ride bugs everywhere tons of gory deaths and some massive set pieces instead turns out be rather subdued almost boring movie plods along at very slow pace perhaps the movie was trying be thought provoking and trying avoid the predator type movie it could easily have become if it is then the director and writers have made the wrong move because this is perfectly suited be an all out action fest the director who bought us cronos far superior directs the in calm and frankly dull movie there are few exciting sequences instead just lot of people talking if the dialogue was intelligent then it would be all right but it is sadly babbling nonsense in fact the script is embarrsingly weak and the characterizations not much better sorvino and company are as as characters come the script not bothering develop them there is some action in this but it is directed in such an annoying way it is just infuriating watch the camera cuts all over the place disoreitating the audience and instead of involving the audience in the action it merely alienates them the peformances are k if slightly below average sorvino is k although she is not very good at conveying terror or anything emotion really the supporting cast are all sterotypes characters such as big black security guard foul mouth geeky scientist spectacles and what could be the most stereotypical mexican old timer ever their reasonable good fun however mimic then may fail it is story pacing and characters but the does look good like dark city mimic is definite case of style of content it may be bit too gloomy for it is own good but the sets look nice and parts of the are directed well but looks are not good enough save mimic from the depths of mediocre somewhere where it should not really belong good opportunity then wasted shame overall rating review david wilcock

this movie tries present itself as the sequel jan de bonts debut as director surprise hit speed but the only thing the two movies have in common is sandra bullock as the female lead annie sandra bullock is in the wrong place at the wrong time again she is going on cruise her new boyfriend alex jason patric and of course it is her ship that is kidnapped john geiger willem dafoe who has bone pick the shipping line they sacked him after he got sick now he wants the diamonds stored in the ships safe for compensation that actually is the whole storyline speed could do without dialogues the movie is all about images and remarkable sound do not really know why this is called an action movie except for few scenes that are vaguely reminiscent of speed this goes along the lines of the desaster movies of the ies first we are introduced number of people who are going be important later on in the movie then desaster strikes sandra bullock was said have been glad that she could take action this time around looked for the action but could not find it most of the time she is part of the decoration the only time she is part of what happens is when she can have shot at defusing bomb and freeing some passengers trapped behind fire door now we know that she can handle chain saw we also know that fire doors on cruise ships can be cut apart in seconds the bomb defusal of course goes wrong but only the furniture is damaged not our heroes who still are needed jason patric alias alex spends most of his time flirting annie helping other passengers and frolicking in the water his initial seasickness is suddenly gone because there are ship crew and passengers be saved from evil geiger he does pretty good job but cannot blame keanu reeves for declining this part then there is willem dafoe the villain who desperately tries look as frightening as frankensteins monster he does not succeed though an untidy appearance is not enough convince the viewer of his psychopath potential before he tries again make us believe he is dangerous man he should practise for while in front of mirror cannot really recommend speed you will probably like the movie if you like funny situations that are not meant be funny especially the showdown when the ship first runs into an oil tanker and then dissembles whole village is treat there you get see the most superfluous scene in the movie in keeping last years desaster movie tradition dog is miraculously saved from certain death really funny and meant be funny scene takes place on the oil tanker right before the collision some crew members watch two ships colliding in an old movie had they looked out the window they would not have missed the huge ship racing toward them those of you who still want see the movie should pick theater large screen and good sound system enjoy the visual effects and the phantastic surround sound effects in an adequately equipped theater it is as if the explosion were going off all around you and you can feel the seats vibrate but the ilm special effects cannot save the movie for all the money they could have done better

it is tough be an aspiring superhero in champion city just ask mr furious ben stiller the blue raja hank azaria and the shoveler william macy they are trying break into the biz but captain amazing greg kinnear the citys hero numero uno hogs all the action the good captain has his own problems because he is all but eliminated crime amazings endorsement deals are falling through the public craves major slugfest so amazing engineers the parole of his onetime arch enemy casanova frankenstein geoffrey rush frankenstein succeeds beyond expectations he captures capt amazing before setting out on his scheme destroy the city so no one is left save the day but our wouldbe superheroes but their abilities are more little league than justice league the raja hurls forks at foes the shoveler hits them shovel and mr furious just yells at people stiller is doing essentially the same character he played in guest appearance on friends after painful first strike the guys hold auditions for teammates and add the bowler janeane garofalo who carries her dead fathers skull in her bowling ball invisible boy kel mitchell who can only use his powers when no one is looking at him the spleen paul reubens who blows devastating winds from his rear and the sphinx wes studi mysterious figure who will teach them fight mystery men boasts one of the most talented and eclectic casts ever assembled in addition those already mentioned the credits include lena olin as frankensteins evil shrink comedian eddie izzard and the fugees prakazrel michel as discothemed thugs singer tom waits as an inventor of superhero weapons artie lange from mad tv as another thug claire forlani from meet joe black as waitress mr furious is pursuing louise lasser from mary hartman mary hartman as the blue rajas mother and actormagician ricky jay as capt amazings manager the cast includes four oscarnominated actors when saw the list of players early last year figured the result would be cannotmiss comedy yet must report disappointment the script is probably the worst of nearly every joke misfires the stabs at comic books are too obvious be funny for example no one can recognize capt amazing in his secret identity because he is wearing glasses the fart jokes surrounding the spleen are surprisingly the only gags that work the cast tries hard especially hank azaria whose character adopts an effete british accent while in costume but the script is just too lame run

mm written seven scribe andrew kevin walker has an interesting idea is ruined formula become bog standard murder mystery nicolas cage plays family man detective tom welles who is asked upper class toff mrs christian myra carter investigate an movie found in her recently deceased husbands safe the movie happens be an mythical snuff movie where the girl featured in the appears get brutally
