eventually lands them on the remote planet of tatooine the jawas or small creatures who sell droids pick rd and cp up sell they are bought luke skywalkers mark hamill family while luke is cleaning the droids the message from princess leia is found luke finds this obiwan kenobi and learns that obiwan was friend of lukes father who is now dead luke also learns his family was jedi after lukes family is killed tropps from the dark side ben decides put luke through training stop the dark side and destroy them once and for all ben wants create new jedi first the two must find princess leia and serve her han solo played harrison ford and his sidekick chewbacca played peter mayhew are consulted about providing ship complete the tasks necessary after meeting up leia the really picks up luke continues his training as pilot and become jedi ben kenobi confronts darth vader and many other interesting events occur star wars is an amazing epic the plot is so original and amazing cannot believe it the special effects especially for its time are wonderful and realistic the space scenes in particular are the most fun watch the ships flown all are very unique and creative the costumes are also out of this world the scenery is so different from anything have ever seen before there are variety of different very memorable set pieces that will stay me forever the entire premise of star wars is amazing the creatures and droids that we see throughout the are one of kind even the human characters are different every character is extremely likable and different from characters from other sci fi films the acting on everyones part is great especially that of sir alec guinnesss even though the concept is not realistic at all it is pulled off very nicely the acting setting effects costumes and sound make it work if any of these were messed up star wars would have come off as one huge joke the ending works very well and left it very open the sequels that came afterward in early special edition of star wars was released the was remastered so it looked better than it did in few creatures were added here and there and even an entire deleted scene han solo and jabba the hutt seen in return of the jedi was added the think that is enough on may star wars episode the phantom menace will be released followed two more films that will reveal what went on before new hope this star wars is bound become the greatest tale told in our time

if you want some hearty laughs then rat race is the movie for you this unpretentious little comedy sneaks into theaters today very little hype will have you bouncing in your theater seat and while the fits neatly into the lowbrow slapstick school of comedy one refreshing aspect is its lack of meanspiritedness the plot follows group of people chosen at random an eccentric las vegas casino owner john cleese who must race from vegas bus station locker miles away in silver city m inside the locker is duffel bag containing million the first one open the locker gets the bag and the money what the group of participants does not know is that cleeses donald sinclair can do anything want am eccentric is staging the race as betting game for group of high rollers at the hotel the participants include vera whoopi goldberg and merrill lanai chapman newly reunited mother and daughter disgraced pro football referee owen templeton cuba gooding jr italian tourist mr pollini rowan atkinson randy pear jon lovitz and his family the bumbling con men duane and blaine cody seth green and vince vieluf and cynical young lawyer nick shaffer breckin meyer various amusing encounters and mishaps befall the participants en route silver city screenwriter andy breckman adds nice touch not having the racers try sabotage one another the most sidesplitting situations involve vera and merrills encounter the squirrel lady nice nutsy cameo kathy bates owens commandeering charter bus full of lucille ball lookalikes on their way lucy convention the cody brothers misadventures hotair balloon flying cow and monster truck and the pear familys stopover at barbie museum turns out not be what they think it is the pear family situation is fine example of the way breckmans script builds the laughs without going into detail this bit segues from the museum hitlers touring car eva brauns dark lipstick lovitz burning his tongue culminating at ceremony honoring world war ii veterans rat races cast is first rate cleese is wonderfully devilish and madcap lovitz is at first bit whiny but his character grows on you gooding is having fine romp and dave thomas almost steals the show as cleeses deadpan assistant man born without personality the is directed jerry zucker who knows something about comedy along his brother david and friend jim abrahams he was responsible for such hits as airplane and ruthless people throwaway subplot is good for some laughs features cleese and his buddies betting on series of outlandish situations including one dealing hooker and peptobismol this is fun little feature the only letdown comes at the finale is too touchyfeely and sweet almost negating what came before it rat race is summer sleeper but it will keep you awake as will the laughter of those watching around you

i had chance see sneak preview of city slickers ii on campus last night went in the expectation of the similar flavor made the original such success personal growth and insightful humor about life came away somewhat disappointed in this regard getting some of the latter and not much of the former the basic plot revolves around billy crystal who plays mitch robbins turning forty he is now become the station manager of the radio station in he worked in the original he is given job at the radio station his best friend played daniel stern out of sympathy while sterns character works through his divorce his loser younger brother john lovitz comes mitchs house bum money and place live all while mitch and his wife try celebrate his birthday during the celebration mitch discovers what appears be treasure map in curlys the cattle drive leader in the original played jack palance old hat after business trip las vegas crystal stern and lovitz stay few extra days go off in search of the treasure on the way they run into curlys twin brother duke played you know who jack palance first of all the cinematography was beautifully done especially the outdoor scenes in the desert the scenes are such that would like see some of those sights filmed myself there is some character development during the the actors remain true their characters and play them well without overplaying the jokes the movie is good basic adventure enough plot twists provide for an ending that is difficult predict the movie is paced well but couple slow spots in the middle and towards the end humorwise the has good number of jokes maintained my interest throughout the there are memorable moments like when stern is bitten snake but there are fewer jokes laugh at in the sequel surprise surprise for sequel right however the slight bitter aftertaste have this has do mainly the films manipulation of the audience the tries pull your heartstrings too much regarding how close the characters are each other like when mitch had decided suck the snake marrow out of his best friends butt this is done again when the gang meets up some members of the cattle drive group from the original there were also some parts appeared unrealistic like whether the stampede would start in the way it did or why they did not worry more about water while tromping around the desert some strenuous stretches of the imagination are required here since the objective of the gang is find gold and get rich unlike finding themselves in middle age like in the original also found it harder empathize the characters during their journey overall would say that the is an entertaining and humorous adventure some storyline deficiencies making it less worthy than the original it may be worth the full price of admission but matinee would be better bargain

the submarine genre of movies seems be one of the most intriguing and compelling types of storytelling there is think about it these films are completely based in reality yet only handful of people have ever been on one making them fascinating the general public they are not like movies that take place on plane or train as anybody can get on one of those and they are not like movies that happen in outer space either because no ones done any of that stuff yet when new one comes out you do not hear anyone say ugh another submarine movie like people tend say ugh another boxing movie look at modern movies that involve submarines das boot the abyss the hunt for red october crimson tide all are well regarded as topnotch entertainment gladly joining that bunch is stars matthew mcconaughey as the executive officer of u naval submarine during world war ii we learn he has been denied recommendation for his own command his superior bill paxton mcconaugheys crew then receives orders that they will be boarding disabled german submarine steal the enigma german communications encoding device that has stumped allied intelligence the mission goes horribly wrong however and as result mcconaughey and only handful of his crew as well as captured german become trapped aboard the in enemy waters the first great thing about is the films opening sequence the german crew of are under attack sets the events of the rest of the into motion it is tense exciting and fascinating and applaud the filmmakers for not copping out and instead keeping the entire sequence in german english subtitles most movies scene this long would have panicked and had the german crew speaking english right away once the plot gets moving gives us action sequence after action sequence making the audience wonder ok now how do they get out of this the stakes keep raising much like in executive decision an excellent actionthriller and even though the audience knows how the will end it is lot of fun getting there only have two minor complaints about the entire the first comes from the scenes follow the opening sequence while their purpose is introduce us the characters and get the story going they do feel as though it could have been done much quicker and less conventionally mean did we really have see the ships crew at wedding because of that you now know exactly what is going happen the groom my other gripe would be during the films finale there is an explosion ends the that is one of the weakest looking cgi effects since the presidents plane crashed into the ocean at the end of air force one cannot stress this enough until cgi effect can be made look like model effect stick using models yes is historically incorrect and there are surely some specifics in the plot that people who have been onboard submarine will tell you that could not happen but the overall point of this is entertainment it succeeds fantastically pg

we share the descent into darkness of talented boy pianist years later we see his subsequent resurfacing in the mid a damaged man walks out of rainstorm and back into the world the movie charts the causes of his mental breakdown based on the life story of david helfgott this australian is rich exploration of the pressures drilling in upon childgenius compounded the looming shadow of domineering father in the helfgott emerged as child prodigy the traces his relationship his father whose encouragement comes at the cost of demanding david have no life beyond that of the black and white keys david is offered places in the usa but his father refuses let him leave australia the effect this has upon helfgott is cleverly told via single reverse tracked shot david is sobbing on the front doorway of his music teachers house he is well lit via the external house lights his teacher is not home we pull back and see that the dark front rooms window has it is curtains open there in pool of blackness is grand piano davids fall over the dark cliff has begun instead of being told in linear mode shine jumps around in time ala pulp fiction this narrative device works well we see david as boy teenager in london and mentalpatient in various snippets the then neatly loops back for its uplifting conclusion adulthelfgotts return the light is told in linear fashion the lead role is played different actors the teenagedavid taylor and adultdavid rush standing out whilst rush is known for his tv work in australia think this is his first major cinema work his david whilst clearly damaged he keeps quoting his daddy in babbling word torrent cuddles strangers and grabs women on the breasts is both touching and funny taylors teenagedavid is the more sympathy producing role we are mute witness his gradual breakdown as the pressures just keep on building his father wants him play the very demanding rachmaninovs rd whilst his teacher wants start him simple mozart technically this is beautiful and lot of thought has gone in the production particularly like the use of slow motion and sound effects one scene has adulthelfgott happily babbling in car in the rain the sound of the windshield wipers fades up over his voice clever subtlety the wiper sound appears morph into rhythmic thumping but of the same beat the image dissolves and we realise the thumping is the slow motion applause of crowd but it is us being clapped we are youngdavid walking up the stage for our first public show the music as you would expect from of this subject matter is critical and it works very well the miming of the actors piano playing is faultless apparently rush did not mime he really did play helfgotts life is certainly not without it is sympathetic people indeed his return the normal world is accelerated his chance meetings two very special women his ultimately uplifting story is magic piece of theatre craft it shows that the help of god we can all find our way back home

today war became reality me after seeing screening of saving priivate ryan steve spielberg goes beyond reality his latest production the audience is tossed about the theatre witnessing the horror of war please keep the kids home as the rating is for reality tom hanks is stunning as capt john miller set out in france during ww ii rescue and return home soldier private ryan matt damon who lost three brothers in the war spielberg at time takes us inside the heads of these individuals as they face death during the horrific battle scenes private ryan is not for everyone but felt the time was right for movie like this be made the movie reminds us of the sacrifices made our ww ii fighting men and women we must not ever forget them as many gave the ultimate sacrifice their lives so that we may live in freedom today for this thank them and for steve spielberg for making movie that will never forget the academy will not forget tom hanks come april as another well deserved oscar be in toms posession

note some may consider portions of the following text be spoilers be forewarned during the three years since the release of the groundbreaking success pulp fiction the cinematic output from its creator quentin tarantino has been surprisingly low oh he is been busy doing the talk show circuit taking small roles in various films overseeing the production of his screenplay from dusk till dawn making cameo appearances on television shows providing vignette for the illfated anthology four rooms everything it seems except direct another featurelength it is been the long intermission between projects as well as the dizzying peak pulp fiction reached has made mr tarantinos new feature jackie brown one of the most anticipated films of the year and his third feature cements his reputation as the single most important new american filmmaker emerge from the things are not going well for jackie brown pam grier she is years old stuck at deadend job year plus retirement benefits that are not worth damn as flight attendant for the worst airline in north america and she is just been caught at the airport atf agent ray nicolette portrayed terrific childlike enthusiasm michael keaton and police officer mark dargus michael bowen smuggling from mexico for gunrunner ordell robbie samuel jackson who has her bailed out unassuming bail bondsman max cherry robert forster the loquacious ordell based out of hermosa beach house where his horny bonghitting surfer girl melanie bridget fonda and agreeable crony louis gara robert de niro hang out operates under the policy that the best rat is dead rat and he is soon out silence jackie brown meanwhile the authorities target is ordell and they want jackie help them arranging sting the tune of halfmillion dollars only through series of clever twists turns and doublecrosses will jackie be able gain the upper hand on both of her nemeses although jackie brown marks mr tarantinos first produced screenplay adaptation based on the elmore leonard novel rum punch there is no mistaking his distinctive fingerprints all over this while he is adhered closely the source material in narrative sense the setting has been relocated los angeles and the lead characters now black in terms of ambiance the harkens back the from the walltowall funk and soul music drowning the soundtrack the nondescript look of the sets even the opening title credit sequence has the echo of vintage productions the opening sequence featuring ms grier wordlessly striding through the lax funky music blaring away on the speakers is emblematic of films of that era the timeframe for the is in fact but the atmosphere of jackie brown is decidedly retro of course nothing in the screams more than the casting of pam grier and robert forster as the two leads and although the caper intrigue is fun watch as the plot twists backstabbing and deceptions deliciously unfold the strength of jackie brown is the quiet understated relationship developed between jackie and max when they kiss it is perhaps the most tender scene of the year tenderness in quentin tarantino sure thereve been moments of sweetness in his prior films the affectionate exchanges between the bruce willis and maria de madeiros characters in pulp fiction and the unflagging dedication shared the characters of tim roth and amanda plummer or even in reservoir dogs where deep unspoken bond develops between the harvey keitel and tim roth characters but for the most part mr tarantinos films are typified manic energy unexpected outbursts of violence and clever often wordy banter these staples of his work are all present in jackie brown but what is new here is different facet of his storytelling willingness imbue the poignant emotional undercurrent and patience draw out several scenes great deliberation this effective demonstration of range prohibits the pigeonholing of mr tarantino as simply helmer of slick hip crime dramas fasttalking lowlifes and heralds him as bonafide multifaceted talent he is the real deal this new aspect of mr tarantinos storytelling is probably best embodied in single character that of the worldweary sensitive and exceedinglyprofessional max cherry whose unspoken attraction jackie is touching mr forsters nuanced understated performance is the best in the he creates an amiable character of such poignancy that when he gazes at jackie we smile along him much press has been given about the casting of blaxploitationera icon pam grier in the lead the wags buzzing that mr tarantino may do for her what his pulp fiction did bolster john travoltas thensagging career as it turns out ms grier is solid in the films title role although nothing here forces her test her range do have take exception the claim that this marks her career resurrection though she is been working steadily over the years often in directtovideo action flicks but also in such recent theatrical releases as tim burtons mars attacks and larry cohens original gangstas where she first teamed up mr forster of course it is true that her role here was godsend meaty part as this is rarity for any actress let alone one of her age and current status in the industry while jackie brown may disappoint those looking for another pulp fiction clone it marks tremendous growth of mr tarantino as director whose horizons are rapidly expanding and whose characterizations have never been better and while the films narrative does not really warrant running time of minutes it is filled such sumptuous riches ranging from the brashness of the vivid soundtrack entertaining inconsequential conversations between the characters that there was not an unengaging moment an impressive trio of feature films under his belt it will be interesting see what he tries next

last night could have an aka tagged on the end of it that says it is the end of the world and we feel fine last night is about just that the last night of planet earths existence the world is going end at precisely midnight january st how scientists were so accurately able predict when this catastrophic event would occur is never explained nor is the event itself throughout the entire movie no explanation is given as why this is happening in doing this mckellar who also wrote and directed the seems be trying transcend the genre he is attempted make about people and how each of them deals their last night of life the contains no science fiction elements allows the viewer concentrate on the feelings and actions of the characters mckellar is largely successful in his attempt rise above his material the is set in toronto and follows several people in their various escapades on the last night of existence there is mckellar who plays man who just wants be alone when the moment occurs but keeps getting interrupted woman sandra oh in search of her husband her husband played david cronenberg is spending the day working at the gas company informing people that they will attempt keep providing gas right up until the end finally there is mckellars friend played callum keith rennie man who has spent his final months trying out every sexual perversion you can think of mckellar has crafted gang of the some of the most interesting characters have seen in in months these people all felt real me especially the character played sandra oh we can see her desperation her utter need be her husband in the final hours rennie is good too as the man who wants literally try everything before he dies he exudes such charm and likeablity it is not surprising that we are rooting for him get what he wants but for me the biggest surprise in the movie is mckellar knew that he was talented director but had no idea he could act as well his insistence be alone much the dismay of his parents is something that most people would find difficult understand but as played mckellar we can understand his reasons he does not buy into the whole notion that just because everyones going die he should immediately find some companionship he realizes the relationship would be forced and they would only be together for the sake of being together mckellar gives brilliant performance and hope he alternates between directing and acting my only quibble the is that we never find out why the world is ending really wanted know and my need know was hanging over the at all times appreciate the fact that mckellar did not want the material rule the and that he wanted the movie be more of study in human behavious however in not telling the audience what the cause of earths destruction is he is left big question that is in their minds throughout the another problem is we never see anybody panicking would imagine if the world was ending and there was nothing be done about it large segment of the population would be going out of their minds instead we are treated shots of giant crowd partying like it is new years eve just did not buy the fact that everyone had completely accepted their fate no one had the urge rage against the dying of the light despite these small problems last night is one of the best movies of the year as opposed the moronic armageddon last night treats the subject at hand maturity and believabilty and bruce willis never shows up save the day

bugs life may not be toy story but it is more close than antz was really liked antz basically because yes it is clever and witty and intelligent and it has the temerity take chance and put woody allen in the lead perhaps the years most inspired casting but there was in fact something missing from it and am the first admit that maybe it is that it never totally lets go and takes off into real innocent fun it is too obsessed its orwellian message become totally engaging and if it were not for woody allen it would have been just really clever goodnotgreat flick bugs life has similar premise and it also has disney insure that it is grated and not totally over kids heads like antz was not bad thing believe me but what it also has is tone that is completely innocent even when it is also remaining perpetually clever antz is still the more witty and love it for it and bugs life is more for general consumption but it is also more entertaining it broadens its horizons and when it really moves from the ant colony it really shows us whole new world we have never seen before and it is take on the evolution of bugs is lot better than the one in antz it is also light and clever the visuals are instead of earth tones bright worldly colors and still gives the amazing visual technology of antz at least worthy contender the characters are also nicely realized though watereddown for broad consumption they still carry more wit than the contemporary disney animated films the lead character flik voiced dave foley is nothing more than slightlyless neurotic from antz but foley makes him nearly as engaging as allen made instead of gene hackman playing the villain we get the much more menacing kevin spacey as the lead grasshopper the nicelytitled hopper and for the romantic lead we do not get spacey sharon stone but intelligent and hardtoget julialouis dreyfuss who does not even come around until the very final frames not that the plots really any better than the one in antz it is basically yet another redux of the seven samurai an ant colony under the control of giant grasshoppers forcing them produce product for them or else when flik bone fide inventor creates timeconserving apparatus that accidentally destroys the seasons donation he puts them all in risk and is sent away so that he will not screw anything up the pretense that he is searching for help fight the grasshoppers he runs into group of warrirors who are unbeknownst him group of carnival bugs and they agree help under similar false pretenses these bugs are an equally wonderful assortment anything in toy story foppish walking stick slim david hydepierce german caterpillar heimlich joe ranft quicktempered and insecure male ladybug francis denis leary pretentious praying mantis manny jonathan harris his assistant butterfly hypsy madeliene kahn spider rosie bonnie hunt and two fleas tuck and roll michael mcshane who speak in undiscernable jibberish the writers lightly touch on each bugs place in bug society and the malleability thereof while making wisecracks at everything they can and blowing the audience away wild visual treats grasshoppers jumping in unison seems like menacing earthquake small bird becomes an ominous mortal threat whose usual mildmannered squeal is scream of death the bug city is modernday metropolis complete fireflies temping as traffic lights and fly sitting on the curb holding out cup sign lying next him that says kid tore off wings and rainstorm is like giant flood each drop acting like small bomb dropped at millions of miles per hour around this the pixar animators stage several large set pieces like resuce mission halfway through that is as wild and entertaining as anything this year and wonderfully exciting action piece at the end chase scene at night through the labyrinthine branches of small thicket meanwhile each character gets the spotlight be completely idisyncratic and interesting something antz could not do and the end over the end credits bugs life pulls it is final punch out clevering antz series of incessantly hilarious fauxbloopers that come just at the right time when those who leave immeadiately after the final frame of have left and you can brag that you were one of the elite who stayed and got the full moneys worth of entertainment still it is no toy story that maybe above any animated have ever seen encompassed almost true perfection in story character and wit it proved that it did not need brag about it is cutting edge technology really soar it is the least visually striking of the three computer animated films thus far but is still the most satisfying and created perfect world of idiosyncratic delights and innocent fun yet bugs life as well as antz are still amazing films and prove without doubt that if you are gonna make computer animated send it the guys who created these three flicks evne if they are not working under the same roof

when saw the trailer for the sixth sense did not expect much from it my snap judgment was that it was watereddown version of the shining or possibly lateentry in the glut of angelrelated moviestv shows of couple years ago but all the buzz motivated me give it shot it turned out be one of the most satisfying movie experiences of the year bruce willis plays child psychologist malcolm crowe at the beginning of the movie he is admiring an award the city has given him for his work but he is soon confronted vincent patient malcolm failed years earlier donnie wahlbergformer new kidin an impressive cameo year passes and malcolm is treating another child the same symptoms vincent displayed cole sear haley joel osment is withdrawn kid who is called freak the other boys in the neighborhood weird things seem happen around colehis mother olivia williams leaves the kitchen for moment and returns find every cabinet and drawer open even though cole has not movedand cole seems know things that kid his age should notfor example that there was once gallows in his school he steals religious icons from churches build chapel in pup tent in his bedroom the trailer gave away the movies first major plot twist if it had not the first hour of the movie would be more engrossing because we would not know what is wrong cole if you are lucky enough have not seen the trailer stop reading this review right now and go see the sixth sense anyway since the trailer gave it away figure it is fair game discuss here once malcolm gains coles trust cole reveals his secret he sees ghosts everywhere dead people wander around not knowing that they are dead invisible everyone except cole malcolm gradually begins realize that cole is telling the truth the box office success of the sixth sense has generated lot of press about how horror movies rule the box office this year and lots of theories about why that is so hate burst anybodys bubble but the sixth sense is not really horror at its core the sixth sense is touching story of how troubled kid and an emotionallyscarred adult help each other move past their problems some scenes the ghosts are wonderfully creepy though one that really got me the ghost of boy says cole will show you where my dad keeps his gun when the ghost turns we see the bullet wound in the back of his head osment gives the best performance have ever seen from child actor it is hard enough find grownup in who can give subtle realistic portrayal although willis gets top billing cole is really the protagonist of the story and osment truly brings the complex kid life if only willis work were as impressive accustomed delivering catchphrases rather than dialogue willis is stiff and awkward as malcolm his most challenging role date this is bad omen for his next movie the story of us chronicles the ups and downs of marriage writerdirector night shyamalan has light poetic touch that goes the heart of the viewer without seeming sappy or trite he is also skillful storyteller as the movies ending demonstrates only when the final secret is revealed do you realize that shyamalan has been hinting at it throughout the movie look for cameo the director as doctor who treats cole bottom line osment should get an oscar nomination and you should go see this movie

near the end of frank capras holiday classic its wonderful life george bailey jimmy stewart is feeling down he has devoted his life others and never fulfilled his dream of leaving his small supburb town bedford falls standing upon bridge above stormy waters he looks down contemplating suicide he has potential he has not fulfilled yet he has done so much for others as young chap his ambition was leave his hometown of bedford falls but times and ambitions change things happen and he is stuck his guardian angel is there and shows him that it is wonderful life in whirlwind tour of the town george sees what life would be like without him he learns the moral lesson that live is gift his earthly problems are solved the climatic scene is marvel frank capras is centenial classic watched and reexperienced every generation wonderful life is one of the few pictures of times gone that seems as fresh maybe fresher then it did when it was first released many films of the thirties through seventies have aged poorly but this one is near flawless example of how well perfect script and timing can mesh firstrate acting wit and suspense glorious music and terrific set peices the only even slightly dated scenes are those at the begining in god has long chat clarence georges guardian angel they are not all that bad but they remain corny and little out of place nevertheless this is one that deserves its place in time cinema history and our hearts it can be equally appreciated anyone of any age here is one genuine masterpeice classic that reaches heights and ambitions near perfection this crackling good mixture results in is at once funny exciting moving and uplifting the itself is almost reversal of the life of george bailey there is not too much it but capra and the gang various screenwriters composers actors plumet the material its fullest potential the result is though not at first intended be pigeonholed as holiday that will always be remembered celebrated and loved

jerry springer has got nothing on wild things john mcnaughtons new thriller tackles more tawdry themes in less than two hours than springers notoriously sleazy talk show broadcasts in two weeks bisexuality threesomes poolside catfights slutty rich bimbos even redneck gatorwrestling they are all part of the movies raucous complex storyline but even trash tv topicality cannot drag wild things down this crazy campfest plays like something you would find latenight on the usa network only infinitely more palatable and solid ensemble cast despite smattering of needless scenes most of them sexual in nature there is wicked fun be had here wild things would be guilty pleasure only there is no guilty feeling involved in having good time it high school guidance counselor sam lombardo matt dillon is wellliked in the town of blue bay especially pretty popular kelly van ryan denise richards whose family name is among the florida yachting enclaves most financially prominent hoping take her crush physical level kelly seductively slinks into lombardos house after washing his jeep for fundraiser but the very next day tearfully admits her trollop mother theresa russell that she was raped before long blue bay detectives ray duquette kevin bacon and gloria perez daphne rubinvega are listening similar allegations from kellys rebel classmate suzie toller neve campbell lombardo who maintains his innocence hires neck bracesporting opportunistic lawyer ken bowden bill murray defend him in court the previews give away the following revelations so if you have not seen any of the movies spots on the television or in the theater you might want skip the next paragraph while crossexamining suzie on the witness stand bowden gets her break down and admit that the alleged rapes never took place that kelly had concocted this entire scheme because she was angry that lombardo was sleeping her mother and not her pay lombardo for the damages kellys mother breaks her daughters trust fund and gives him million but lombardo kelly and suzie are actually all working together and plan take the money and run as fast as they can duquette and perez however begin suspect that there is more afoot the case than just false accusations if there is major drawback wild things it is that it is oversexed fault the muchtalkedabout hotel room menageatrois between dillon campbell and richards is turnoff it is also cut short sorry guys and should have been cut shorter the movie grinds halt for pure titillation once too often what we do not see is far more effective than what we do another example of this is kevin bacon needlessly going the full monty in shower scene er no thanks also bacons duquette feels simultaneously underdeveloped and overwritten daphne rubinvega from broadways rent tries compensate for superfluous character theresa russell is just plain wooden and when in the end all is out in the open ask yourself if certain scenes involving these three were really necessary but what keeps the movie from being throwaway junk is an engaging chain of surprises some predictable some not that never seems end wild things has more twists than crate full of corkscrews and most are so gleefully overthetop nasty that you cannot help but be charmed their absurd showmanship great deal of amusement also comes from watching bill murray in supporting part that appears have been written for his sly comedic talent murrays stitch especially when pulling up beside the van ryan limo after winning lombardos case and flipping them off and do not leave when the closing credits hit the screen or you will miss the films best part four bonus flashbacks that smooth over plot holes while offering few more tiny turns plus final scene that caps everything off great stunner of bombshell speaking of bombshells denise richards who plays almost every scene in blue bikini top does the teen tease thing malicious allure that she was never allowed flaunt in starship troopers matt dillon flexes his sleepyvoiced sex appeal and pulls off personality changes chameleonic precision neve campbell lovely as ever except when sporting blond wig gives suzie vengeful vulnerability that makes her the most interesting member of the conspiring trio reedited and toned down bit the dynamics between these three actors could have carried the greater lengths but what we are given works well enough wild things is highly entertaining and indeed very wild

the happy bastards second review big daddy happy gilmore as father of course that is the latest scenario presented adam sandler in the new movie big daddy movie that is passable but is not really considered some of sandlers best work he does not actually play happy gilmore in the movie but variation of him he is sonny coufax man who is living off settlement he got for cab running over his foot and his onedayaweek gig as tollbooth man tollbooth willie his girlfriend kristy swanson is fed up his lifestyle and demands change before she leaves him enter year old kid who is mysteriously dropped at his doorstep and intended for his preppy roommate jon stewart who is off in china on business trip from there coufax basically acts as the kids father teaching him different things like peeing on the side of building and tripping up skateboarders sticks he even manages use the kid in sort of con game get the attention of beautiful law office worker joey lauren adams but somehow he also garners the attention of social services who are not particularly pleased coufaxs actions as he pretends be his roommate keep the kid the reason say it is not really sandlers best work is because it gets really sappy towards the end of movie showing some odd feelings that somehow did not really belong in sandler vehicle mean it fits the movies tone and everything and sandler handles it well but it is just oddly placed that is all fortunately it does not destroy the goofy glee path it is been following and it still makes you feel good sandler does good job here as he does in most of his movies rob schneider however is irritating as his friend an immigrant delivery boy who cannot read stewart in his minor time on screen is great and adams remains joy watch look for steve buscemi as well as homeless bum he is hoot directed dennis dugan director of happy gilmore the movie remains good couple of hours pass the time again there are faults but hey everyone needs get emotional sometimes

six days seven nights is summer movie that gets the summer movie experience deliciously right commendable achievement considering the season thus far has been littered some pretty uneven fare heres genuinely fun fluff piece that knows it is fluff recognizes it is fluff and is admittedly proud be fluff of course the casting of harrison ford in the broadly comedic lead role plays sizeable part in the movies success ford is such concentrated dramatic actor that it is easy forget what funny guy he can be as his female counterpart anne heche also deserves big pat on the back for her sweet goofily charismatic performance the age difference fords heche is matters not these two click in charged way that is hard come the story is nobrainer ford stars as gruff but loveable island aviator quinn harris while heche is careerminded but loveable new york magazine editor robin monroe robin on tropical vacation fianc frank david schwimmer gets assigned supervise an emergency photo shoot in nearby tahiti so she reluctantly hires quinn fly her there the plane crashes during terrible storm and they immediately find themselves stuck in deserted paradise few ideas on getting back civilization series of unpleasant often hilarious catastrophes leaves little choice but for both members of this unlikely odd couple fall for each other meanwhile back at the resort frank is tempted himself quinns shapely female tagalong jacqueline obradors that subplot obviously exists get us rooting for the quinnrobin pairing and while it makes for few good laughs early on it eventually becomes contrived distraction from the far more engrossing misadventures of quinn and robin and since the spends most of its time the castaways this flaw is only minor inconvenience director ivan reitman keeps the pace brisk at slim minutes six days seven nights never wears out its welcome where lesser could have felt like it was as long as its title michael brownings clever screenplay allows for plenty of notable oneliners my favorite taken in context is you mean _arrrgh_ pirates and though it essentially boils down one mishap after another they are all quite engaging even the movies more serious moments are played wink heche has been under undeserved fire over whether or not her private life ellen degeneres would affect the believability of six days seven nights heterosexual pairing so she is lesbian so what deal it of course it does not and here her naysayers are proved wrong in big way in fact her chemistry ford is what really makes the click these opposites attract the utmost endearing electricity at one point when the two are discussing the likelihood of romantic interest heche asks ford how old he is after several wrong guesses fortyfive _fifty_ he whispers his age her you still look good heche stammers still _am_ good ford replies she is good too and together they make six days seven nights one memorable ride

the release of dolores claiborne into wide release this weekend adds another entry into the long list of adaptations of stephen kings work this slowmoving character study provides some outstanding acting performances the principals but suffers from tepid conclusion inconsistent direction and may not have wide commercial appeal when the maid dolores claiborne is found brandishing rolling pin standing over the bloody and dead body of her employer it seems like an openandshut murder case upon hearing of the death via mysterious fax dolores estranged and bitter daughter esquire magazine writer selena st george returns from new york back her tiny island village childhood home as the two clash horns the story behind the mysterious death of dolores abusive husband two decades ago ruled an accident despite the protests of detective john mackey is revealed did dolores kill her husband and did she kill her employer dolores claiborne is certainly more of character study than suspense thriller consequently it is fortunate that their cast includes some of hollywoods finest character actors such as bates leigh and strathairn kathy bates plays the films title character and gives sensational lead performance dolores claiborne is essentially showcase for the talent of bates as her character has huge amount of screen time she dominates the screen producing character that is compelling and arresting as we watch the character go through two decades of history via flashbacks kathy bates performance is awardcalibre stuff the rest of the cast is also very good jennifer jason leigh plays the perpetually sour bitter helena st george well and christopher plummer seems be enjoying himself as dolores everpresent nemesis the determined detective john mackey david strathairn is particularly interesting and suitably smarmy and despicable as dolores husband joe st george judy parfitt is fine as dolores tyrannic socialite employer vera donovanit would have been interesting see say meg foster in this role child actor ellen muth is also worth noting as the young selena during the flashback sequences she is very impressive the direction of dolores claiborne taylor hackford wildly varies throughout the ranging from some parts are quite clever in their own right parts are embarrassingly hokey the segues between flashbacks and the present are very hitandmiss in terms of effectiveness the pacing of the tends be numbingly slow tends undermine any suspense might be built up however the cinematography gabriel beristain is wonderfuli particularly like the chilling iceblue hue permeating the presentday scenes contrasting well the many nova scotia ocean shotsand danny elfman provides surprisingly understated score for the it would seem that the commercial potential of dolores claiborne is limited none of the performers in the could be classified as big draw and its pacing may be turnoff those expecting gripping suspense filled twists and turns and car crashes and axewielding psychopaths although being essentially the only in its genre in release now it may also be hurt the negative perception of king works even the recent critical success of the shawshank redemption and the stand dolores claiborne suffers from very unsatisfying conclusion and moves very slowly however the performances are uniformly excellent particularly kathy bates and the has its moments on my fourstar scale give dolores claiborne three stars

seen september at m at rotterdam square mall cinema theater chris wessell for free using my sonyloews critics pass theater rating good seats average sound picture unstable rounders is exactly the kind of movie parents do not want their kids see it is not that it is drunken orgy of sex and violence but because it is that flatout says you can make career out of gambling and take make things worse it proves this through its original fascinating story there have been countless crime films both past and present that evoke the noir mood that is the dark shady atmosphere where the vices of the world become more fascinating on screen than they would in real life this starts off in the tradiational noir style introducing us the underworld of modern gambling where the stakes are high and so is the price for losing matt damon stars as mike mcdermott something law student in presentday new york city who tells us how the game of poker is really played damon narrates throughout the but the entire opening scene is voicedover so perfectly completely and totally define the setting mikes about go up against teddy kgb malkovich russian gangster who looks like serial killer but then again he practically is one and the does everything convey that sense the look in his eyes his slow movements his intricate mannerisms all combined the classic noir cinematography of isolated brightness within the darkness of the underworld literally damon in the flesh might seem little out of place his expensive clothes and perfectlygroomed features but his narration is what brings it all together he never sounds like he is reading from script nor that he is trying embellish anything it just comes natural him the screenwriters use the right words and phrases describe the mood from the smell of the air the logic involved in reading the other guys faces and cards and all without sounding remotely trite immediately we get the sense that poker is not for gamblers but for near geniuses nerves of steel the game is quiet war strategies just as complex and the same sense of honor among the soldiers the gangsters mike plays against are the same ones that might kill someone for scratching their car but when it comes the game of poker all respect is due the winner because he is truly the better man the does an excellent job in establishing its atmosphere during the first act it concentrates so much in this aspect that the background and the progression of the story stumble bit we learn only little about mike both past and present presently we know he has girlfriend named jo gretchen mol who he constantly argues over his gambling they go through few breakupmakeup cycles until mikes childhood pal and fellow rounder worm norton is released from prison it is not at all surprising worm owes thousand of dollars the mob but what is surprising is how the is able take such predictable element and execute it the way it does technically the plot is not unlike many childrens sitcoms in the good kids bad friend gets the good kid in trouble and yet the good kid remains friends the bad kid what this does is use different medium tell that story mike and worm have been in over their heads their entire lives but both share passion for outthinking the other player who is trying do the same them where as worm prefers go the sleazy route of cheating hence his jail time mike always takes the cards he is dealt and works them sometimes they pay off e his ability pay his way through law school on his gambling money but other times they do not e the fact he takes himself out of the game and works steady job after dropping on single hand once things start happening the is able expand and develop its plot into an intricate web of detail and mood mike and worm bob and weave through all kinds of games at all kinds of places from socialites mansions taking the tourists at atlantic city outwitting the gangsters that control it all everything they come into contact is big poker game in that everythings battle against the cards destiny deals one scene demonstrates this perfectly in mike is told judge martin landou in perfectly cast and performed role that destiny is everything and yet nothing at the same time matts good at gambling but he is also got potential be great lawyer he could go professional as either but one he could lose everything or win big but the other there is stability but not much risk involved can someone who is gambled his entire life really cash in his chips and leave if the had been just subtle lesson in pokerplaying then the ending is our test everything is told from mikes perspective but we are finally able recognize some things on our own this makes the final againstall odds showdown seem like just that it works just like the game it revolves around showing us some of the cards but still evokes the element of the unknown and the consequences thereof what separates rounders from most other films about games is the fact the challenge and the skills are more important than winning in the end

there was lot riding on this movie everyone even moderately interested in the scream series was dying know how it would end what would be the final act this is the end of an era for them movie has kept them up nights searching for clues on the internet talking and tossing around rumors their equally enthused buddies and for kids under those elaborate plots consisting of buying ticket one movie and hopping into scream while narrowly escaping those menacing ushers who are only year or two older than themselves no need worry scream is endlessly inventive and entertaining fine epilogue the series that made kevin williamson household name reinvented the horror genre and continued in the selfreferential postmodern tradition of quentin and co so how does the story go as opposed what some fanatical internet sites would have you believe sidney prescott neve campbell now allgrownup and constantly dealing her pass in the constantly tormented sector of her psyche is not living in fulfilling her dream become an actress but rather in upstate california living understandably alone in the confines of fences and vast security systems she works at home as crisis center affiliate over the phone but that not where the movie starts off instead in tactic that reminded me of the somewhat similar and conceptually horrifying sequence in eye for an eye cotton weary liev schreiber now big star drives home his girlfriend in traffic when the killer calls demands the location of sidney home and when he doesn get it threatens the life of cotton girlfriend christine and cotton can do anything stop him the rest of the sequence is particularly clever setting up constant throughout the picture the killer has hightech electronic voicechanger that tops that of the first two not only does he sound unmistakably like talented voiceover artist roger jackson ha ha he can now easily duplicate the voices of the lead characters including sidney and the returned gale weathers courtney cox arquette and dewey riley david arquette at the same time stab the third filmwithinafilm based around the characters and events of woodsboro and windsor college has taken less authentic approach this time around in return woodsboro whereas the account of the first two films was true the franchise within scream has now become totally fictional nevertheless we learn cotton made an appearance in the movie is now in production as himself be killed off in the first scene so it seems that the real killer is offing our heroes in the order in they bite it in the movie either the actor portraying them or the real thing sometimes both clever indeed but who goes next no one knows three different scripts were penned we re told keep the true finale off the internet nod the scream fiasco few years back and no one knows for sure one the killer read still all the while sidney stays concealed in her home only visiting dad for the first halfhour of the while also having horrifying visions of her mother takes us back bit sidney fear of becoming what her mother was or at least what her mother was secretly when sidney finally ventures out as the murders become more prevalent she chased onto the set of stab wandering through woodsboro written and directed as an odd surreal nightmare indeed this is one of scream finest moments okay over the years ll admit that ve become quite the scream fan no don have the ghostface costume or the director cut laserdisc but often find myself compelled pop in the dvd of either member of the preceding duo and can get quite caught up in the dramatic element of these films yes said dramatic element sometimes debating family and friends the possibilities and endless theories that have become quintessentially affiliated scream throughout the though noticed much more subtle approach than the other two films granted that there stabbinaplenty going on throughout but there considerably less blood less gore honestly like this approach it more classical more rebellious constantly demonstrating the capable direction of wes craven he knows when hold back and at the same time makes the movie ooze energy illustrating the delicate poise flowing from his years of experience some critics have noted that scream seems take itself more seriously this time maybe so or maybe screenwriter ehren kruger arlington road who took over after williamson had scheduling conflicts saw an opportunity for true irony maybe even little bit of satire if the worked in few more clich what puts damper on this otherwise exceptional and creative m afraid is the ending or rather the identity of the killer it does the job guess accomplishes what it should bringing the three films full circle but upon my first viewing it seemed rather dissatisfying because it appears little too contrived too arbitrary after second viewing endeavored upon due this recurring disapprobation the killer identity still seems little too random but his motivation came across more sound this time around and the eventual conclusion was ultimately more satisfying all in all scream does not fall victim the most lamented principle of trilogy it is not the worst of the films as trilogy scream was lot of fun refreshing humorous offbeat almost sad see it go but then it does seem best quit while you re ahead and scream does fine job of providing closure its characters for now scream holds the title as the finest series of horror films be committed celluloid not too shabby

ingredients pouring rain small flooded town damn about burst bad guys going after millions of dollars synopsis at one point in the story townsperson karen asks hero tom what happened her church he replies something like the church is flooded but at least the floodwaters put out the big fire well the fire was not that bad since while the church was burning looters apparently thought it was safe enough break through all the priceless stained glass windows in hard rain small town is nearly deserted due flooding everyone has had evacuate because it is raining and now floodwaters are rising so high that buildings are being submerged and the nearby dam is about break enter working class smartalecky new armored car driver named tom christian slater suddenly his security truck carrying over three million dollars gets stuck on the flooded street and is waylaid armed looters tom has no choice but grab the bag full of money hide it and swim for his life this makes for an action movie full of jet skis speedboat chases and gun battles as tom tries evade and outsmart corrupt cops and armed looters until the national guard can answer his distress call he is befriended and aided spunky churchgoing young woman from town named karen minnie driver but unknown tom and karen the national guard never heard toms initial distress call will tom and karen survive the natural and manmade disasters opinion do not expect thoughtprovoking issues or dramatics there is not much more this movie than hiding running swimming shooting and saving handcuffed heroes from drowning but that is what makes it escapist and fun relax take your shoes off and break out the popcorn

although many people have compared this new gangster comedy the hit hbo drama the sopranos analyze this is witty and entertaining enough be good movie in it is own right billy crystal plays wiseguy shrink ben sobol who new patient happens be gangster boss paul vitti de niro ben wants nothing do vitti as he is about get married laura macnamara kudrow and having gangster as patient would not really help but ben is soon drawn into vitti worlds and reluctantly helps vitti sort his life out all done in comic fashion of course although never brilliant analyze this is also never rubbish makes for fun ride billy crystal who has not had good role since city slickers way back in the early is given role that lets him fully exploit his wiseguy act he is pretty funny while he does it and although his character is little close his character in city slickers he is pretty funny robert de niro is hilarious as vitti playing it dead straight but coming off as really funny he is serious gangster unaware that he is comic gold mine lisa kudrow barely seen as crystals estranged wife be basically reprises her phoebe role from v series friends is getting rather tiresome and does not come off well on the screen the supporting cast is apparently made up of the entire cast of casino and goodfellas and are all funny caricatures especially vittis bodyguard jelly joe viterelli the genuinely plays like proper gangster movie but laughs instead of hard ass talking it sometimes gets little bloody for light hearted but it strangely fits in spoofs are made of famous gangster movies including nice parody of the godfather the italian tunes playing throughout the soundtrack contribute the fun there is also some odd plot points fbi guys appear and suddenly disappear for no apparent reason it is true that analyze this has had somewhat chequered production history and perhaps the plot points were expanded in earlier version of the script unfortunately this is so we will never know harold ramis best known as egon from ghostbusters has deft touch directing comedy as shown in the immortal groundhog day and the less immortal caddyshack all the comic potential in scene is dug out and presented the audience the script written ramis along peter tolan and ken lonergan starts off funny remains funny for the most of the but sadly peters out somewhat during the last twenty minutes where it wrongly enters more serious territory the is short however and just before audience interest is waning the suddenly goes into rather rushed and unsatisfying ending and the credits roll analyze this is good comedy and is certainly worth watching robert de niro sobbing is reason enough watch it even though it does seem forced or like parody although think this was intentional crystal is his most likeable in years kudrow is given as little screen time as possible is good thing and de niro is just awesome it is no goodfellas and it probably will not be remembered as much as groundhog day but analyze this is well done comedy that will not leave you feel cheated

being john malkovich is the type of we need see more todays films are either blockbusters that entertain us tiresome formulas or those that have similar themes malkovich falls under none of these categories and it is quite refreshing see that occur this strangely provoking story is actually somewhat understandable john cusack plays puppeteer trying make it the big time his wife cameron diaz supports the both of them working at petstore explains the obscure pets they keep in their apartment when cusack finally realizes he needs get job he finds an ad for filing clerk when he reaches the building he arrives at floor it is there that he discovers secret portal that leads being john malkovich for minutes at time meanwhile cusack meets business partner catherine keener in he falls madly in love her the only problem is she has no interest in him what so ever the whole portal thing is not just toy in fact it becomes cusacks dream being inside malkovichs mind gave him the opportunity basically control mlakovich like puppet and fulfill his fantasies do not want give away too much but cusack becomes too attached his discovery in my opinion this idea is absolutely brilliant it is really quite scary think that someone could become you control you be you it makes you wonder why we act like we do and why sometimes we blurt out things or act out something out of the blue even if the script is super sharp cannot help but find the ending displeasing it could have lead up something more or at least an amusing conclusion it tried explain mythology about the portals that made it seem rushed other than that had very enjoyable time the acting was quite delightful as well john cusack has finally been given chance prove his ability and he does it well he is far the most underrated actor due lack of popularity but am hoping that will change cameron diaz was her usual charming self although felt that part was wrong for her but she pulled it off john malkovich himself continues creep out people his eerie facial expressions and tone of voice who elses mind would be better explore the director spike jonze who appeared in last months three kings really catches my attention this project knew he was bizzare but not this extreme he too is likely too receive media attention being john malkovich is not an excellent but it is definitly entertaining and will eaisly become cult favorite what is even better is the films puzzling message am nick lyons

as feelgood formulaic as it may be in its own way shall we dance also demonstrates kind of charming restraint you do not often find in american films this japanese import tells the story of middleaged accountant named sugiyama koji yakusho whose mundane life is shaken up one night when he spots beautiful mai kishikawa tamiyo kusakari in the window of dance school intrigued her melancholy demeanor and slightly infatuated her sugiyama signs up for weekly classes at the school and much his amazement ends up as attracted dancing itself as his young sensei meanwhile sugiyamas wife hideko hara becomes suspicious of his late wednesday nights and sets private detective on her husbands trail in you can bet that subplot would be turned into stream of slapstick comedy and crazy misunderstandings in shall we dance writerdirector masayuki suo dispenses it in matter of minutes using it set up later character interactions rather than letting it overwhelm the story pratfalls neither does he make the climactic moment of victory competition between the hero and some meanspirited token rival suo gives his comedy the graceful movements of his subject matter allowing the humor flow from the characters rather than forcing it upon them an opening prologue in shall we dance goes some effort place the in sociological perspective explaining how contrary ballroom dancing is the japanese sense of propriety it is forced message in story does not need such culturespecific angle the dance school in shall we dance plays the role of singles mixer everyone vaguely embarrassed be there yet taking the opportunity try on new personalities most amusing among these new personalities is the one adopted sugiyamas coworker mr aoki naoto takenaka balding systems analyst who becomes fiery latin lover when he dons frizzy wig and begins rumba sugiyamas awakening is less overt but koji yakusho does wonderful job showing transformation of small steps it is delicate performance huge heart shall we dance is fairly lightweight experience makes its final half hour rather long sit suo crams lot of exposition into very little time including an unnecessarily detailed backstory for mai resulting in sluggish march towards the resolution it is here that shall we dance feels most hollywoodconventional attempting blindside the audience truckload of emotional catharsis suo might have been better advised conclude the small gem of scene in sugiyama and his wife take their first tentative dance steps together that is the real joy of dance shall we dance conveys its ability create an intoxicating mood of romance can soften the stiffest shirt

the tailor of panama is different kind of spy movie despite the presence of pierce brosnan there is nary hint of james bond flash here instead of big action scenes leering super villains and emptyheaded femme fatales we get interesting characters and an intriguing situation based on the novel john le carr who also cowrote the screenplay the offers viewers something rarely seen in theaters this time of year solid welltold story brosnan plays andy osnard british operative walking on thin ice his british superiors ship him off panama making sure he understands that he had better not screw up the placement osnard arrives in the tropics virtually oozing contempt for his new coworkers and his new home base when shown the bridge of the americas person marveling over the fact that since the creation of the panama canal the structure is the sole connection between north and south america he barely keeps from yawning brosnan clearly relishes the chance be the antithesis of investing the suave spy distinct reptilian quality coupled an air of indifference that irks his fellows no end searching for way get information on the government osnard sets his sights on harry pendel geoffrey rush an unctuous tailor serving the panamanian elite harry claims be transplant from britains renowned saville row but osnard knows his secret the tailor is an excon who served five years in prison after torching his uncles shop in an insurance scam he also knows that harry is up his ears in debt having spent fortune on an unsuccessful farm osnard offers harry way out he will pay for information harry has gathered from his upscale clientele eager comply harry offers what he knows then starts concocting tidbits keep the money flowing before long he is forced spy on his loving wife louisa jamie lee curtis an aide the canal director harrys little lies build eventually taking on life of their own osnard turns in reports about the silent opposition group threatening upset the balance of control over the canal the bogus revelation proves explosive leading meetings in washington c over how best protect the vital waterway meanwhile osnard wallows in his newfound status enjoying the best the city has offer and wooing an attractive coworker and harry grows ever more fretful fearing the consequences if his clients not mention his wife learn about his lies geoffrey rush is wonderful as harry fawning over his customers day and savoring his rich family life in the evenings all while playing secret agent in the off hours his new benefactor rush makes harry credible figure presenting the various levels of the character so effectively that he remains sympathetic despite his duplicity after gaining fame playing larger than life characters rush flips everything around for this role using his energy depict the quiet desperation of man slowly realizing that the solution his troubles may be worse than the original problems although she gets far too little screen time jamie lee curtis imbues louisa depth greater than the screenplay provides her of the central characters she is the only one that exhibits maturity and genuine selfconfidence curtis is one of my favorite female actors whiplash smart sultry and charismatic she deserves more than supporting roles speaking of supporting characters there are some great ones here harold pinter is amusing as harrys uncle benny who pops up throughout the story in number of creative ways also shoring up the proceedings is jon polito as corrupt banker and dylan baker who is riot as united states general straight out of the dr strangelove school of armed patriotism but the most important secondary performers are leonor varela and brendan gleeson both outstanding as two wounded activists their presence adds weight the story reminding us that beyond the charades of the leading men there are real people that have suffered greatly over the politics connected the canal director john boorman adds additional verisimilitude shooting the on location instead of using panama city merely as colorful backdrop he adroitly weaves in footage of all aspects of life there the metropolis described one character as casablanca without heroes pulsates life underling the folly of the two foreigners playing dangerous games that could have disastrous impact on great many people the tailor of panama succeeds because the principals behind it were bright enough make it more than simple entertainment

perhaps it is time for me say little about my reading habits really do like read and have enjoyed many books in my lifetime my problem is that am slow reader and not very dedicated will enjoy portions of book and then set it down for months at time it is taken me the last six weeks get through the first one hundred pages of anna karenina even though am loving the book in addition this typically do not read anything created after the th century the only reason bother this bit of information is because feel bad admitting time after time that have not read any of the books on these films are based the only exception believe is great expectations however do not think it should be necessary read the book beforehand in order judge the quality of the needless say have not read the elmore leonard novel out of sight on steven soderberghs new is based cannot say how faithful of an adaptation it is or if it lives up leonards vision can say that it is terrific sharp acting great dialogue and pumping full of energy and style injected soderbergh it is certainly nice distraction from lineup of brainless blockbusters all hopelessly wishing that size mattered out of sight proves that it does not had originally written george clooney off as onenote actor incapable of depth but occasionally showing little flair after seeing his latest performance in this have changed my mind this guy can act but he also has that forceful presence that most certainly will make him one of those million superstars here he plays jack foley middle aged guy who robs banks for living he does it because it is fun think but the opens him getting caught because his car will not start he goes jail is interesting only break out five cinematic minutes later the help of his friend buddy ving rhames we are then introduced karen sisco jennifer lopez u marshall who conveniently is waiting shotgun as jack escapes fortunately they take her hostage and she and jack spend some quality time in the trunk together as buddy drives them safety the central conflict arises when both jack and karen become obsessed one another though their respective jobs make them superficially incompatible we soon learn that the is not told in sequence and since this is gritty crime comedy flashbacks of pulp fiction should arise at first kind of felt that it was gimmick but guess it was gimmick in pulp fiction too it is fun gimmick though and soderbergh treats the material enough humor that everything comes off naturally have only seen few of soderberghs films was impressed both kafka and sex lies and videotape but think he is excellent at what he does he is an artist without making it obvious and without being pretentious is always admirable he uses tricks yes lots of freezeframe stuff here but it all adds the smooth and quirky currents in the as said clooney is terrific and he is matched lopez lopez is of course beautiful but she can act too can sense that she is honing in on her skills for she comes off more natural here than she has in any of her previous ventures not that stone gave her much help in the loathsome uturn the two actors have arresting chemistry one another the best scene in the far is the seduction scene the brilliance of this scene is also due in part soderbergh for he cuts back and forth from their quiet discussion in bar the physical act takes place few minutes later the scene is series of soft nuances and glances layered upon light dialogue and the result is one of the better love scenes in recent cinema meaningful and engrossing the supporting cast is strong led the alwaysreliable ving rhames dennis farina who plays karens father is good as is don cheadle as the profoundly stupid villain steve zahn who plays jacks nearlybrain dead accomplice glenn steals all of his scenes and that is in where every scene is already at high level all of the actors are helped the dialogue and the intelligentlyconstructed script scott frank out of sight is certainly light although there are few heavy moments that will linger in the memory overall can recommend it simply as great entertainment not every has change your life and it is nice see movie that uses the art tell great story and simply entertain its viewers as for the book this is good enough make me believe that there might be something in the text worth looking at

note some may consider portions of the following text be spoilers be forewarned among my fanatical ticker tapeworshipping friends there is one who happens share the same philosophy espoused the central character in darren aronofskys darkly original pi the entire stock market can be reduced nothing but series of patterns through analysis will produce information accurately forecast future behaviour an example of the mentality involved if the stock price goes up like this and then down like that and then sharply up this way it then will go this way while freely admit that know less than nothing about the market knowledge check prices up good prices down bad most of the time at least and hence really could not comment any authority it is always nonetheless struck me as an incredibly naive oversimplification of an astonishingly complex system and besides if it were that simple no doubt somebody would have already figured it all out the difference in this case is that while my colleague an otherwise assuredly realistic individual truly believes in this in and of itself as valid forecaster pi uses this ideology as device investigate its characters psychosis it is also vastly more convincing its argument mathematics is the language of the universe insists genius protagonist maximillian cohen sean gullette in cool mantralike voiceover repeats throughout the picture since nature can be expressed in numbers and there are patterns everywhere in nature he reasons eminent logic that finding the patterns will allow him predict anything the ups and downs of the stock market how many games the yankees will win this year the flavour of jam am going put on my toast tomorrow morning obsessed finding the proverbial key the universe max lives in paranoid selfimposed solitude in seedy nyc chinatown apartment singlemindedly toiling away his monstrous homemade computer system sullenly withdrawn and plauged debilitating migraines the elusive pursuit of mysterious digit number his machine spits out one day is driving him into madness the story then is basically an eccentricity but it is clever astute eccentricity perceptively zeroing in on the modern mistrust of mathematical reductionism in an age where dominant societal phobia is ones individualism being replaced series of numeric identifiers maxs allconsuming penchent for numbers at once creates lingering unsettling mood it helps matters that he is not particularly likable protagonist all attempts of friendliness from neighbours are curtly rebuffed max spindly neuroticlooking individual who has not the time indulge in pleasantries for puts its lead character front and center mr gullette appears in virtually every scene pi takes refreshing and effective approach in avoiding conventional aesthetics because of our ambivalence max we are not so much avidly rooting for him triumph moment of epiphany as we are following him through this plot sense of mixed dread and morbid fascination it is more disturbing journey than quest still we do care about maxs fate teetering on the edge of dementia he winds up being pursued two different groups want pick his brain both fronted deliciously perky resolutely cheerful representatives inevitably duplictious intentions as we know in films where paranoia is dominant element see the truman show is laura linney character or for that matter in real life it is always the ones who never stop smiling at you and are overly friendly that are the ones of be wary pi that addresses patterns itself intentionally adheres an identifiable pattern cycle headache scene important revelation or bit of plot development pillpopping montage hallucinatory nightmare decidedly cronenbergesque undertones few other directors are as equally adept in bridging
