unsettling concepts and bodythemed horror nosebleeding reality the repetitiveness far from being tedious is effectively maddening more than anything the picture aims get under our skins and take in events from maxs claustrophobic perspective in this regard it wildly succeeds due mr aronofskys striking direction it is rarity that so completely immerses itself into protagonists warped perspective of his surrounding and high contrast blackandwhite cinematography combined constant usage of extreme closeups lend heightened sense of paranoia the proceedings in some scenes the stark composition in conjunction the lumbering approach mr gullette make his character curiously resemble latterday max schreck from nosferatu using savage jittery lensing and rapid cuts create sense of disorientation the picture is often dizzying behold and maxs effective isolationism is emphasized shots from the socalled snorri cam keep him in plain focus while the environment races in blurred bursts pis raw aggressive visuals are reminiscent of david lynchs early work in particular eraserhead the films sinister tone splashes onto the screen immediately dazzling opening credit sequence ably backed sly electronic score clint mansell and gradually increases in intensity still amidst all its kafkaesque qualities and overall dispassionate mood pi does occasionally display sense of humour at one point marcy dawson pamela hart great fun entices max the offer of an invaluable treasure oneofakind computer chip is not it beautiful she coos showcase for mr aronofskys technical virtuosity made for it is since gone on capture acclaim at the sundance festival pi is an intriguingly cerebral story ironically is perhaps the most purely visceral of the year

upon arriving at the theater during the opening credits took my seat and prepared myself for what appeared be hellraiser meets the crow but as soon as kiefer sutherland began speaking the narrative monologue describing the strangers and their reasons for contacting human beings was hooked there was something especially compelling about the nature of his voice knew from the start that was going witness the actions of his character rather than the actor attempting the character sutherland played the role as true veteran upon the completion of his monologue the camera arrives on sutherland in such fashion that you can only wonder how long alex proyas spent on cinematography would imagine for of this caliber that maximum hours of work were spent where they were needed the most the flowed beautifully as was being taken through the intricate regions of the dark city clever plot began unravel the point where the last time had seen such clever plot twists were in the usual suspects not mention series of special effects that would make james cameron literally turn green envy but if you are not exactly the biggest scifi fan caveat emptor get ready for the atmostpheric darkness of monkeys or the crow without the boredom or depression the concept of the plot is as mindstretching as monkeys was however so be prepared and be sophisticated and imagine picture that finally does justice the comicbookgonefeaturefilm fad that has recently become abusive of dark city simply puts spawn shame in fact during the climax of the could not help but feel the strong presence of an akira esque explosion throughout the general feeling of the movie so my initial predictions were wrong this is anything but the meloncholy of hellraiser parts one through five am never one base entirly on special effects so know that when give dark city it is actually because the contained all of the neccessary ingredients keep me entertained and awake from storyline plot twists camerawork even tsk tsk special effects not since contact have recieved such deep insight into the way the human mind operates and never this year have been so blown away the best have seen all year and easily one of the best have ever seen

kadosh means sacred in hebrew amos gitais fictional work after spending most of his career doing documentaries is grim story about failed hasidic marriage even though the marriage is loving one the marriage will symbolize the clash of cultures in modern israel between the native israelis modern viewpoint toward religion and the political savvy hasidics intolerable one as both groups are vying for control of the secular government gitai devarimyom yom is labor party leftist who believes that if the rigid hasidic ever got control of the government it would sound the death knell of israel the emphasis of the is on how the ultraorthodox jews of that sect live the letter of the torah in everything they do and how they subjugate the women accept their vision of gods law from only the males view that if they ever got control of the country their intolerant attitude would subjugate the country the same way the women are the story takes place in jerusalems jewish quarters called mea shearim where we are taken down sinewy back streets placards pasted on the walls and into the crowded apartments and prayer rooms where the protagonists live out their idea of the proper jewish life is much different than the way most jews live in israel this is controversial in that the women are unhappy and the male attitudes are such an extreme patriarchal ones that the is bound anger most viewers no matter their belief it is slowmoving meticulous that grabs hold of you the collar and never lets go the force of what is seen though filmed in an objective manner never taking cheap shot at the hasidim is nevertheless bound leave questions about the nature of such practice of strict observance the is meant be critical of such rigid people as it implies how they kill the spirit of everything they touch and their extreme phobic attitudes it makes it impossible for them unite the country when they cannot at present live in harmony their own people and it would be even more impossible imagine them living their arab neighbors in peace the opens as meir rises at dawn and goes through his prayer ritual where every prayer is made the virtues of god he even thanks god that he did not make him woman his wife rivka accepts the fate she was born into and looks at him from the next bed where she sleeps separately according hasidic custom she looks at him glistening eyes not questioning the laws or rebelling against her secondary role and how her religion keeps her from studying the talmud and having all the modern conveniences of life and from seeing movies and tv meir is talmudic scholar his father abu warda is rabbi at the yeshiva he has been married for ten years and his wife has not been able give him child since the hasidim look upon womans role in life being only conceive children and cook and clean house for the man while the mans role is spend his time in prayer therefore there is an insurmountable problem in this otherwise loving marriage she receives an anonymous letter that states woman without child is no better than dead meirs response is that it is written like that in the talmud meirs father tells him that the marriage contract must be broken man who dies without progeny rips page from the torah all the blame is placed on rivka who is thought of as unpure as the reason for her being barren she will go through countless ritual baths cleanse herself as her rigid mother koenig dunks her in the holy water and says ritual prayer for the times she is dunked as an homage the tribes of israel their religion does not permit them be examined extensively doctor rivka goes on the sly and finds out that it is her husband who is sterile but she cannot tell him that because of their religion so when meirs father chooses younger woman for his son she is exiled live alone in cold apartment in the same jewish quarters rivkas spirited younger sister malka does not want get married but wants live more liberated life she has long time romantic relationship fellow hasidic yaakov but because of the way they were both raised she is still virgin when yaakov joined the israeli army fight in lebanon something his sect is not allowed do he is thereby banished from the sect even though he is still believer he now works as singer in nightclub malkas mother is worried that her daughter will not get married so she arranges the rabbi for her marry yossef someone whom she does not love yossef is very stern follower of the order he is also political activist who drives around the city in soundtruck bullhorn urging jews stick together and fight their godless enemies the two sisters are close and languidly discuss their options rivka telling her sister accept the marriage it will make her happy but while malka is reluctantly forced into accepting it she has other plans ruin this bogus marriage the harshest scene in the is on malkas wedding night yossef prays god for child and then robotically gets malka spread her legs and without the least bit of affection only nervousness shown on his part for the function he supplies as he goes inside her and rams her hard thrusting away until the act is completed and then retiring without word or gesture of love the sisters have choices like everyone else in life does but the choices are obliterated ones beliefs circumstances and inward nature and how difficult it is carry out those choices if it goes completely against the way one is brought up for the sisters the choices are life or death ones gitai closing in on the daily rituals tight living quarters and closeknit community has shown how difficult these choices are for those who have never seen another world and have been kept in the dark all their life the ends the forlorn malka walking atop of jerusalem and looking down upon it as an outsider would and everything seems strange her all the things she once thought of as being set in stone are now harsh memories as she has made her choice and the price of that choice is very heavy indeed

the magnolia can be compared simple flower as its title and movie poster suggests the dozens of characters introduced and developed are like the petals on the flower they all come from the same stem and as the flower begins develop they grow farther and farther apart the numerous characters in the are all closely connected no matter how different they are from one another socially from humiliated but kind cop an aging game show host each one of these characters is suffering the same kind of pain they are each seriously lonely and seek the perfect companion end this loneliness whether this companion is distant family member or spouse each character begs for one and spends the whole searching for the perfect one magnolia is clever well thought out from prodigy directorwriter paul thomas anderson of boogie nights fame the detailed character analyses and the powerful script make magnolia memorable however what really is impressive is that even though there are tons of characters in several unrelated stories the is never confusing andersons control over transitioning from one story another story is masterful he also knows exactly when cut another subplot since not one of magnolias scenes drag on too long any three hour that does not deliver even one uninteresting scene is definitely worth recommending from the fascinating beginning the risky yet surprisingly satisfying ending the just does not get boring it is obvious that anderson put lot of time into connecting each subplot this is the ultimate game of six degrees of separation every character is connected every other character at the most two degrees for example cop john reilly is connected game show host phillip baker hall through halls daughter melora walters who once went on date reilly the fact that each character is so different from the others yet so similar shows that there are universal pains that all classes races and genders suffer andersons explanation prove this point is both accurate and convincing the only mistake anderson made in trying connect his characters was making his actors all sing an aimee mann song simultaneously this was foolish not only because it was unbelievable and hilariously erroneous but also because it had broadway musical feel it and this movie is about as far apart from your typical broadway musical than you can get the performances in magnolia are perfection this is classic example of flawless casting and flawless ensemble acting anderson allows many of hollywoods best supporting actors blossom at what they do best character acting all of the main characters in each story are perfect because they are able reveal more emotions and attitudes in their brief time on the screen then most movie stars can do in feature length worth noting is tom cruise who stepped out of his usual superficial starring role and into funny but depressing tour de force performance he was probably noticed more than the other actors in the award givers because his role here is so much different and impressive than those in the past however any actor in this could be nominated for best supporting actor without any complaints the only problem had the acting was that few of the characters felt seriously edited down such as melinda dillons character as phillip baker halls wife she seemed be thrown in towards the end and felt very little sympathy for her because had not seen her enough earlier in the magnolia uses several effective metaphors describe its characters anderson has the talent make the audience sympathetic towards numerous people in only few hours see that anderson is able perfectly portray this many different types of people shows that he has keen sense of diversity diversity is what makes director successful for long period of time predict lot of diversity and success from anderson in the future

no humans were harmed tested or tasted in the making of this all recipes are fictions twentieth century fox does not condone cannibalism psychological thriller that will scare you the depth of your soul directorwriter antonia bird shows us that the most terrifying horror is not provided giant beasts but instead monsters lurking in ourselves they were party of settlers in covered wagon times and they had resent cannibalism in order stay alive this true story briefly mentioned in the shining has no turned into minutes long motion picture in the united states was land of pioneers of goldstarved americans making their way west it was period of manifest destiny the inevitability of the country extending its boundaries stretching out its arms and consuming all the land it could capt john boyd guy pearce has become both hero and victim during this period of relentless consumption in ways he could never have imagined boyds journey hell begins when he is awarded for an act of cowardice during horrific mexicanamerican war battle earns him banishment desolate military outpost waystation for western travelers in the barren and icy sierra nevada mountains in california upon his arrival he is greeted small motley group of soldiers including his commanding officer hart jeffrey jones previously intelligent and sophisticated man who has lost his aristocratic origin in the heat of battle and has pretty much given up on life toffler jeremy davies the forts personal emissary the lord knox stephen spinella the veterinarian that plays doctor who never met bottle of whiskey he did not like reich neal mcdonough the nononsense soldier of the group and the seriously overmedicated cleaves david arquette cook whose meals are inspired more peyote than culinary ambitions into this cold bleak and bizarre world staggers stranger colqhoun robert carlyle halfstarved scot who had been traveling group of settlers until they became snowbound seeking refuge in cave they soon ran out of food and were forced consume one another colqhoun barely escaped becoming an hors doeuvre himself our heroes then decide journey through the mountains find the survivors and colqhoun tags along help out soon it becomes clear that colqhouns tale has ramifications beyond cannibalism and the will survive it involves an old indian myth called weendigo states that man who eats the flesh of another steals that persons strength spirit and very essence his hunger becomes an insatiable craving the more he eats the more he wants and the stronger he becomes there can never be enough and death is the only escape it is all fairly sickening and you have have healthy stomach see the whole movie through as professionally made as the movie is you have wonder who they thought would come piling into the theater see this teenage horror fans will not care because none of the soldiers look remotely like neve campell older folks might show up when they hear that the movie is actually satire about the pioneer spirit but they will be disappointed once all the raw meat starts getting waved in their faces but jokes aside this is that is well worth watching it has wonderful and mature characters that few horror can boast of and strangely effective story that continues electrify you till the end the two main characters are also the most interesting boyd is simple honest man tiered of war killing and fear his sacred wish is live normal quite life away from gunpowder and blood colqhoun is different he proves that man on the brink of death would do anything stay alive including sacrificing his own soul he believes so much in this indian myth that he starts change physically it is the power of the human mind and conviction that make miracles happen the atmosphere in ravenous is macabre and bizarre scary and surreal completely isolated from the rest of the world stands fort spencer here time stands still and nothing changes the inhabitants are soldiers driven war and pillage they are all somehow losers of society that have been banished men that are used killing and have not done anything else in their entire life men that are nothing and has nothing loose the result is some sort of cabin fever cannibalism is more like sick game for them since they find no pleasure in living they find some excitement in killing and dying it is like who is going die first the unchangeable icy landscape where birds do not sing and even wind does not move the leaves on the trees resembles kubricks the shining it is hard not get mad here one of the scary aspects of the is strange connection that the viewer establishes the characters and starts understand them although they have turned into half crazed killers music is another factor that strengthens the atmosphere strange musical score composed michael nyman the piano and damon albarn that often seems out of place and in complete contrast the image somehow reflects the characters twisted reactions on the world and their situation the director herself stated that it was ok laugh during the picture and must admit that it is often very funny in strange way such as the wonderful quote it is lonely being cannibal you do not get that many friends or when colqhoun is quoting ben franklin saying eat live do not live eat but mostly it is frightening and shocking as it goes deeper into the minds of these strange men and we witness their psychological change every actor does great job especially robert carlyle as the sinister and intelligent cannibal and guy pearce as the moral and honest soldier nagged his undeserved honor this strange couple resemble lestat and lois in neil jordans interview the vampire actually there are many amusing parallels and connections vampire movies since the topics are so alike ravenous starts wonderfully and continues shock and scare until it gets the finale where it looses focus and gets too primitive and rather boring however these little failures do not diminish the impression this is bizarre dark comedy about the human mind and its change in different situations it is scary fable about the monster that lurks in everyones soul dark side we are all trying hide but it is there always it is one of the most frightening and successful horror films since the shining said no food did not say there was nothing eat colqhoun ravenous

good will hunting is two movies in one an independent take on the struggle of four boston pals and traditional prodigy child complete upbeats downfalls sporadically moving situations and plenty plenty of shtick unusually directed gus van sant good will hunting overcomes the banalities of its story affirming the emergence of fresh new talent the stars matt damon as will hunting as mathematical rebellious whiz kid inadvertly discovered college professor stellan skarsgard who places him under psychological supervision robin williams in nutshell that is it the core of the good will hunting is damon who infuses the script co written chasing amys ben affleck just the right amount of warmth sensitivity and humanity accentuate his position as refreshing multi talented performer but it is the acting that hits the mark and damon hits all the right notes flying over robin williams dejavu role awakenings was written all over this as devastated shrink who has closed all contact society due his wifes tragic death damon effortlessly blends the carelesness of gregarious confused thug the absorbing ingeniousness of someone like einstein his rich complex character is the pulp of good will hunting everything else pales in comparison good will hunting exposes the lack of profoundness of deliberately schmaltzy storytelling but unlike little man tate or phenomenon it does not set up its story in black and white point point be manner but as the saga of an extraordinary individual whose feasibility for success does not automatically signify he must make easy familiar choices like the protagonists in the aforementioned

curdled is deliciously dark and witty black comedy but its humour will not appeal everyone be specific let me give you an example do you know in pulp fiction where jules and vincent go on brain detail after marvin and his head accidentally get separated if you thought that was completely tasteless and unfunny do not see curdled on the other hand if you found that sequence be pretty funny you have the sense of humour that curdled is aimed at our films heroine gabriela played angela jones is woman obssessively curious about murder and serial killers she even keeps scrapbook of news articles luckily for her miami is being plagued serial killer rampage her scrapbook is getting pretty big the killers nickname in the press is the blue blood killer because he preys on older rich socialite women and he is played william baldwin this is not spoiler one particularly striking o on the blue blood killer is his propensity decapitate his victims gabriela is watching television one day when she spots an advertisement for firm whose line of work is perfectly attuned her interests she immediately quits her job and signs on pfcs stands for postforensic cleaning service no points for guessing what they do her workmates are confused gabrielas fascination murder them it is just day job there is hilarious locker room scene where they debate whether decapitated heads can talk and what they would say gabrielas partner elena played mel gorham is particularly perturbed gabrielas wideeyed fascination and becomes really upset when gabriela volunteers them clean up the blue blood killers latest scene they are the messiest you see unbeknownst them the last victim left something on the scene would id the blue blood killer so he is also heading over there the comparison pulp fiction earlier on was not accidental quentin tarantino executiveproduced this began life as short he saw at festival apparently tarantino was so impressed that he helped braddock convert this into featurelength there are other parallels the star of curdled is angela jones the top billing goes william baldwin but really jones is the central character who is probably best known for her role as esmerelda villalobos the deathobssessed taxi driver in pulp fiction that role was written specifically for jones based upon her similar character in the aforementioned short curdled jr jones is great in curdled she is wonderfully funny and maintains an amusing wideeyed naive curiousity about murder without compromising her characters innocence or likeability she can express so much one lift of her eyebrow it is great performance reb braddocks direction is extremely sharp and clever toeing the line between black humour and bad taste the best scene in the is an outrageously funny sequence involves jones and dancing any more than that would be spoiler the opening credit sequence is also inventive and amusing of course it is impossible really take this stuff seriously but then again you are not really supposed braddock knows the audience is in on the joke and makes it fun little romp as result the one drawback of curdled is that it was based on short and it feels like it the material is just stretched too thin in order fulfill feature length running time and some parts just seem drag while its running time is already short minutes it could really stand lose twenty minutes or so give it better pacing curdled seems destined be nice cult for miramax it will be interesting see if it will appeal mainstream audiences as well

it is often said his fans that hal hartley movies are an acquired taste indeed while perhaps less dangerous than tequila shooters or bungeejumping they require no less amount of physical stamina and concentration felt rewarded at the end of henry fool this movie creeps up on youat slow minutes mean creepsand despite the final shots ambiguity left completely satisfied henry fool used have an arrives at garbageman simon grims house claims the vacant basement apartment and almost instantly inspires simon urbaniak take up writinghenry martin donovan lookalike ryan is an exconvict oncegreat author who has been exiled and marginalized the publishing community because of his criminal activity simons poetry turns him into local sensation as it causes mute women sing highschool girls swoon and councilmen rile against its pornographic content meanwhile henry seduces both simons dependent mother porter and immature sister sundance queen posey philosophical babble is turns brilliant and inane and breathy animal lust these story elements result in climaxes both inevitable and unpredictable the teacherstudent relationship formed between henry and simon eventually reverses itself henry fool is sprinkled hartleyian flourishes simon drinks milk from udderleys the big teen hangout is called world of donuts simon wears his garbagemans uniform throughout the editing style is decidedly elliptical is key the conclusions said ambiguity the performances the three leads are abrasive at first selfconsciously quirky the introductory scenes are chore these people do grow on you because they convey genuine passion belief in themselves and because they have longterm goals henry and simon may drink lot of budweiser and hang out on the streetcorner but they are not pop slackers the story is rather classical the tutor is better talker than doer raised on books the timid tutee has innate talent his master only dreams of shades of school the finished is epic in its proportions for story so small and the final third does test ones patience yet henry fool is tight hardly excessive in its length how refreshing see movie this long in devoted entirely character and unless nodded off not single building exploded this hartleys seventh feature is contemplative about the artist fortunately we never get sampling of simons work and it is testament the actors and the screenplay that the end we can surmise what sort of thoughts would pour from these writers pens

most people fit into two different categories you either love woody allen or you hate his guts my family for the most part hates him and his movies think he is very funny but his shtick has gotten forced and contrived over the years so maybe taking his body away was the best decision any producer could have thought of unrestrained physical boundaries allens humor comes shining through those who had problems his physical appearance will be able join the rest of us in laughing at allens intelligent observations of life those who had problems his verbal comedy may want skip this one in was introduced audiences sparked their imaginations and showed them something they would never seen before toy story used stateoftheart computer technology and presented world of toys who would come alive when no humans were present many critics will call that better but believe they only say that because it was completely original motion picture antz however has upped the ante considerably disneys bugs life is not due out for another two months and dreamworks seems have received the better end of the deal beating disney out they have satisfied the audiences thirst for computeranimated films but do not let that fool you disney is definitely not scared in the past two years competitions have broken out between studios in it was the volcano duel in my opinion dantes peak came out way ahead of its predecessor both in time and in quality volcano had an original premise but destroyed that some very ridiculous situations in there are twice as many competing films first was the comet competition and armageddon blew away it is cheesily dramatic competitor deep impact but now it is even more interesting as one beloved studio disney goes up against the newcomer dreamworks who will prevail time will tell but am sure that mr mouse has nothing fear this may sound like did not like antz on the contrary would put it up there toy story but due it is pg rating many parents may be put off some of the dialogue should not appear in disneys version some of the dialogue in antz pushes the envelope for familyoriented sexual innuendoes and profanity pop up occasionally makes dreamworks animated feature geared more for an adult crowd the humor is also written especially for adults though many kids were laughing in the theater attended this is the type of that should be made for families more often entertaining for kids and entertaining for parents antz begins hilarious monologue seems meld between woody allens shtick and franz kafkas metamorphosis the short story of man who wakes up discover himself as bug allen is troubled ant believing he was not made be worker when you are the middle child in family of five million he comments about his neglected childhood one night is sitting in bar his friend weaver sylvester stallone discussing his pathetic place in life in walks princess bala sharon stone whom no one recognizes without crown bala asks is he would like dance and they engage in pulp fictionesque dance while everyone else is following the leader after discovering that she is the princess falls in love but there is problem bala is getting married general mandible gene hackman ruthless leader who merely wants control better and stronger colony in order do that he must eliminate not only the queen anne bancroft but the weakest of the colony namely the worker ants but get rid of the queen he needs get rid of the loyal army ants who would be willing die for her he and colonel cutter christopher walkin come up plan send the loyal ants off battle where they will surely be killed the queen is reluctant at first but decides it is best for the colony meanwhile wants meet bala again and he asks weaver an army ant switch places him so gets sent off battle but he manages survive the slaughter the termites the battle sequence is absolutely stunning though you may have flashbacks starship troopers contained very similar sequence however antz and that were both in production around the same time so the similarities are merely coincidence the second half of the revolves around zs kidnapping of bala and their search for mythical place called insectopia there an ant can be his own boss and have all the food he wants the adventures and bala get into are surprisingly high in tension especially one involving magnifying glass looming over the targets like the spaceships from independence day in fact am just going assume that the producers referenced id intentionally the ants look up in awe and then beam of fire blasts into the ground visually it is an exciting rush of adrenaline but do not be fooled little kids should not see this as they may just try and copy it after seeing antz vowed never intentionally step on an ant again hopefully children will learn that killing ants is rather cruel as an animated antz is probably the best you will find date visually it is as stunning as what dreams may come the best aspect of animation is the fact that the characters are not limited gravity they can take ridiculous situations and make them seem plausible one great moment involves mass of worker ants bunching up form wrecking ball the animation is so perfect that you can virtually see every single ant on the ball however the most exhilarating scene involves bala getting stuck the bottom of young boys shoe it is truly great example of making at its finest computer technology the animators have carefully made the ants faces look similar the actors providing the voices the best example would have be barbatus danny glover at one point you can even see the pores on his face although doubt ants have pores do they barbatus also has touching but rather gruesome scene as he has his final words without body young kids may be disturbed the site of dismembered head but good deal of humor is derived more appropriate for adults of course disneys bugs life looks good but do not know if they will be able best dreamworks newest animated feature in terms of animation if not then dreamworks will have done something no other studio could do go head head the big mouse and knock him down yes anastasia was good but not nearly as good as even the worst of disney vocal talent is always essential an animated feature and antz has one of the best lineups seen since toy story in fact it far exceeds that one woody allen has always been funny but here he transcends most of what he is done in the past few years without body his comic timing is the most noticeable thing in fact am pretty sure that the writers let him improvise lot of his lines sharon stone as bala shows off some of her comic ability though for the most part stone works best as dramatic actress sylvester stallone teamed up stone once again is beginning solidify his statement that he wants be an actor not typecast action star after snub at the oscars last year stallone is proving himself as the serious or comedic as illustrated here actor that he is gene hackman is superb as the grufftalking general almost doing another take on his crimson tide persona christopher walkin is probably more noticed his voice and so many people will remember him from such hits as batman returns anne bancroft has minimal role but she is effective nonetheless danny glover has small role but he does very very good job dan aykroyd and jane curtin also lend their voices as two lovesick eurotrash beesboth are very unrecognizable especially aykroyd jennifer lopez plays worker ant who falls in love weaver although most people will not recognize her voice either many people will recognize grant shauds voice as the foreman he played miles on the tv show murphy brown this is definitely huge cast some highprofile names and it will definitely help it is grosses of course you can probably tell where lot of the million budget went also directors eric darnell and lawrence guterman are relative newcomers though guterman did direct feature headless but both show an incredible talent for this type of picture tense at times and very funny throughout the two hold this together like professionals the screenplay todd alcott and chris weitz is quite simple in plot but it contains lot of subtlety that makes the more suitable for adults kids will delight in the animation while parents can laugh heartily at the humor most of it will go over young childrens heads does that mean you should not take kids see it not at all they will have lot of fun watching this one what is great is the themes that are given us part social commentary part romance story and part moral drama antz gives everyone something talk about whether it be the animation or the discussions of individualism and community thankfully it is not subtle in either aspects antz is rated pg for mild language and some intense action sometimes the language can be pushing the limits for family movie but the violence is what should keep kids at home the battle scene has ants melting in acid and bugs being speared death and the magnifying scene shows an ant disintegrate in the beam of sunlight but other than that and some sexual innuendos it is perfect choice for some wholesome fun at the theaters doubt many children will understand the sexual innuendos unless they are old enough but it is still advisable leave really young children at home have confused you enough if you do take your kids recommend seeing the them because more than likely you will enjoy it the most

that is the question asked myself when venturing nervously into the wedding singer the latest star the saturday night live alumnus does he draw laughs from his sad puppy dog expression and do nothatemeforbeingasimpleton observations or do fans giggle when he screams at the top of his lungs at people or is it just the fact that he sings songs silly lyrics that bowl audiences over well there is little bit of all of that in the wedding singer and while exited the theater still not one hundred percent sure of mr sandlers thing did have surprisingly good time that is because in nutshell the wedding singer is one of the sweetest movies you are ever likely come across that is right sweet the humor in the runs the gamut from dumb mildly amusing laughoutloud hysterical but the tone well it is just lovely have admit was halfexpecting farting armpit humor gratuitous nudity superfluous cloying subplots and some nasty unnecessary violence instead well have said it before sweet the year is and sandler plays robbie hart the eponymous wedding singer job aspiring rock stars often settle for when robbies fianc dumps him at his own altar robbie gets depressed and turns plucky waitress called julia drew barrymore who has some problems of her own she is marrying hunky junk bonds dealer who unbeknownst her is not that big on monogamy it is not giving anything away say that robbie and julia fall in love aww sandler and barrymore are good match and they are assisted some terrific cameo appearances including steve buscemi and jon lovitz whose individual scenes are perhaps the funniest in the writer tim herlihy uncredited assistance from carrie fisher keeps the story bubbling along its predictable conclusion it does not all work but it is handled such lightheartedness that robbie and julia coming together generates more smiles than groans herlihy and director frank coraci have done great job of recreating the sights sounds and affectations of the the soundtrackan everpresent force in the filmis packed walltowall hits of the period new wave upon new wave of songs from billy idols white wedding the smiths how soon is now culture clubs do you really want hurt me the mix of music and fashion would make the wedding singer great double feature boogie nights if you grew up listening the cure and flock of seagulls and the psychedelic furs then the wedding singer is bound put nostalgic hop in your stride if you are fan of the lovable laughable adam sandler well let us just say that the wedding singer might well be the only in recent memory make me want rent happy gilmore

jarvis cocker of pulp once said that he wrote common people after noticing mike leigh boxsets on the video shelves he had feeling that economic deprivation was becoming tourist experience for the welloff maybe it is classic case of displacement it is easier see jarvis own lyrics obsessed acrylic and wood chip on the wall as fetishization of lowlife rather than leighs films but it is worth being reminded that drab interiors and couple of workingclass characters do not make for guarantee of authenticity let alone good it is the triumph of secrets lies then that it goes beyond gestures of sympathy for the common people into probing of just what it means seek authenticity and honesty in everyday lives following her adopted mothers funeral hortense young black optometrist sets out find her birth mother and is disturbed find out that she is white it is cynthia factory worker who lives in shabby house her perpetually moody daughter roxanne cynthias younger brother maurice is successful photographer who has not seen his sister for ages largely because of his wifes animosity towards her hortense calls up cynthia who initially breaks down in tears and refuses see her but their mutually suspicious meeting gives way warm friendship eventually cynthia invites hortense come along party maurice is hosting secrets lies has simple enough theme at its heart as one character puts it best tell the truth is not it that way nobody gets hurt but if the delivers much more than trite message it is because we are also shown how hard it can be face up ugly truths even while the evasions and unspoken grievances slowly choke us hence cynthias difficulty acknowledging first herself then others that hortense is her daughter one of her first reactions seeing hortense is sincere denial that she has ever been black man before longsuppressed memory seizes her at the party cynthias pretense that hortense is her factory coworker leads her ever more convoluted lies as agonizing as they are funny little lies seep into every corner like maurice pretending that he is just dropping when he visits cynthia after much deliberation maurices job as photographer gives the opportunities for side comments on the main theme sadlooking bride that maurice coaxes smile couple who pose awkwardly prominent wedding ring and argue about his spectacles one of the most startling images is of beautiful woman large scars on her face she says she needs the photo look as bad as possible collect insurance money yet the short scene leaves you wondering about what untold story lies behind the scars there are occasionally hilarious moments as when cynthia attempts give her daughter some unwelcome advice on contraception have got dutch cap floating about somewhere upstairs or when cynthia stares at her own rather pedestrian legs and tells roxanne if you have got it flaunt it is what say as played brenda blethyn cynthia comes close being caricature her nervous somewhat disconnected way of talking but she is really just right for the role of someone who inspires sympathy and yet strains the tolerance of those around her precisely because she is so needy of love perhaps indeed the whole cast gives warmly rounded detailed performances the script was developed partly through improvisations and the fusion of cast script and director shows best in the party scene seemingly everyone is talking at the same time and yet many subtle observations are being made throughout in very different way but also using long single shot the scene of hortense and cynthias first meeting in lonely cafa achieves touching intensity all the more for their reticence and unspoken feelings the films climax all the secrets and lies finally spilled out in ibsenesque revelations and everybody hugging each other is the one thing that seems false about this however it is that truly earns its happy ending after the misery and repression of the characters lives when cynthia says near the end this is the life innit you get the sense that following the cynicism of his last naked leigh has rediscovered that life can be sweet after all without comforting illusions the flying inkpots rating system wait for the video little creaky but still better than staying at home gotcha pretty good bring friend amazing potent stuff perfection see it twice

richard linklaters slacker made in for budget of only immerses itself in the twentysomething collegetown culture of austin texas most of these characters are either unemployed or work jobs that are apparently too menial be worth mentioning their lifestyle is sort of passive resistance the idea that people should go out and actively pursue career after graduation they seem content sit around spouting off about the inadequacy of american democracy the pervasiveness of slave morality the subtle messages in pop culture and such ask them what they have been doing lately and they will more likely than not reply oh you know just hanging out linklater uses an interesting technique examine these characters the camera follows one person for few minutes then someone else walks and the camera follows that person who walks into diner just as another person is walking out the door it is certainly lot of fun listening these characters talk some of them are clearly very intelligent and have some genuinely insightful ideas some of them are just plain weird and some of them think their ideas are lot more profound than they really are the opening monologue delivered linklater himself taxi driver tosses around ideas about alternate realities that nicely set up the meandering structure of the other characters along the way offer observations about everything from dating relationships the history of anarchist philosophy while groups of pseudointellectuals kick around ideas about the nobility of sitting around and doing nothing or the subtle briberybased morality in scoobydoo for the most part however the best moments are the ones involving the slightly unhinged types near the beginning paranoid man follows pedestrian for several blocks warning him about government conspiracies involving everything from global warming secret colonization of mars another man seems be collecting televisions keeping at least fifteen sets running at the same time and playing tapes of graduate student who recorded himself having nervous breakdown and destroying the camera and in scene that drew big laugh from everyone present when saw the man tries achieve closure after failed relationship reciting poetry on bridge and then throwing typewriter into the creek below the only problem slacker is that it starts run out of steam towards the end since linklater only spends few minutes each character the introduction of the new characters gets repetitive after while there are only so many times you can hear hey what is going on not much what are you up nothing really just hanging around before it gets on your nerves the might well have benefited from slightly slower pace and little bit more characterization and the dialogue in the second half of the is and large not quite as interesting as that in the first half jfk buff for example seems like pale imitation of the previous conspiracy theorist and many of the characters just generally are not as weird or unique instead of depicting city populated mostly normal people and then showing us the strangeness that we might not have noticed at first linklater shows us the oddballs first then stops and reminds us that ordinary people live there too slacker is good and wonderfully offbeat and entertaining comedy whatever its flaws and its status as cult classic is welldeserved just cannot help but think it might have been even better if linklater had slowed down little bit and filmed these scenes in reverse order

breed apart casts rutger hauer as crazy birdloving recluse who picks his feathered friends over kathleen turner bit hard swallow that is only the first of many improbabilities in this hauer stars as man obsessed keeping the birds on his island safe while boothe plays guy hired steal couple of rare eagle eggs rich egg collector turner is the woman caught between the two men breed apart is not bad movie exactly indeed found myself rooting for both the hauer and boothe characters even though their goals could not be more different the problem the is that there are just too many inconsistencies for example early on in the hauer physically assaults two drunken rednecks shooting at his birds later on the rednecks come back for revenge four other people and hauer kills few of them have tough time believing that the police would not get involved at that point another problem is the silly lovetriangle that develops did not care one way or the other who ended up turner was more interested in finding out of the two men would be victorious in their respective missions however despite this uninteresting subplot turner did manage give great performance as the woman who reminds the two men that sometimes there is more life than money and birds as for hauer he is an actor have always admired he has penchant for picking strange and unusual characters and this one is no exception he is frequently seen riding around his island on white horse wearing pirates clothing and holstering crossbow despite all his eccentric mannerisms though hauer always manages let the human side of his character shine through for example there is scene in he barks at turner and her son because they came onto his island day early he comes off as crazy loner in that scene but few minutes later he is apologizing turner and we believe his intentions soon after we find out he is vietnam vet and his actions become fairly clear us breed apart is not great movie any means but it does contain good performances all three leads and it is worth seeing for that reason alone

titanic is so close being the perfect movie it is upsetting that it is not the cost million make and could of put th century fox into lot of finicial trouble if it sunk pun intended is labour of love for cameron who wrote and directed the we all know that big budget dosent mean great see waterworld but titanic is far superior kevin costners waterlogged epic but sadly titanic just misses the mark of masterpiece although it is one of camerons best films the starts present day explorers searching the runied titanic they find safe and inside picture of woman the woman in the picture an old winslet tells the explorers that the picture is of her the explorers invite her over and she then tells her story of titanic in the flashback dicaprio plays poor boy jack dawson who after winning poker game wins two tickets board the grand ship titanic leaving liverpool go america also boarding the ship is rich woman rose dewitt bukater winslet who is being forced into marriage man she dosent love at all cal hockley zane so her family can remain rich she nearly commits suicide on the ship but jack comes the rescue saves rose they fall in love and cal gets jealous and eventually tries kill them oh yeah and the ship sinks and that is the main problem the and stops it from being work of genius the story and script both cameron are both weak the story is full of cliched characters the creepy man who the nice girl has marry the poor boy heart the stuckup mother and poor dialogue the script consists of lots of injokes of how the boat will not sink and most of the dialogue is pretty basic it is shame really as the audience does have sit through hours of this without good dialogue could become very long very boring like camerons own terminator but luckily there are some redeeming features that make the story and dialogue problems just disappear firstly there is camerons direction there are some great sweeping shots of the titanic and some clever fades between the flashback titanic and the ruined titanic but the scenes cameron directs especially well are the disaster scenes at the end there is lot of mayhem and panic all done very well cameron it is scary sight watching bodies fall from great heights into the watery depths below thanks camerons direction then the audiences attention is held for the full hours minutes support the directing are the excellent cast working very well their underwritten characters dicaprio is good although he only looks years old his performance of over excitiable yet also well mannered boy is excellent and he also has some funny lines winslet is great also and her transistion from well mannered rich girl rebelous young adult is pretty smooth zane is deliciously evil as cal saying every line sneer and flicker of the eye lash the audience really does come hate him he may be playing the same character he plays in every he is in like dead calm but he does it really really well also worthy of note is kathy bates edward scissorhands as loud mouthed american finally the icing on the great things cake are the special effects cameron is whiz effects just watch aliens terminator and true lies and they are used very well throughout the sweeps of the ships are awesome although digital domain who did the effects cannot animate human movement too well the humans seem move smoothly there is just something odd about them you can tell that they have been animated on computer of course the ship sinking scenes are awesome bodies flying all over the place and the scene where the ship splits in half has be seen be believed titanic is one of the only films where effects have reinforced the titanic then is wonder of directing acting and cgi but not writing and story again like most of camerons films the editing is loose cameron edits himself and the could of come in under three hours few more cuts titanic then although not the godfather of movies it could of been is wonderful attempt at creating work of genius enjoyable scary and even sad titanic is cinema was invented for filling the screen incredible images and assaulting the ears awesome sound superb but sadly not perfect overall rating

on seeing the outrageous previews for bulworth one wonders what plot could possibly allow beatty get away making those statements in case you missed it warren beatty plays politician on the campaign trail he says black congregation if you cannot cut down on malt liquor and chicken wings and get behind someone other than running back who stabs his wife you are never gonna get rid of me well there is such plot and it works very well in this comedy beatty plays jay billington bulworth longtime democratic senator from california the movie opens on painfully repetitious montage of bulworths latest commercials condemning affirmative action the montage is ironically intercut pictures of martin luther king and bulworth in his youth working jack kennedy when we finally lay eyes on bulworth he is morosely weeping in front of his tv having gone without food or sleep for days his campaign is entering the final weekend before the primaries but his depression has sunk in too far for him care first he calls lobbyist from the insurance industry get bribe million life insurance policy in his daughters name then he calls an associate arrange for his own assassination his assistant murphy oliver platt is oblivious bulworths suicidal state and drags him his speaking engagements bulworth halfheartedly reads his speech at an africanamerican church then takes questions from the audience he is hit hard questions about his voting record he had promised money help rebuild the community after the riots and it has not shown up since he is dead man anyway he figures he will answer truthfully he and bill clinton and newt gingrich came a for the photo opportunity they made some promises that improved their public image for while and then counted on the media and the public eventually forget about the promises they made the shock and outrage from the congregation grows the questions keep coming and he keeps shooting back honest if ugly answers before go further would like make distinction that the denver post failed make and that is that characterizing africanamericans as maltliquor drinking j fans is not part of bulworths truth that line is in the trailers but it should not be praised like the other political confessions he makes in the movie when the critics praise beatty for speaking the truth about politics this line is not what they are talking about the experience is liberating nothing left lose bulworth is no longer restricted burping generic platitudes out of both sides of his mouth he can say whatever he wants because he is going be dead anyway why not tell the people the truth about being sleazy politician that he is bought and paid for lobbyists and that racism among the populace protects politicians from being the target of charges of classism bulworths candor wins him three volunteers from the church one of whom nikki halle barry he gets crush on he feels so good afterwards that he actually eats something chicken wings appropriately enough bulworth shows up late for his meeting some movie studio executives when one of them asks where he stands on government regulation of movie and tv ratings bulworth drifts the topic of the quality of filmed entertainment so much money and so many talented people working so hard he wonders why cannot make quality product you go warren when they become indignant and ask why he is talking them if he has such low opinion of their product he callously admits that it is because they are rich jews that night he drops the three africanamerican volunteers at their nightclub and he decides go in them he stays up all night drinking smoking pot dancing falling in love nikki and learning scratch turntables and rap the next day he shuns his prepared speech and instead raps the suitandtie fundraisers from then on at all of his political appearances he raps his political truth his rap is not bad for middleaged white guy he is not very good but it is his first try and at least he is not embarrassingly bad his lobbyists are not amused but the rest of his constituency seems like the new bulworth eventually the movies plot remember he hired hit man overtakes the politics is too bad screen time is spent bulworth trying cancel the request for his assassination while the hit man seems be closing in on him there are even few gratuitous chase scenes bulworth fleeing his killer these scenes may have been necessary keep the events of the moving along but it distracted and detracted from bulworths political ranting was much more interesting than the everpresent obviouslooking assassin still most of the movie is original and very enjoyable and beatty deserves most of credit for bringing it the screen as the story and screen writer he came up first good structure then good dialogue back it up jeremy pikser cowrote the screenplay as an actor he was able convincingly portray bulworths depression then liberation and rebirth as producer there were four others he was able keep the movie free from hollywoods indulgent formulas except for those inexcusable chase scenes someone else probably could have directed but since he was there anyway what the heck it is too bad that there are not more movies like this around movies that tackle political corruption in way that challenges viewers pay more attention real politics after all much of the inspiration for bulworth is straight out of the news just little perception and insight and you could write your own bulworth rants just do not expect be popular the insurance companies

american pie acknowledges cold hard fact that most movies do not it is very difficult get laid its four virgin heroes are jim biggs chronic masturbator kev nicholas who desperately wants deflower his girlfriend reid oz klein lacrosse player whose approach requires some fine tuning and finch eddie kaye thomas germphobe his crass nickname is hilarious but will not spoil it here who pays classmate spread rumours about the size of his member jim kev oz and finch attend high school in suburban michigan full of so many impossibly beautiful women it is no wonder they are horny all the time after party at their studly friend stiflers seann william scott in the films sharpest performance house leaves them sexually unsatisfied the quartet make pact lose it graduationspecifically prom night is only few weeks away american pie is in the tradition of bachelor party or revenge of the nerds almost every conversation these characters have revolves around makin whoopee all women are there be ogled alyson hannigans perky music student is the only memorable female of the bunch situations abound that defy logic only arouse andor amuse its core audience adolescent boys arouse nadias shannon elizabeth internet stripteasean unexpectedly raucous and guiltily pleasurable sequence amuse jims lusty encounter hot apple pie what differentiates american pie from those dirty eighties comedies aside from very nineties obsession bodily fluids is cast that is light years more appealing than that of say just one of the guys two more standouts klein and sctv eugene levy klein plays kindhearted athlete for the second time in row after alexander paynes underappreciated election hope see more of this warm actor the disarmingly honest face very soon levys is the most crowdpleasing performance and indeed it is nice see him back on the big screen in role that makes wonderful use of that expressive brow american pie also wants emulate the teen flicks your parents _would_ let you watch growing up it skillfully employs broad mix of pop tunes much like john hughes movies did and even pays homage the breakfast club couple of times most evidently when the prom band covers simple minds do not you forget about me the picture ultimately has healthy if obligatory attitude towards safe sexeven at their most libidinous american pies protagonists first whip out condom the filmmakers prove that socially responsible raunch is possible for its familiarity and for its charming leads recommend american pie but the buzz on this had me expecting something fresher as far as the new teen cinema goes it is at the top of the heap do not say did not warn you about the party scene

the summer movie season is still in its infancy but after diasappointing films such as godzilla and fear and loathing in las vegas it would be nice see really good but doubt you could have expected this the truman show is one of the most unique films have ever seen and it deserves spot on the decades best list there is no way isolate any single component of this picture and proclaim yes that is what makes this great the blend of peter weirs masterful and in many ways brilliant direction peter bizious stunning photography and jim carreys performance is what makes this work so fantastically there is something strangely beautiful about every shot in the truman show it may be the use of color or the placement of characters in the frame but everything about this looks intentional and perfect carrey has made very wise choice playing mildmannered truman burbank he allows himself enough room be comical and therefore not alienating his true fans while still showing vulnerable and human side that is side has been missing from nearly every major character he has played in his numerous commercial successes truman burbank was born an audience of millions he was chosen before birth be the focus of hour television show everything in his environment is controlled team of technicians led the show is director christof played ed harris everyone in trumans life is an actor or an extra they are all being watched millions of people around the globe people who can tune in at any time of the day see what is happening in trumans life but he is the only person that is not aware of it the classification of the truman show may be tricky the audience reacted many of trumans revelations laughter did not laugh much during the because was so emotionally wrapped up the character the things that made the audience laugh gave me glassy eyes because what was happening him indeed what had been done him his whole life was wrong so is this going end up labeled as comedy drama it really depends on the audience but me the truman show was touching sad tale about the extents corporation will go exploit human life for the entertainment of others but above all else the truman show was stunningly beautiful picture humor heart and scary realism oscar predictions in june are pointless but if the truman show had been released on schedule in late fall or winter of as originally planned james cameron would be oscarless

one way of telling if is good or not is the length if is only minutes but feels like minutes then it is crap but if last hours and feels like minutes then it is excellent boogie nights falls into the latter catagory the director anderson delivers funny hip yet sometimes violent flies along mark whalberg k marky mark plays eddie adams seventeen year old certain gift in the midriff area jack horner reynolds is adult director who decides that eddie would be great in the adult movie business after running away from home eddie joins jack changes his name dirk diggler and starts making erotic movies in the movie business dirk meets whole load of characters the introduces very quickly and slickly such as scotty phillip seymour hoffman rollergirl graham amber moore and floyd phillip baker hall and little bill william macy all the characters are well written well played and the audience gets know them pretty well thanks the excellent script we learn about ambers grief about not being able see her child due divorce rollergirls hard time at school and little bills wife who sleeps everyone except her husband but the best thing about the excellent boogie nights is paul andersons direction and writing the direction is fast thrilling and never holds up there are some great shots some lovely steadiocam and handheld camera sequences and lots of other neat directional touches the writing is fabulous some intelligent dialogue some funny dialogue but none of the dialogue is crap like most films such as the lost world jurassic park or tommorow never dies boogie nights really is spectacular feat of direction and writing on par and sometimes betters quentin tarantinos films resevoir dogs and pulp fiction the soundtrack is also excellent like american graffiti the features some great old songs on the soundtrack heightens the atmosphere and gives the an extra lift also the costumes are great the clothes really do look like what people wore in the seventies and eighties the although excellent does have some flaws firstly wahlberg although excellent cannot do highly scenes require him be angry in both scenes where he has act angry his acting is so off the scenes tension and anger is lost but the rest of the cast are excellent burt reynolds is brilliant julianne moore shows real emotion and william macy is great aswell but he always is another flaw the though is that the ending seems bit tacked on it seems anderson saw the was going on bit and needed wrap up quickly it is shame really as the rest of the is perfectly paced but they are small niggles really boogie nights is an excellent superb directing writing acting and music all combine make one spectacular whatever you do do not miss out on boogie nights

it is ironic that the best films in cinema history are invariably the original directors cut of the films such as aliens the abyss the wild bunch blade runner and terminator are all prime examples of filmmakers integrity later chopped up or mucked the studio the advent of the dvd format has provided more accessible way get these original cuts the public and provide freaks like myself the ability become further enraptured the extension of such classic films the dvd release of the original international version of luc bessons masterpiece the professional is known as on around the world is prime example of how good can become an instant classic as directors cut for years have heard of an international version available only in laserdisc format has eluded me for years even bought laserdisc player from my uncle don for bucks just watch certain directors cuts including on but after countless searches in laserdisc stores could never find it until now the follows the story of on played jean reno professional hit man for an italian mob crew run danny aiello he lives next door ferociously independent yearold girl named mathilda played then newcomer natalie portman whose father is involved in drugs and crooked cops one day crew of the cops lead gary oldman in an overthetop performance kills her entire family while mathilda is out buying groceries taking pity on her on hides her in his apartment when she returns save her life mathilda learns of ons hit man profession and decides follow in ons footsteps as cleaner she then falls in love him and manages reawaken emotions within on he has kept locked away as part of his profession at this point the differences in the american version and the international version really kick in the international version contains an additional minutes of footage that pertains directly the relationship of on and mathilda footage that american censors deemed too explicit assume that american censors feel that defining character development is too much for american audiences handle the best part of this extra footage is that gives better understanding of both mathildas and ons motivations pertaining later actions involving oldman and his crew of bad cops there is even previously unseen cameo the great french actor jeanhugues anglade star of queen margot bessons la femme nikita and killing zoe these additional scenes replaced on and matildas relationship brings you emotionally closer the and draws stronger bonds between the characters that were murky in the american version the most ironic thing about the international version of the is that the inclusion of the missing scenes the becomes primarily heavy emotional drama punctuated big action scenes at the beginning and the end of the the betters reflects the serious drama of french cinema but is laced pieces reflecting the brutality of american cinema my advice everyone out there is throw away your copy of the professional throw down twenty bucks and pick up this newly restored cinematic masterpiece directorwriter luc besson producer luc besson claude besson starring jean reno natalie portman gary oldman danny aiello

while it was part of former yugoslavia my country croatia used be almost completely ignored western films in general words croatia and croatians were unheard even in movies whose plots actually took place on croatian locations the rare exception was the dogs of war adaptation of frederick forsyths bestselling novel yet that rare occasion only added insult the injury mentioning croatians in most unflattering context in single line they are referred as bunch of mean people probably terrorists who happen remove parts of arm dealers stomachs when they are unsatisfied the quality of merchandise same line also illustrates the milieu where the movie takes place dark and violent world of shady international deals the blurred boundaries between business politics and crime the movie protagonist shannon christopher walken is mercenary who spent the best years of his life fighting numerous little wars all over the globe his latest job is intelligence mission for powerful mining corporation that demands information about political climate in west african nation of zangaro shannon arrives in that country only find oppressive regime of president kimba bloodthirsty madman whose brutality crushed any opposition and scared almost any westerners away after being arrested and tortured kimbas secret police shannon leaves country help of british journalist north colin blakely upon return he is approached mining company again but this time they want him plan and execute the coup detat against kimba shannon reluctantly agrees and assembles small group of his surviving mercenary friends who begin meticulous preparation for another small war thing that separates the dogs of war from conventional action movies especially those made in is its authenticity almost close documentary it should not surprise anyone because the author of the novel frederick forsyth made reputation blending fiction real life thus creating interesting exciting yet very believable plots for his books those plots were also responsible for few very successful thrillers and one of them zinnemmans the day of the jackal is now considered classic in that genre this one deals soldiers of fortune ancient tradition that was resurrected in great turmoil of and and filled the void left vanishing colonial empires unlike wild geese that used it as pretext for conventional action adventure script george malko and gary de vore author whose death last year became real life mystery is serious and instead of action puts emphasis on characters and prosaic details of their work the movie does not try romanticise the mercenary profession nor glorify mercenaries as some kind of superheroes they are simply shown as deadly yet expendable tool of powerful forces questionable agenda christopher walken played in many movies yet very rarely we can see him in leading role his performance in this perhaps is not breathtaking yet adequate his notoriously expressionless face is perfect illustration of the disillusioned world weary man whose alienation from the normal way of life becomes complete and only remaining ideal is loyalty the shrinking circle of friends although the movie does not lack capable actors their roles are miniature compared walkens and only colin blakely as cynical reporter has opportunity portray his character however those who look familiar faces would find them plenty in the dogs of war tom berenger paul freeman jo beth williams victoria tennant in brief cameo and biggest surprise is ed oneill of married children fame as shannons reluctant colleague this was the first major production for john irvin and it shows why he earned the reputation of capable yet second class director the good script he can make very good movie the bad script he can make real mess luckily the dogs of war had good script irvins direction was very ascetic and it gave the movie almost documentary feel the only distraction is dramatic music of geoffrey burgon used on the wrong places in the final battle scene where we can see mercenaries at work irvin shows us that modern warfare means superior firepower and tactics unlike ramboesque fantasies that rely on macho superheroes unfortunately making battle realistic irvin made it somewhat less attractive and his sloppy editing also did not help but despite those shortcomings this movie remains interesting and rare combination of action thriller and gritty realistic political drama

the happy bastards quick movie review analyze this how does one do comedy focused on the mob well few years ago there was sly little comedy called the freshman had marlon brando doing romp of sendup of his famous don corleone character and recently the utterly stupid in bad way movie mafia failed really get the joke this time around however warner bros may have gotten it right analyze this movie that hits its targets more than it misses and for plenty of reasons the story goes like this mobster robert deniro finds himself receiving several panic attacks as of late fueled the stress of an upcoming mobster meeting and neardeath following driveby shooting it is these attacks that prompt him hire psychiatrist billy crystal who is mostly reluctant take the mobsters case for two reasons first of course he is mobster but secondly he is trying get married and enjoy quiet honeymoon his wife lisa kudrow and kid and of course he cannot rest worth for moment because the mobsters goons are always needing the shrink for something be it quick consultation or dream analyzation fortunately the movie is played out for plenty of laughs director harold ramis who also helmed the comedy multiplicity was not half bad keeps the tone peppy and light even if it is sometimes sprinkled slight dramatic moments shootings cannot always be taken for laughs you know deniro does some of his finest comic work since the king of comedy giving off somewhat similar performance his role in goodfellas but bit of lighter heart scene where he tries display his anger over the phone and fails miserably is hilarious crystal plays an excellent straight man deniros character uplifting him from such bombs as fathers day and my giant kudrow is also hoot as crystals wifetobe who is on the verge of breakdown thanks deniros presence is the movie perfect not really thanks simplistic ending and some slightly wasted moments character portrayed chazz palminteri he is comic actor too come on give him some more but it is an enjoyable romp that lets deniro do something different but same for change taking his dramatic act new field of comedy kudos crystal and kudrow for not just making it his show either line of the movie crystal when you said you needed family therapy this is not the family had in mind

this is about secrets some that are innocent like those of cute little farm girl frances boyd ashley others that are between married couple that is impacting their relationship like the problems of infertility affecting this upwardly mobile couple geoffrey gaines stephen ramsey the medical researcher working for big corporation called fex and striving get patent for his experiment and become recognized in his field and his artist wife lillian miriam healylouie who reluctantly stands behind her husband suppressing her natural artistic tendencies in order make the marriage work and still other secrets that have greater implication for the world and are deadly in political sense of science carried out the big corporations like it was business run for the bottom line receiving summer grant study chemoelectric therapy geoffrey and his wife are hoping that summer spent away from the intensity of the big city will bring back the romance that is dwindling from their marriage and that the casualness of the country atmosphere will give them more time together as their threeyear marriage has become shaky because he is more interested in his work than he is in her he has slyly managed keep his work as secretive as possible locking himself in the lab is off limits her as he secretly goes about conducting experiments on rats and mice convincing her that what he is doing is benefit humanity possible new treatments and cures illnesses his main argument is that this is what the public wants they do not want hear about how some animals had die because of these experiments they just want the benefits of science that he is depicted as monster creating another monster much like frankenstein was created is the argument skewed the director against his bad science science as business as opposed the good science science that cares about the small farmer is represented the handsome and almost perfect gentleman alex vine david young ecologist who chooses work in the field trying get the farmers go back organic farming he is hired the university monitor the dangers of pesticides and all the chemicals the farmer is almost forced use survive financially as it is doing irreparable harm him and the consumer because of all the health risks attached this new way of farming methods that have just come about in the last thirty years and are being pushed the big companies enhance their profit margins the third view in all this is the artists represented lillian who points out that the artists work is shown in public and scrutinized constantly why should not the same be true of the scientist she argues that the artist is the watchdog for the public questioning what is good or evil in society something that bad science has completely ignored geoffrey impatient get ahead his research feels bogged down the bureaucrats in his firm who fail provide him the three chimps he needs experiment on as he contacts one of the companys higher ups argue his case but decides he cannot wait any longer for their help so he sets an animal trap in the countryside and catches chester the gorgeous pet dog of frances dog that means so much her and her family because he saved her life
