while out in the field the bloodied trapped dog already in the back seat of his car he is spotted alex and one of his coworkers and nervously invites them dinner his wife afraid that alex will spot what he is doing as he rushes away from the area in the dinner scene that was unfortunately flatly done but was nevertheless the heart of the as all the main characters get chance speak out from the point of view they represent as they eat meat means of getting protein that the radical scientists have eschewed since they became so politically correct about everything the scientists engage in rational argument highlighting their different points of view while lillian reacts in an emotional way siding mostly davids view but coming at it from much different angle it was as if the actors were puppets on strings that the director controlled and they just spewed out their generalized philosophies that the directors point of view is absolutely right is beside the point the point is that the characters lost their humanity and became onedimensional characters geoffrey was likened hideous monster alex vine was likened his last name the one who holds fast the ground ensuring that the plant has stability while lillian was likened the muse of poetry and art the inspiration for goodness and beauty alex has been spending lot of time together lillian as these two seem share the same views and are physically attracted each other but when the time is ripe for an affair take place between them lillian changes her mind and decides not go up alexs apartment geoffrey is already suspicious of alex and considers him an enemy and the marriage seems be coming apart and all his cunning tricks possess her are no longer working as it is now impossible see any good in him and there becomes no reason why she would remain him the relationship has disintegrated way beyond the point of her just feeling lonely the dog is discovered alex and her in deplorable state after geoffrey is seen them electrically shocking it and mercifully the dog dies the only thing left for her do is walk out of the marriage but she also fails respond davids loving gesture for her stay him instead opting head back the city the farmer whose dog was tortured death comes into the scientists lab and knocks him cold while he was in the middle of phone conversation one of the higherups who told him all the animals he needs are on the way what is progress what can one expect out of life is the small farmer about become extinct the answers these questions can best be answered either good science or art are both closely related the american natives vision of world entrusted mankind so that he can respect it and take care of it and enrich it his creations benefit mankind in peaceful way that this work fails be subtle and polarizes opinions leaving no room for deeper arguments is the shame of this decent and smart that tried so hard say what it felt it had say but said it so loudly without trusting its audience catch on its message not making everything seem so black and white no telling said lot about the harmful trends it sees science going in it probably said too much and would have been better off if its vision was more poetical and less didactic there is something about listening lecture that turns off the rebel in me as do not like being hit in the head the truth but prefer have it presented in the form that leads inspiration or told metaphorically that is not say that found the without considerable merit that inspite of its shortcomings it was worth seeing because of its visual statements though they were also not too subtle they were at least effective in setting up the intense mood that the needed show that there is mental war going on currently of those who believe one way is right and others who differ them and that anyone who is neutral must be considered an enemy because of their indifference the stakes in this ecological struggle are that high perhaps the most powerful visual statement in the was the dead cow from pesticides shown in the opening scene it was the image that lillian spent her time painting all summer and had the same affect for her as did the animal faces in picasso as guernica had for him both artists envisioned the horrors that man could do against the world and represented this unspoken pain on the faces of the animals so that anyone who cares really see what is going on will not mistake side of the fence he or she should be on the pain that lillian feels as she forgets about her desires raise family and she stares at her painting of the cow and the song make the world go away blares out from the background after she has learned that frances beautiful and loving dog has been brutalized her monster of husband all in the name of science had raw power it that personalizes the dangers of bad science perhaps the most pertinent question the asks requires an answer that must be resolved the farmers and the consumers who are most caught in the changing world and its new way of doing business as the question becomes can science be happily married art

this british import follows the mis adventures of group of heroin crazed scottish youths there is marc renton who narrates spud the dimwitted one sick boy the sean connery obsessive and begbee the violence obsessive powered top rate but not top name soundtrack iggy pop sleeper elastica lou reed the follows renton who gets clean gets back into heroin and gets clean again some of the wit in this movie is sharp and pulp fictionesque and some is just dumb dumber gross the bed sheets and stupid the bb gun although the starts out on comic note it takes sharp term in the middle and becomes almost depressing the is based on an irving welsh novel bearing the same title can honestly say that this is one of the best movies have ever seen it is an obscure gem that has been over shadowed in the us such movies as mission impossible and id the is hard follow the heavy accents of the actors this is very original as far as films go today it definetly deserves multiple viewings partly because of the slang and accents jeremy dennison mr orangecenturyinter net

you may not have heard of lucas or if you have you might not think much of it probably because it stars corey haim or maybe because it is about little geek who collects insects or maybe because it does not feature slick oneliners or the chart topping soundtrack albums that were almost requirement for teen films in the however you have been missing out on true masterpeice the best of and the best about adolescent life ever made corey haim stars as lucas bligh tiny year old scruffy hair thick glasses and an interest in insects and other outdoor life one day he stops the tennis courts and sees what must be an angel him her name is maggie year old who certainly is beauty lovely red hair and sweet innocent complexion maggie seems be little disturbed this little kid watching her but somehow he interests her and soon they are talking and getting know one another they gradually become good friends and spend the summer together doing various things such as studying insects namely locusts who come out of hiding once every years playing tennis and listening symphony orchestra through manhole cover lucas is obviously in love maggie and while she is charmed him it is clear that she would never consider him anything more than very good friend this is not clear lucas however he still beleives that maggie is his soulmate and he dreads the impending start of school because he knows what is about happen we soon find out why in painful scene where lucas is humiliated the jocks during pep rally they throw him on stage right in front of his beloved maggie surprisingly he turns the tables on the jocks some clowning around but he takes it too far and is embarassed in front of the entire school the next scene is brilliant maggie follows lucas outside of the pep rally she tries talk him as if nothing happened he rails back against her in cruel unfair fashion in lesser movies this would have turned into confrontation between the two characters but maggie is written smarter than that she understands what lucas is feeling and knows exactly what say console him next we are introduced another great character named cappie charlie sheen he is jock typical cheerleader girlfriend what is interesting about him is that he sticks up for lucas and protects him from the other jocks of course anyone brain can tell what is gonna happen next cappie will cause conflict in maggie and lucas relationship this begins in classic scene in the school laundry room when cappie and maggie are alone she is been assigned show him how operate the washerdryer so he can clean his shirt maggie is charmed cappies tender undertsanding demeanor not mention his shirtless body this scene is so delicate and sweet but cappie still has girlfriend preventing either one from acting on their desires desperately trying puncture the tension cappie begins kick basketballs around the room it is not long before cappie does break up his girlfriend in the films only subpar scene lucas finally figures out what is going on when he tries pick maggie up for the dance this causes him take severe actions prove himself maggie and himself such as try out for the football team the last third of the revolves around this attempt while the idea seems cliched the way it is executed is not there are many surprises during the last half hour lead an ending so emotionally involving it should make the most heartless of cynics get choked up dave grusins memorable score played at the perfect moments certainly helps lucas is filled great performances forget everything you know about corey haim back in he had talent and that is proven here as he delivers perfect fully dimensional performance filled anger humor and pain kerri green is very appealing as maggie showing us why she cares about lucas so much and why he is so attracted her sheens cappie is almost too good be true but sheen makes him beleivable especially when he explains the reason why he protects lucas there are other wonderful minor characters such as ciro popittis ben friend of lucas whose diminutive stature does not mean he will take crap from the jocks also turning up in few key scenes is winona ryder as rina the girl who admires lucas from afar when people talk about the great teen angst films of the you hear john hughes this and john hughes that lucas seems be lost among the crowd of his socalled classics but hopefully like heathers and say anything lucas can begin find it is own loyal following and help people realize there were more the than anthony michael hall and molly ringwald it deserves more than that but do not want be greedy

in arguably the most anticipated movie this century george lucas has achieved very mixed reaction sure blockbuster despite the fact the script and plot is bit of let down the entire movie on the whole can be considered milestone in technical excellence in the sound and special effects department in terms of characters far the most outstanding and interesting is queen amidala natalie portman whose mature performance far exceeds her tender years of age she is one hot babe who defines true woman leadership she not only has presence but knows how take command of the situation and save her planet from ruination no thanks the jedi knights who although led the force lack leadership qualities in terms of thinking up plan do anything the young obiwan kenobi ewan mcgregor who has bad hair day in every scene gets kill bad guy in the end but lacks love interest make him desirable sort of hero in fact all the jedi knight are bit asexual there must be something about the force makes them all hermits and loners mean it would be interesting see yodas girlfriend for change if he has one not much better is quigon jinn liam neeson who mostly broods and has better hair do than obiwan but only find the young anakin skywalker and make the biggest mistake of his life also fascinating is george lucas metoclorian theory claims that microorganisms live within our cells and tie us the fabric of the universe and it is the high concentrations of these organisms in an individual make them particularly powerful in the force more humerous are the claims the immaculate conception of darth vader no doubt concept stolen from the christian faith except there will be no christmas celebrate the birth of this dark emissary of the force overall an experience is not be missed because of the very fact that it is predecessor almost command viewing of this inferior successor all means not the pinnacle of the star wars phenomena but an adequate addition the clan watch out for the next one it should be one steamy encounter between queen amidala and anakin skywalker who believe should be portrayed leonardo di caprio

felix sami bouajila the siege lives contented life his boyfriend daniel pierreloup rajot in the little town of dieppe in northern france when he is laid off from his job after discovering the address of the father who abandoned him before he was born he decides journey marseilles in the south find the man he never met in the adventures of felix writersdirectors olivier ducastel and jacques martineau made their debut the musical comedy jeanne and the perfect guy embracing that typically american genre their second effort the adventures of felix once again borrows from america tale of young man who hits the road find himself felix is happy his life in dieppe but when the ferry company he works for falls prey the economics of the chunnel he is out of job and at loose ends when he goes through his late mothers papers he learns that the father he never knew is living in marseilles hundreds of miles away felix makes the snap decision journey the south puts together supply of cocktails for his hiv virus kisses daniel goodbye and heads off on foot he refuses use trains and wants avoid big cities as he hitchhikes across france find his destiny along the way series of chance encounters various strangers teaches felix that family is not always made up of blood relations on the road he witnesses racerelated mugging that turns into murder and frightened for his own safety runs away without telling the police following this harrowing experience he has his first chance meeting that begins the unconscious construction of his ideal family his journey brings him rouen and the films first title section my little brother where he meets jules young art student who becomes smitten felix they steal car and develop chaste brotherly affection before felix must move on he next meets elderly mathilde patachou in the chapter titled my grandmother and soon learns that she too has fondness for the same tv soap opera that felix has grown addicted she wants him stay her but he must continue on his way find his father in the weakest chapter of felixs road trip titled my cousin he meets railroad worker philippe garziano and has brief sexual encounter before heading off once again toward marseilles he next helps stranded lady motorist isabelle ariane ascaride and shags ride her and her three kids each different daddy in the sequence titled my sister he is torn the inner turmoil of not going the police about the murder he witnessed and isabelle comforts him just as sister would on the final leg of the journey titled my father he meets an older man fisherman maurice benichou who enlightens him about the real facts of life and family while they fly felixs kite just like father and son the adventures of felix has number of things going for it as we follow felix on his journey of discovery first and foremost is the charming performance sami bouajila as felix he is likable guy fighting his hiv his doses of cocktails and lights up the screen as he makes the long walk often dance and song find his father and himself as he encounters each member of his new family promising each that he will send postcard when he arrives at his final destination he grows little bit more spiritually and emotionally bouajila does terrific job holding center stage on the screen the cast of characters making up felixs newfound family are nearly as charming as the star each in their own way patachou especially is wonderful as the grandma character and kindred spirit felix ariane ascaride along her kids gives perf that really makes you think of her as the sister that the young man never had only the cousin chapter lacks the emotional depth of the rest and feels like perfunctory addition felixs family the adventures of felix does not reinvent the road movie but it does provide charismatic telling of young mans journey find himself and his surprise his discovery is dramatically different than he expected at the beginning it helps that cinematographer matthieu poirotdelpechs crisp lensing compliments the story perfectly as felix moves across the french countryside give it b

i know that funnest is not word fun is noun and therefore cannot be conjugated like an adjective but that is the word that came me right after viewing chicken run no wonder this is the kind of movie that reduces you childish expressions like that was the funnest movie have ever seen so hell websters chicken run is one of the funnest movies have seen in while cannot remember the last time have seen anything funner the chickens at tweedys farm are up something living in concentration camplike atmosphere they are led one plucky hen called ginger voice of julia sawalha who continually comes up plans for escape and always gets caught subsequently spending day after day in the coal box one night brash american rooster flies in over the fence calling himself rocky mel gibson famous flying rooster and circus performer rocky promises teach the chickens how fly and the situation grows more desperate as the nefarious mrs tweedy miranda richardson decides abandon the farms eggselling plan for pieselling plan she orders huge piemaking machine cackling chickens go in pies come out what sort of pies chicken pies of course codirector nick park and his studio aardman animation produced three oscarwinning short films creature comforts the wrong trousers and close shave the latter two were the second and third installments of trilogy starring the delightful team wallace gromit man and his dog famous for getting themselves into increasingly peculiar adventures part of what made the wallace films brilliantly entertaining was parks uncanny ability make an old story seem new the wrong trousers for example pulled out lot of old hitchcockian suspense tricks and close shave owed great deal of inspiration classic detective stories but in the hands of park and his team the stories felt fresh and inspired and not the least bit contrived now teaming codirector peter lord park has created similar creature in chicken run the plot is largely lifted from the great escape watch for quick reference the ballbouncing scene some spielberginspired action sequences providing the excitement thing is the does not feel like it is been lifted from somewhere else chicken run feels fresh alive like nothing else ever done part of it is the original idea who in the world came up the idea make prisonersofwar movie starring chickens park and lord milk the incongruity for all it is worth the characters treat their situation as if it were dead serious and them it is but they are chickens so it is funny us another thing that helps chicken run and most of parks films succeed is the animators subtle way of giving nods the very films they are cribbing there are references the great escape obviously and stalag the chase sequence inside the chicken grinder parodies both raiders of the lost ark and indiana jones and the temple of doom there is even nod the blues brothers if you can believe it and the filmmakers even get in little lighthearted ribbing at the expense of their star voice actor taking couple of very subtle jabs at mel gibsons nationality and history the braveheart reference is hoot if you catch it when you consider just how fine line resides between funny parody and redundant one chicken run is downright brilliant in its execution consider this since july of last year have seen dozens upon dozens of blair witch project parodies on television on the radio and online out of all those maybe one or two were amusing the rest tiresome why because once you got past the thought that they are parodying that blair witch movie most of the parodies had nothing offer no insight no original idea no greater purpose they were only funny if you had seen the movie otherwise you got nothing conversely chicken run does not lean on its parodies the references are never the sole focus of any scene if you have never seen indiana jones the chase sequence is still fun even if you have no idea who mel gibson is rocky remains an interesting character park lord and screenwriter karey kirkpatrick realize that an audience does not need parody shoved in their faces before it is understood and as result chicken run is filled visual and verbal jabs that are never too obvious but not quite vague either enjoyment of this movie does not require knowledge of history but if you have got it chicken run is that much richer the voice cast turns in uniformly lively performances and the characters they play are given so many subtle nuances that it is hard not fall in love every one of them ginger is perfect spunky and opinionated but soft heart that forbids her leave her companions behind and julia sawalha known as the cute mousy girl on absolutely fabulous nails it she has warm human chemistry gibson whose rocky hides his personal doubt under brash gungho veneer the characters inevitable romance does not feel contrived but sweet poor mr tweedy tony haygarth suspects the chickens are organizing in some way but his limited intellect prevents him from figuring things out and his overbearing wife certainly is not any help jane horrocks delivers lovely voice characterization as tragically optimistic babs hen that runs away most of the best oneliners all while perpetually crocheting sweater and two supplytrading rats that seem have walked straight out of monty python sketch nearly steal the show during the lively central swingdancing sequence they even come up an inspired riff on something that is baffled scholars and theologians alike for decades the chicken vs egg dilemma one might have expected this inevitable joke come off as wearisome but as most of chicken run it comes as delightful surprise the manages cross all barriers it should be accessible both children and adults brits and yanks rats and chickens the animation is firstrate remember that this was all done the oldfashioned way actual humans moving clay figurines around on tiny set bit painstaking bit and you see just how truly remarkable chicken run really is this movie possesses that same quality that makes pixar studios animation great precise and unwavering attention detail as in such topnotch family fare as bugs life or toy story chicken run has something offer in nearly every frame certainly passive viewer can enjoy it as straightforward story worthwhile moral and some surprisingly touching scenes but active attentive viewers will enjoy it even more because they will catch all the details anyway the movies just boatload of fun funnest damn movie have seen all year

after the press screening of moulin rouge stood in the lobby of the theater listening the reactions of my friends and colleagues everyone seemed bit numb understandable after sitting through barrage of oftenincongruous sounds and images pal of mine simply said that he loved the and could hardly wait take his wife see it another enthusiast immediately began analyze the production while woman who flatout hated the movie gave him the skunk eye when one fellow quietly stated have never really been fan of musicals the statement surprised me because even though the story is told almost completely through song did not think of it as musical there is so much going on in moulin rouge that musical seems too small term cover it moulin rouge is the kind of creation that sends critics scurrying off the big tub adjectives in search of proper words describe the experience australian director baz luhrmann the man behind strictly ballroom and romeo juliet fills the heads of viewers unique camerawork opulent imagery and songs ranging from the sound of music smells like teen spirit sumptuous and beautiful vulgar and overdone moulin rogue travels through the looking glass while an ethereal stereo loaded years worth of catchy tunes operates on the random setting oh and it has story as well it was the summer of love christian ewan mcgregor is penniless young writer newly arrived in paris write about truth beauty freedom and love where he encounters group of bohemians led henri de toulouselautrec john leguizamo christian meets satine nicole kidman courtesan from the legendary moulin rogue and his world transforms from black and white technicolor at once fragile and vivacious the dazzling redhaired woman sweeps him off his feet without even trying christian instantly falls in love her and satine finds herself smitten him as well is quite hindrance for someone in her profession working the bohemians and moulin rogue impresario harold zidler jim broadbent christian writes an opus modestly named spectacular spectacular zidler quickly finds backer the wealthy duke of monroth richard roxburgh but there is catch the duke also wants the hand of the fair satine as if all that is not enough satine has cough and while cough in the real world probably indicates cold it rarely turns out be anything that simple in movie land like teetertotter moulin rogue moves up and down between the ridiculous and the sublime one of the loveliest moments comes as christine and satine commune outdoors at night becoming part of defiantly unrealistic parisian cityscape straight from book of fairy tales together they dance while serenaded the man in the moon alessandro safina provides the vocals apparently transported from the classic georges li silent guard the nocturnal sky other scenes merely traffic in everythingandthekitchensink overload the cavorting of toulouselautrec and his comrades gets strained at times and some of their overt comedy accompanied cartoon sound effects is overly reminiscent of the frenzied farce that sitcoms like bewitched beat into the ground of course sensory overload was exactly what baz luhrmann had in mind we never heard from baz turn it down one of the actors told the los angeles times it was always more more the director even sent note his cast reading dare you make me say you have gone too far the musical numbers reflect his attitude one knockout piece the elephant love medley incorporates the beatles all you need is love us in the name of love dolly partons will always love you and elton john and bernie taupins your song need more how about diamonds are girls best friend spiced portions of material girl luhrmanns cast offers wide variety of approaches that together add up something messy but often wonderful ewan mcgregor is extremely likable as christian emphasizing the sincerity of the lovestruck poet mcgregors singing voice is robust and adds vigor at just the right moments once labeled the ice queen nicole kidman melts that characterization sizzling yet tender performance she handles the songs adroitly although her voice sounds bit thin in the upper range veteran character actor jim broadbent is suitably larger than life as ringmaster zidler wait until you see him perform like virgin as the buffoonish duke richard roxburgh proves be the films weakest link although am sure he was simply following instructions suspect moulin rogue will be one of those loveitorhateit films while did not completely love it most certainly liked it lot over the course of year see well over movies and most of them look like xeroxes of each other moulin rogue is an original and an original even flawed one is thing be cherished

living out loud is the type of motion picture we do not often see it is about mature intelligent adults instead of the usual american in children basically dress up in grownup clothing and parade around acting like immature sevenyearolds judith holly hunter fortysomething living in new york city has been having difficult time life lately she is extremely depressed about her recent divorce her husband martin donovan who had been cheating on her she cannot sleep haunted terrible memories often imagines offthewall things try and make the world seem like better place and the only place she can really go feel happy is hear one of her favorite singers liz bailey queen latifah perform at local club judiths life does start brighten little when one night when she gets home her apartment late strikes up conversation the elevator operator pat danny devito lonely man in his fifties whom has lost his daughter recently both of them create sort of emotional connection each other seeking comfort the other person but while pat starts form deep love for her judith only wants remain friends living out loud was written richard lagravenese the bridges of madison county who is also making his directing debut here is wonderful from beginning end one that is honest genuinely funny and poignant the three central characters that of judith pat and liz are all written be freethinking complex human beings and are all likable but flawed people who are constantly interesting as is the itself one highly original element of the is that judith occasionally imagines things occuring in her mind in the way she wishes they would happen sometimes it results in comedy and sometimes it turns out be subtle and truly touching one sequence that stands out is when judith is at restaurant herself reading novel an older woman comes over her mentions that that is great book she is reading and then goes over join her own friends as the woman sits down she looks over see judith herself and motions for her come join them instantly we realize this was simply in judiths mind as we see the same woman just sit down at the table and begin talking her friends holly hunter and danny devito both give the performances of their careers here hunter of course was brilliant in the piano for she won an academy award but in this she is even better think she finds the right note for each scene and holds it and devito has never had such humanistic role before was surprised about usually he is used as the butt of joke or as caricature but in this has livingandbreathing sympathetic person play topping it all off is latifah also singer who is quickly turning into respectable actress herself and has juicy natural supporting role as in some ways judiths role model another joy of the is that it does not somehow form contrived happy ending but in staying its realistic tone manages be upbeat but truthful the last shot is an especially powerful image nothing is said but just the image of someone walking down sidewalk says it all the relationship that results between judith and pat is truetolife and sincere as we watch these two people talk and get know each other all that we wish for them both is be happy even if that does not include for them become romantically involved and as living out loud is one of the best films of the year proves sometimes friendship is the strongest bond anyone could possibly ask for

oh behave felicity shagwell is one shagadellic babe do make your horny female fembots breasts that require gun controlling anything that resembles bananas and two balls of icecream the nutbiting finale between mini me and austin all that body hair is real turn on it is pity more leading men do not wear it on screen anything that vaguely resembles sausages and eggs fat bastard the love scene between felicity and fat bastard that redefines sex the wrongly implied love scene in the tent that redefines anal sex the love scene between austin and ivana humpalot that redefines chess and oral sex the love scene between dr evil and frau farbissina that redefines weird sex the love affair between austin and felicity that does not happen because his mojo goes missing the relationship between dr evil himself and mini me redefines solo love affair the unique relationship between dr evil and his son scott www com zip that says lot about our relationship our children nowadays weanies johnny richard dick etc this movie is every bit as silly and crazy as the first there are moments that will make your sick are probably best forgotten but overall mike myers has redefined what it means be an international spy and leading man

written john grisham and robert altman as al hayes directed robert altman some time ago young director was given the opportunity direct the screen version of popular novel the novel was summer smash topping bestseller lists across the country and already drawing speculation as popular actors of the day might play the leads the only problem the novel was not very good it was far more pulp than pulitzer but the director realized that no matter how pedestrian the prose this book really grabbed people that the author while not great writer was fantastic storyteller so he took on the project convinced he could make something happen on screen the director francis ford coppola the book of course was mario puzos the godfather the rest as they say in showbiz was history bringing up the godfather do not mean suggest that robert altmans the gingerbread man is destined for that level of greatness but the parallel does suggest that it is possible create great cinema from questionable source material can you get any more questionable than john grisham depends on whom you ask but there is no question that grishams work grabs people like puzo grisham is better storyteller than writer unlike fellow hack michael crichton who is good idea man but who cannot tell wellconstructed story from can of spam so something in grishams unpublished story of cocky savannah lawyer who gets involved in deadly family squabble drew the attention of robert altman who at years old remains one of americas greatest living filmmakers the result is gripping thriller that while falling short of classic cinema deserves its place in the altman canon from its opening shot the closing credits the gingerbread man is permeated sense of dread fear of the natural destructive forces of the universe this terrific sense of mood is classic altman touch witness said opening shot we see an aerial view of coastal georgia its writhing undulating landscape while the soundtrack grumbles ominously in our ear we roll over the hills into the town of savannah then zoom in close on red sports car speeding over bridge while its driver chatters oblivious on his cell phone right away we know that the driver of that car is in for few surprises pay attention boys and girls this shot was not conceived john grisham but altman this is what great director can do for questionable source material the sports car belongs rick magruder kenneth branagh the aforementioned hotshot attorney who specializes in police brutality cases magruder has just won high profile case and celebrates that night catered party at his office outside after the party he meets one of the waitresses mallory doss embeth davidzt just as she realizes her car has been stolen driven southern chivalry driving rainstorm and his unspoken attraction the fragile waitress magruder offers her ride home there he learns more about mallorys life than he bargained for her car was stolen her schizophrenic father dixon robert duvall ted kyzynskistyle whacko who has been stalking and terrorizing his own daughter magruder perhaps influenced mallorys decision strip off her wet clothes in front of him is sympathetic her plight and offers help her get her father committed right after he sleeps her of course this simple offer of help leads magruder down dangerous path black end he succeeds in having dixon incarcerated in mental hospital and for moment all appears well but then dixons crack team of homeless commandos bust him out of the lockup and suddenly magruder finds himself mallory and his own children in danger the cops will not lift finger help liberal attorney his only allies are his faithful assistant lois daryl hannah and his bumbling privateeye sidekick clyde robert downey jr if this predicament was not bad enough hurricane geraldo is bearing down on savannah and throwing the world into chaos altman may provide the atmosphere but branaghs performance holds the gingerbread man together an accomplished actor when he is not directing himself in vanity productions branagh does fine job of making rick sympathetic hero while casting doubt upon his motives is his offer of help mallory an act of kindness or of egotism magruder is so sure of his place in the world that he never considers that he has bitten off more than he can chew until he has swallow it and then it is too late as the plot unfolds magruder learns that none of us are as secure as we think we are and life is never so bad that it cannot get worse if you are familiar altmans work you will recognize several of his signature techniques characters are not introduced in establishing shots but rather are allowed wander in the background of scenes until their importance becomes apparent crucial scenes are shot from the outside through windows making the audience unwitting voyeurs of the action dialog overlaps and the actors seem slip naturally into an improvisational style and of course there is my favorite altman technique the obligatory nude actress shot thanks altman here are some of the actresses have had the pleasure of seeing naked sally kellerman julianne moore madeline stowe even frances mcdormand and now can add embeth davidtz who looks quite healthy in the altogether the naked actress shot has become as ubiquitous the altman as the director cameo was the hitchcock is it oldschool sexism or clever injoke you be the judge but back the picture at hand in the hands of mere mortal the gingerbread man would have been routine thriller no better or worse than the countless others we have all endured in the hands of master like altman it becomes an exercise in existential doom in its own way far more successful than scorseses cape fear remake tried for the same result what may prevent it from enduring altmans greatest work is weak third act in fact there really is no third act in grishams story so it appears that altman had throw in the hurricane just jazz things up but there are true moments of riveting suspense and great performances branagh davidzt and downey jr more than enough see you through that polygram so hated this picture that they tried steal final cut from altman and then buried the marketing campaign when he won it back should tell you how utterly clueless of quality most studios are they probably wanted it look more like time kill and that my friends should make you very afraid

october sky is rare oddity in cinema selfproclaimed uplifting that is actually uplifting based on the autobiographical book homer hickam rocket boys october sky tells the struggle of four boys reaching for their dream it is and for the boys of coalwood west virginia there is not much hope of rosy future coalwood is coal mining town and except for the few lucky ones who manage escape on football scholarship most of coalwoods boys are destined work in the mine but in october an event happens that sparks one boy dream the launch of the soviet satellite sputnik sets homer hickam jake gyllenhaal dream future of rocketry and space travel of course homers parents chris cooper and natalie canderday are not quite sure what make of their sons unusual interests homer gets his strongest encouragement from miss riley laura dern teacher in his school who also informs him about the scholarships offered the winners of national science fair and so stars in his eyes and thoughts of scholarships in his head homer enlists the help of three other boys william lee scott chad lindberg and chris owen and begins build rocket but do these four backwoods boys even have the slightest hope of escaping their destiny there is lot that could have gone wrong october sky nearly every sequence flirts becoming syrupy and cliched however miraculously october sky avoids nearly all of these pitfalls making the exact right moves at the exact right times emerges manages be powerful and moving without slipping into the gauzy haze of nostalgia or sliding down the sugarry slope of sappiness jake gyllenhaal is outstanding as the kid at the center of this from the outset of the he is immediately likable and never seems too corny or brainy as alienate the audience unfortunately while october sky focuses on homer the other three kids get the short end of the stick they remain little more than placeholders reading insert friend here of the adults in the chris cooper is the most fully realized character the never paints him as merely the villainous parent standing in the way of his childs dreams but instead shows the multihued portrait of man who wants the best for his family and town but is too stubborn realize what that is director joe johnson deserves much credit for successfully navigating the many obstacles that october sky manages dodge however there are still few occasions when he allows things proceed just step too far scenes were natural and inspiring start become contrived and artificial however these lapses are minimal and johnson quickly steers the movie back on course the problem many socalled uplifting films is that they attempt force their mediciney goodness down your throat october sky never resorts that level and yet manages become truly uplifting purely on its own merits

this three hour movie opens up view of singerguitar playermusiciancomposer frank zappa rehearsing his fellow band members all the rest displays compilation of footage mostly from the concert at the palladium in new york city halloween other footage shows backstage foolishness and amazing clay animation bruce bickford the performance of titties and beer played in this movie is very entertaining drummer terry bozzio supplying the voice of the devil franks guitar solos outdo any van halen or hendrix have ever heard bruce bickfords outlandish clay animation is that beyond belief zooms morphings etc and actually it does not even look like clay it looks like meat

while watching boiler room was constantly reminded of last years masterpiece fight club both films consist of predominately male cast both films follow young men as they illicitly fight the traditional system for their own desires and both films are seen through the eyes of one narrator who eventually realizes that these men have be stopped while boiler room writerdirector ben younger does not get his point across as well as david fincher does for fight club he does contribute another impressive work series of films aiming represent the new generation generation has seen the internet prosper and where everyone wants be millionaire paying homage oliver stones classic wall street younger is almost modernizing the tale using younger hipper actors play the greedy villains as opposed the older more experienced types as is true in real life younger minds are becoming richer and richer from their knowledge of more standard technology boiler room dismisses the notion of ingenuity and shows that greed and desire for power come in all ages another similarity fight club is that both films are not action flicks some people are convinced that an allmale cast automatically means there must be gory violence here is proof that this is not true if you want see an action movie starring ben affleck go see reindeer games this weekend if you want see smart insightful excellent acting and clever script see boiler room giovanni ribisi gives an outstanding performance as the films narrator seth after dropping out of college and running lucrative gambling center for college students in his apartment seth is offered high paying job wealthy man nicky katt he agrees take the job in you are guaranteed become millionaire within three years of selling stock welloff americans from the midwest over the telephone and begins fit in quite well his coworkers learning tricky techniques deceive innocent people into buying shares of good in production seth figures this is too good be true after stumbling into room at the wrong time he knows there is something no good about this company at this point seth is left the ultimate choice continue the american dream and make millions or tell the authorities that something fishy is going on ribisi is believable as seth especially when he shares scenes ron rifkin playing seths dad the two have perfect chemistry as troubled father and son trying impress each other and simultaneously impress themselves the transitions from anger sympathy that these scenes contain are the standout segments of the entire the supporting cast of greedy coworkers is also flawless ben affleck shines in short but sweet performance as recruiter for the company nicky katt is fabulous as the ostensibly friendly boss who eventually becomes extremely jealous of seth and vin diesel gives his best performance of his career as the foil character of nicky katt the energy of the cast as whole makes boiler room well paced and never boring the only major error in the is that nothing major happens there is no big plot twist or climatic point make the more memorable due the lack of major event boiler room never finds suitable genre fit into the movie is not intense enough be thriller the romantic segments involving seth and abby nia long are not properly finalized and the dialogue is not funny enough make it comedy in having trouble characterize the movie as whole boiler room is slightly confused at times it does not seem know category fit itself into one satisfying concluding scene could have changed the whole for the better otherwise the movie is fun watch thanks its lively cast of young actors

ok let us get one thing straight right away maximum risk is no battleship potemkin although it does have some russians in it but it is not too bad really it is the new from ringo lam the latest hong kong filmmaker defect and stars that minor league schwartzeneggar from belgium jeanclaude van damme who you will recall also starred in john woos maiden effort hard target in lams van damme plays alain moreau french cop at least his accent makes more sense here than it did in hard target who discovers that he was separated shortly after birth from twin brother who was adopted russians these russians defected the united states and moved into black neighbourhood in new york where suppose they thought they would not be noticed this brother mikhail suverov played in his few scenes well you know becomes deeply involved in the russian mafia and the fbi almost the same thing guess and is killed in france in the movie things happen so fast that you do not have too much time think about how weird this all is moreau does what any good surviving twin brother would do and goes new york find out why mikhail was killed and why everyone in france who knows anything about him is also being killed we wonder the same thing still do in little odessa he meets mikhails girlfriend alex natasha henstridge last seen in species who helps him solve the mystery and adds immeasurably the miseenscene she has very nice breasts and we get seen them briefly in this movie it was rated in the us but is pg here so they must have seen more of her breasts than we do this lacks the gloss and high production values of such other action movies as broken arrow the fugitive hard target or anything starring arnold but that works its benefit think after all one thing that is been missing from woos films is that certain hong kong funkiness that we all know and love well some of us do movies like this should not be too pretentious and that is part of the problem some of these other films they try be too big in terms of special effects and sheer spectacle maximum risk has its share of car chases and explosions but they do not overwhelm the movie or detract our attention from the narrative not too much anyway the emphasis throughout is on the characters and their interactions even if at times they do not make hell of lot of sense in fact one of the more interesting aspects of the is minor character rather overeager new york cabbie frank van keeken from tvs kids in the hall who begins as something of joke but becomes an important part of the story unfortunately the time we have come really get interested in him he well you will see the movie also features some set pieces of the type that we have come expect from lam and his hong kong compatriots one is fight in russian sauna lots of sweaty muscular male flesh this one will appeal certain parts of the audience more than others bullets in heads and vodka another my personal favorite is fight in meat packing house featuring pig carcasses and chainsaw and even the predictable car chases are more hong kong than as they trash those quaint french cafes vegetable carts and well french people that we all know in our hearts deserve trashing just for being so damn quaint of course the movie does have its share of silliness for example while beating the crap out of an obnoxious russian thug who obviously deserves what he is getting alain stops long enough look at his own reflection in the cracked mirror he has been whacking the guy on the head in an unnecessarily dramatic moment he apparently is shocked at what he sees at what he has become but what has he become tough cop who beats the hell out of guy who tried kill him does not sound too unreasonable me considering the genre but let us face it any time van damme tries be dramatic he looks silly so maximum risk is little different from most other action films while watching it was surprised and little disappointed in the relative lack of pyrotechnics but watching some of these other action films is sort of like experiencing sugar rush after the initial excitement there is not much left although it is short on spectacle lams leaves better and more lasting impression think am more impressed it now than was while watching it and me that is good sign go see maximum risk but do not expect typical action movie expect sort of funky hong konghollywood action movie the flying inkpot rating system wait for the tv broadcast little creaky but still better than staying at home gotcha pretty good bring friend amazing potent stuff perfection see it twice dr white teaches at the english language and literature department of the national university of singapore but we do not hold this against him

trailing the success of brit humour in the movie industry the likes of the semidramatic the commitments and the nearly slapstick fish called wanda the full monty is one delivered the depth of the former and the humour magnitude of the latter the opens narrated documentary reel showing the improving economic and living standards of sheffield in the then cut the harsh reality of the present sheffield has become some sort of semislum the only visible increase in anything was the amount of layoffs from steelfactories once flourishing industry gaz carlyle spends most of his time in the workers club sort of place where jobless people sit around wait for job offers he and his plump friend dave addy as well as their former foreman gerald wilkinson have been sitting around the club for months without any call for duty what seemingly was just passing hard time for gaz suddenly transformed itself into desperation when he cannot afford the pounds of childsupport money his exwife suddenly finding himself facing the possiblity of losing custody of his son he goes on concoct an enterprising wildidea get the money he desperately requires dave and gerald too have problems of their own on top of his lack of employment dave is also faced the paranoia of his wife leaving him because of his current financial state as well as hisplump appearance while gerald have been cheating on his wife not telling her of his layoff for as long as months leaving home for work when he was actually longstanding member of the workers club there we have it people real problems and notsopractical solution for them gaz manages get the support from them and sure enough they managed get few other poor jobless blokes join in their gag perform stripact at the local pub in gazs own words while looking at an add for stripact featuring hunky beautiful men if women are willing pay for this they sure as well will pay for realmen the full monty is very simple in nature and not trace ambitious at all it is small delves in the harshreality of unemployment and the desperation it drives people it also is very light movie watch despite the theme it delves in because it has lot of humanfactor going for it never for once was it trying be manipulative at all the full monty was true itself all the way while the hilarity level of this soared unexpectedly high audience will find that they are in no way being cheated of laugh something lacking in many comedy films wannabes from other than carlyle who acted as the psychotic begbie in trainspotting the rest of the actors were definitely very new me onscreen however the acting presented in this is more than satisfying carlyles work here is stark contrast his character in trainspotting implying real acting skill and flexibility onscreen kudos the people involved in this especially director peter cattaneo for being able put together an excellent is has so much potential in ending up as your justanotherstriptease already critical and financial success for such small the full monty is humble deserves applause throughout while titanic managed feast the eyes and soul in an epic way the full monty gives one the same satisfaction in half the time

you will go ape over tarzan because it is more fun than barrel of monkeys okay there is the quote in case disney wants put something in their ads for the movie disneys latest animated feature throws us right into the action from the very beginning skipping the usual main title sequence and putting us on pitching waves as small family attempts escape from sinking ship father mother and infant somehow make it shore amidst rousing song phil collins and have soon built treehouse would impress the swiss family robinson it is amazing the kinds of things you can do when you work soundtrack before you know it an unfortunate set of circumstances put the baby in the hands of kala glenn close mother ape who recently lost her own baby predatory leopard against the wishes of her mate and family leader kerchak lance henricksen she takes on the infant boy as her own tarzan is not so much story about human boy surviving in the african jungles as it is about one who does not really fit in either humanity or the wild much of tarzans young life is spent trying become one of the apes in the eyes of his peers and his father occasionally gets him into trouble no matter how wellmeant his attempts all he is looking for is acceptance perhaps goal easily identifiable young viewers but one will ring true lot of adults when you really think about it this story fits right into the disney formula of the outcast that triumphs in the end look back on past disney animated features and you will see the trend growing up tarzan voiced alex linz as child and tony goldwyn as an adult has couple of friends one is an ape named terk rosie odonnell and the other is paranoid hypochondriac of an elephant named tantor wayne knight both provide the requisite comic relief timon and poombah from the lion king immediately come mind and perform the usual hijinks as prescribed the disney mold am beginning think anyone can write the screenplay for one of these films just fill in the blanks can you see it now we have have couple of zany friends for out hero who might get him into mischief but cover for him or come his rescue when he needs it we have already had fish and crab and we have had candle and teapot genie and dog few stone statues have we had an ape and an elephant yet well there we go of course there is gotta be romance somewhere along the line so jane minnie driver gets introduced about halfway through together her father dr porter nigel hawthorne and the big game hunter clayton brian blessed jane is on an expedition find and study the wild gorillas of africa she discovers the man raised apes and is enchanted almost immediately and soon shares an amusing version of the compulsory you tarzan me jane scene thankfully those are not the exact words however found it distracting that tarzan is going ohh ohh ee ee one second and then tells jane his name in this manly voice perfect diction how does he tell his name another ape ohh ohh ee tarzan ee ee ohh well regardless of my picky nature the romance actually works as only disney romance can purely contrived but for some reason rather believable but hey tarzans young adult do you think he dated few of the female apes before meeting jane is not that illegal in most countries oh well do not think disney will be using my quote anymore tarzan departs from the usual disney feature in that this one is not musical there is lots of music be sure but not single character song in the whole hour and half of running time we instead get more of phil collins concert as no less than five of his original songs are used as interlude material this is not really bad thing as the songs are very highenergy and catchy found myself singing one myself for most of the following day it is just different do yourself favor and see this in theater good sound system because the music will come through astonishingly well and really enhance the movie each new feature disney animation gets even better not necessarily leaps and bounds but since they put out new each year steady rate of improvement is apparent and this definitely shows in tarzan there are couple of scenes where the animation achieves near effect and number of scenes feature tarzan moving through the trees are absolutely dizzying the way he slides down tree limbs and trunks is very reminiscent of skateboarding and rollerblading maneuvers and had me thinking this is not just tarzan it is extreme tarzan however tarzan does not seem have what call its chandelier scene is the one scene the animators have chosen devote an inordinate amount of effort utilizing computerassisted process that makes the animation absolutely breathtaking lasting but few seconds at most it is been the signature of nearly every disney animated feature since beauty and the beast in the castle ballroom chandelier was rendered in stunning detail as usual the voice talent is up snuff convincingly make you believe in the convictions of animated characters the one poor choice in casting however was rosie odonnell going into the did not know she was even part of it but when terk started talking recognized her voice immediately her performance was fine but through the rest of the kept thinking that is no boy ape that rosie odonnell distracting say the least will admit have never read the edgar rice burroughs story tarzan of the apes so could not tell you how true this stays the book but unless you are purist you should have few objections this solid performances action adventure bit of romance and great music and animation tarzan should appeal the kids and the kid in all of us note when wrote my review of mulan year ago went off on the promotional and merchandising tieins prevalent the release of disney animated feature this time will just say that went mcdonalds yesterday treat myself mcflurry and tarzan was on the cup nuff said

you have got mail is timely romance for this impersonal computerdriven decade two people who have never met confide in each other via email without revealing their true identities nora ephrons contemporary update of the shop around the corner retains the basic plot two people who despise each other unwittingly become enamored each other through their anonymous correspondence ephron who cowrote the her sister delia as well as directed it knew what she was doing reteaming tom hanks and meg ryan as the atodds couple ryan is kathleen kelly owner of small childrens bookstore while hanks is joe fox who heads up chain of mega bookstores think barnes noble their charm and chemistry are the glue that binds this even through some of the scripts rough spots for the ephrons invested so much effort in their protagonists that they give short shrift the talented supporting cast including parker posey greg kinnear jean stapleton and steve zahn yet no one is really going complain because the ephrons know their audience and what the paying public wants is hanks and ryan and the two are kept busy one the other or both are in nearly every scene hanks has his decent guy routine down pat yet each time he does it it seems effortless spontaneous and fresh ryan smoothly moves between spunky and vulnerable sexy touch of winsomeness added the brew their scenes together sparkle even though they lack the nostalgic romanticism of sleepless in seattle and the shadow of that earlier hit hangs over you have got mail like driedup mistletoe the sparks created the earlier movie are necessity not evident here true these are two people seeking true love but you have got mail is more comic and less poignant than its predecessor the ephrons script is witty and sharp however as director nora ephron is bit uneven some scenes drag while others especially when hanks and ryan are revealing their souls via email are crisp and tidy also the script gets sloppy toward the end characters merely disappearing from the story nice romantic soundtrack adds this datenight special overall you have got mail is lush and cute outing taking advantage of the star appeal of its two leads it is nice holiday movie one for holding hands and snuggling committed lifelong learning through effective communication

according movies made in last few decades life in small town is one of the worst things that could happen human being even worse fate awaits those who were unfortunate grow up in those dark godforsaken places and later forced live forever traumatised the experience on the other hand it seems that something more than atlantic ocean divides europe from america because one of the most popular and beloved european films takes exactly the opposite view this is amarcord comedy famous italian director federico fellini later gave inspiration numerous imitations and homages and even led few american screen artists adopt its heretical views about benefits of small town life the is based on the screenplay fellini and tonino guerra and it lacks the plot in usual sense instead we follow one year in italian summer resort town of rimini through the series of short vignettes that depict various local events and customs as well as series of local often very colourful characters although many of those characters occasionally take the role of narrator movie concentrates on its nominal protagonist year old boy titta played bruno zanin and chronicles his sexual frustrations obsession local beauty queen named gradisca played magali noel problems in his lovingly dysfunctional family as well as troubles his father played armando brancia have mussolinis fascist regime amarcord was often noted as the ultimate nostalgia and it probably explains why it is very popular even among those people who actually do not like federico fellinis work very much every member of its potential audience would find part of himself or herself in this because fellini in this clearly illustrates natural human desire paint past in the best way possible distortion between actual past and its subjective interpretation could be found even in the title of the word amarcord is nothing more than badly pronounced phrase remember in local italian dialect in the same way the word is distorted so is the past in memories of those who remember it after the premiere fellini rejected any claims about autobiographical character of this but it does not matter whether rimini of amarcord actually resembles rimini of fellinis childhood or not any place and any time could resemble characters and situations of this fellinis views on nostalgia are clearly illustrated way he mixes reality and fantasy in this even the most naturalistic scenes are laced dark humour and grotesque images characters look like caricatures actors playing them often deliberately overact and women especially those who fuel tittas sexual fantasies often have certain body parts gargantuan proportions every now and then scenes that depict reality gradually slide into fantasies of movies characters and rimini becomes almost indistinguishable from the magical place in characters visions because of that almost everything in this looks different and in most cases better than it would have looked in the real life even the fascism gets fellinian makeover fellini views mussolinis totalitarian regime as nothing more than visual spectacle explaining why similar regimes enjoyed such popular support throughout history and opportunity for comedy when fascists finally show their true colours and begin torturing their opponents even this becomes opportunity for scenes of macabre humour unlike many of his italian colleagues in who had used period setting explicitly condemn fascism and serve fashionable political agenda fellini does not care that much about politics lack of selfrighteous moral perspective is compensated fellinis humanistic approach his characters each of them regardless of age gender social class or physical appearance is given opportunity express his or her views dreams and fears fellini treats all those characters warmth and affection even when he paints them as grotesque caricatures of real people because of this warmth and democratic spirit amarcord could be viewed as one of the most humane films of th century and it keeps its general feel good atmosphere despite depicting having many uncomfortable melancholic and even tragic moments fellini could not produce such effects without using his own directorial talent that gave very personal touch this movie vignettes are not memorable because of the characters only fellini uses camera painting in bright colours especially in the scenes that depict characters fantasies fellini also knows how use locations whether such location happens be luxurious hotel brightcoloured beach or rural countryside even the downtoearth streets of rimini where everyone knows everyone gets magical dimension during the snowfall on the other hand lack of credible special effects somewhat diminished the same effect during the ocean liner scene this atmosphere is also provided incredible talent of composer and fellinis longtime associate nino rota his amarcord theme is probably one of the most recognisable most popular and most relaxing and uplifting pieces of music ever produced that music alone should be the reason view amarcord as one of the indisputable classics of seventh art

written mark rosenthal and lawrence konner starring charlize theron bill paxton david paymer as reviewed james brundage am beginning get fed up over my four years as critic the thing has kept me going is the moderate balance of films the good balances the bad try see both in equal proportions but disneys mighty joe young remake marks the fourth week in have not seen truly terrible movie it is backwards machismo suppose the urge see the things you so loathe but need see bad every once in while and you know what mighty joe young does not qualify far from being bad mighty joe young is actually family fun movie it is enjoyable appropriate cute cuddly and all of those other things that have been seeing in every movie since bugs life mighty joe young tracks pound gorilla in the wilds of africa that is taken reserve in california for safekeeping okay little unrealistic but who ever said kids movie had have the slightest hint of realism the first half of the movie is gorillas in the mistesque hatred of poachers womanofthewild motif the second half is straight up parody of king kong awestruck onlookers and all mark one down am feeling relaxed it is as point of fact an extremely uncreative movie but as vetern can say quite honestly that creativity does not count for as much as it should so that saves mighty joe from my wrath although my colleagues and cohorts and surely bashing this at this very moment this is not the take girl on date it is not the for you it is the for you and your family when you are right alongside your kid all of the normal rights and wrongs slip away the same thing happens when you watch horror movie or an action flick it becomes fun all you have do enjoy mighty joe young is shut up and watch

notting hills trailer is awful laughless schmaltzy montage the movie was desperately marketed the antiphantom menace crowd the same lovelorn females who ignored the love letter and it apparently worked perhaps the presence of julia robertswhose allure beyond those perfect teeth still escapes mehad lot do notting hills opening weekend success but the films staying power is based on word of mouth allow me spread some more good buzz for notting hill grant stars as william thacker travelbookstore owner who works and resides in tiny english district called notting hill into his shop one day wanders famous actress anna scott roberts common thief some spilled orange juice and some stilted conversation leads their first highly impetuous or is that improbable kiss days later william sneaks into her hotel suite under the guise of magazine journalist and so begins passionate albeit surreptitious affair aside notting hills portrayal of press junkets is deadly accurate only annas celebrityor williams lack thereofthreatens drive wedge between them richard curtis has tapped into fantasy we all have considered and for at least its first halfhour the pictures beauty and the beast like scenario is romantic escapism of the highest order as groundhog day or pleasantville while watching the highconcept comedy notting hill one constantly imagines himherself in the lead it is williams ordinaryness that entices the spoiled and bored anna curtis who previously penned four weddings and funeral is also smart enough know that the unlikely couples situation is not enough fuel two hours worth of entertainment so some of notting hills finest moments revolve around williams eccentric friends and family now dear reader you have probably heard lot about rhys ifans performance as williams imbecilic welsh flatmate yes he is crowd pleaser walking sight gag but his character is not nearly as involving as the wheelchairbound and appropriately named bella mckee the anguished waitress of naked or max tom mcinnerny her lousy chef of husband in the movies best sequence william anna and company sit around bloated from maxs latest concoction and hold contest the last brownie on the table goes the diner the saddest life the scene ends only as british writer would end it if anything fantastic bits like these dull the main plots dramatic impact roberts and grant especially are appealing but their relationship is convolutedly interrupted too many times four weddings suffered similar flaws and william and anna ultimately only have one thing in common they are lonely worth noting in roberts and grants favour the ubiquitous am just girl standing across from boy asking him love her episode is not nearly so syrupy as it appears in clips and it features some of the best emoting either actor has ever done notting hill is nonetheless enjoyable on the visual side of things especially appreciated michells playful changingoftheseasons number if only and this is surprisinly minor gripe he had lopped off the egregious epilogue for story that thrives on what we bring it the filmmakers work too hard tidy things up leaving our imaginations in the lurch

note that followups are directed rec arts movies currentfilms and rec arts movies startrek current only not rec arts sf movies moderator star trek first contact review michael dequina copyright michael dequina star trek first contact pg anyone familiar the series of star trek movies knows of the evenodd pattern the evennumbered installments of the series are good while the oddnumbered ones are well notsogood the pattern continues the new star trek first contact an energetic scifi adventure that coincidentally is the eighth entry in the hugely popular series in this first trek feature feature only cast members from the late star trek the next generation television series captain jeanluc picard patrick stewart and the rest of the thcentury crew of the starship enterprisecommander will riker jonathan frakes who also directed android lt cmdr data brent spiner lt cmdr geordi laforge levar burton lt cmdr worf michael dorn dr beverly crusher gates mcfadden and counselor deanna troi marina sirtis travel back stcentury earth while doing battle the borg race of cybernetic beings that share collective mind the borg queen alice krige the borg intend alter history and assimilate all of humankind into their racestarting the earthorbiting crew of the enterprise and st century stowaway alfre woodard this is an interesting plotline that is sure mesmerize trekkers everywhere and engage everyone else but unfortunately it only makes up the star trek half of the script brannon braga and ronald moore the other half of the titlefirst contactrefers subplot that takes place on stcentury earth where riker troi and laforge meet legendary scientist zephram cochran james cromwell who is about embark on the first warp speed flight in human history directly leads the first contact extraterrestrials while this story does tie into the main plot and pays off interestingly in the end it is nowhere near as involving or exciting as the borg battles on the enterprise not helping matters is the tiresome cochran character an eccentric whose drunken schtick starts out funny but becomes too onenote after while in the end though the first contact subplot does not detract from the enjoyment of the as whole the story is typical scifi fantasy but the conviction of the castmost notably the alwaysphenomenal stewartmakes you believe and care frakes making his feature directorial debut keeps the action swiftly rolling along and delivers the action goods even upping the violence notch this is the first trek bear pg rating greater effect st fc has bigger budget than the last trek outing the middling star trek generations and it definitely shows on screenthe production design and especially visual and makeup effects are outstanding in particular those involving the borg queen braga and moores mostly sharp script will please both trek devotees and the rest the references the borg storyline in the tv series the continuity the previous g the ongoing saga of datas emotion chip and fleeting star trek voyager crossover will make trekkers squeal delight but such points are made easily accessible those less familiar the trek mythos paramount was reportedly worried about the staying power of its trek franchise the next generation cast now carrying the helm based on the entertaining success that is star trek first contact would say the studio has nothing worry about at least not until this cast retires and the crew of the wan star trek deep space nine takes over

slavery is bad after hundreds of years we have finally figured that one out this almost universal belief is the both the strength and weakness of director steven spielbergs latest serious during the late a portuguese slave ship carries cargo of black men and women kidnapped from their home on africas west coast cuba be sold into slavery fiftythree of them are stuffed into the la amistad from spanish word for friendship their new spanish owners freeing himself from his chains senge pieh djimon hounsou renamed cinque his masters leads bloody revolt after killing most of the crew the africans force the remaining sailors return them their home or so they think instead the ship heads up the coast the united states the amistad is boarded an american naval ship and the revolutionaries are put on trial in connecticut for murder and piracy the legal question becomes are they free men fighting justly for their freedom or are they property if they are property who do they belong their masters the spanish government salvage rights of the officers who captured the ship the us government the defendants are pawns in several games abolitionists theodore joadson morgan freeman and lewis tappan stellan skarsgard want free them but tappan sees them primarily as means further the cause their lawyer roger baldwin matthew mcconaughey views the case as simple one of property rights and chance make his share of legal fees south carolina senator john calhoun arliss howard pursues the case for the political advancement of the southern states president martin van buren nigel hawthorne is willing force the result towards his own political ends when the verdict looks free the africans van buren replaces the judge one more sympathetic his wishes even that does not work and the new judge frees the kidnap victims at the urging of calhoun the president then appeals the case the supreme court populated majority of slaveowners this littleknown try finding it in any history text book incident from americas past would have gone down darker path were it not for former president john quincy adams anthony hopkins who is persuaded argue the case before the supreme court the slavery issue is easy pickins for spielberg much like his shindlers list followed jurassic park as this follows lost world the moral sides are not difficult ones choose nazis and slave traders both treat groups of others as less than human it is not hard see who the bad guys are without that question ponder the directors job is more difficult he has make the story interesting spielberg succeeds for the most part the visual aspect of the is beyond reproach where the movie falls down is bit more subtle there are very few _people_ in the tale in fact cinque is the only character who is fleshed out tappan and joadson are abolitionists symbols but not humans van buren is weak politician but nothing else the rest of the slaves barely exist other than dressing for the set like many other films about people of color almost all the major players are white the films salvation lies in the acting strength of everyone involved and the powerful presence of hounsou the former models first major role is winner without speaking more than five words of english he conveys more emotion than most actors thousand lines of dialog the other standout is hopkins who seems be making career out of portraying american presidents he also played the title role in nixon the impassioned speech the doddering old man who phases in and out of rationality is among the best courtroom drama ever on the screen there are some other great moments especially impressive are the africans struggle understand what is going on in the strange land their interpretation of the bible based solely on the pictures and their own experiences is poignant as grand as the epic is it would have more impact had it focused more on the experience from the point of view of the africans more humanity in the fight for humanity would have made it fourstar michael redman has written this column for real long time and is just now getting around seeing some films

reflecting on bedazzled lively comedy about the devil who seeks possess the soul of pathetic loser one sinful thought remains in my mind if hell means having spend an eternity elizabeth hurley who
