portrays the fiery demon then use that pitchfork and point me the way her pouty lips irresistible british accent and wild display of haute couture hurley crackles naughtiness and fills your mind temptation it is practically impossible turn this beelzubabe down her next target is elliot brendan fraser tech support geek who is clumsy awkward and just too eager please aptly picture him you would have remember saturday night live skit featuring steve the copy guy who effortlessly irritated his coworkers his unpolished social skills eugene thus is loathed and feared his coworkers who do their best stay out of his way yet beyond his annoying mannerisms he is lovable oaf he wishes that he could get closer allison frances oconnor coworker whom he is infatuated but who has never taken notice of him however the odds of him getting together her are about the same as snowballs chance in hell dear god he prays would give anything have that girl in my life guess who then shows up she makes an offer that is too hard refuse seven utterly fabulous wishes for one piddling little soul there is even an escape clause if elliots wish does not go exactly the way he likes he need only beep her one guess as what the threedigit number is and he gets start over the remainder of the consists of elliots various fantasies that incorporate his personal desire have enormous amounts of wealth power fame and allisons love but when he makes sweeping statements such as want be very very powerful and very very rich and married allison he will soon learn that the devil is in the details for example and we have seen this several times in the trailers he is granted his wish but finds out that he is columbian drug lord and that allison while married him has her eyes on someone else apparently the devil is just as eager skew his fantasies as she is possess his soul his other wishes also end up some strange but funny twist that shortcircuits his new life soon elliot wishes that he had never made that deal given the mischievous nature of the devil bedazzled has many amusing moments lot of the credit goes fraser who turns in great comic performance he ably assumes various personas his funniest segment is when he wishes that he could be the most sensitive man in the world allison becomes so frustrated him that she practically urges him take advantage of her hurley also heightens the humor quotient especially in the transitional scenes when fraser waits start his next wish after bailing out of the previous one it is clear that she is having good time it all yet while the filmmakers work hard at creating funny scenes they conspicuously avoid developing the allegorical underpinnings between good and evil that could have added more heft this story but that would be playing fire what they have got works so you can easily accept it for the pleasant little comedy that it is

the muppet movie is the first and the best movie among the evergrowing list of muppet movies the muppet movie tells the story of how our hero kermit the frog came be star delightful movie for all ages the muppet movie is bursting cameo appearances countless stars of the and today the muppet movie begins in movie theater where all of the muppet stars are anxiously awaiting the first showing once everyone is settled down the movie inside of the movie begins it starts out kermit in swamp playing his banjo and singing this shot required jim henson spend hours underwater kermit is discovered bernie bigtime agent who happens upon kermit accident bernie believes that kermit holds much potential become big star in kermit ponders the idea of becoming big movie star where he could make millions of people happy kermit decides leave his swamp and make the trip out along the way kermit befriends his now famous muppet companions beginning fozzie bear who had been spending his days doing standup comedy at the el sleezo cafe owned james coburn the two decide teamup and continue on their way but doc hopper charles durning the owner of chain of french fried frog leg restaurants has different idea he wants kermit be his spokesman but kermit is humiliated at the idea and spends the movie avoiding him and his assistants the trip continues kermit and fozzie meeting miss piggy rowlf gonzo the electric mayhem band and more muppets who all share the same wish make it oh and even more celebrities continue appear kermit and miss piggy continue get know each other little better including rather funny scene at restaurant steve martin as the waiter eventually kermit and the group make it that is after kermit is finally able elude doc hopper and proclaim his freedom lord lew bigtime producer portrayed orson welles gives kermit his shot at stardom and gives him the goahead produce movie the muppet movie is definitely movie that is fun for all ages it is also suredeal as one parents can watch and enjoy along their kids

all great things come an end and the dotcom era embodies that perfectly beneath mound of bankruptcy paperwork lies the remains of former dotcom darling the company kozmo com an online convenience store stocked ice cream porn videos and other basic necessities of urban dweller all handdelivered couriers within an hour designed in two college roommates joseph parks year old goldman sachs banker and yong kang kozmo flamed out in three short years raising more than million in venture capital funding and from partnerships such bigwigs as starbucks and amazon com december the company boasted employees in cities its barking ceo park attracting all kinds of media attention the company was set for an ipo in may until april the day the stock market took its first big dive ending the internet era april kozmo was out of money and ceased operations unlike the earlier similar documentary startup com chronicled the rise and fall of another dotcom govworks edreams focuses both on its original founders especially park and on the common folks that ran the daytoday operations the contrast is amazing showing how cult persona can convince anyone that any idea is the next big thing the films director wonsuk chin too tired die expertly juxtaposes upper management company meetings onthespot interviews the bike messengers general managers and floor staff that kept kozmo humming the films images give backbone the company and provide an emotional edge its ultimate demise the most satisfying part of the comes in understanding degree the expectations of numerous ceos commanding these titanictype businesses in the films final interviews park we learn what happens when the money dries up and backers do not return phone calls in the end the name of the game was profit and if you could not make money even the dreamers got the axe screened at the th annual mill valley festival

since their debut in the tightly wrought texas thriller blood simple joel and ethan coen have been one of the most eclectic original and downright fascinating creative teams in modern their films are highly stylized deeply embedded in particular time and place and their characters are more often than not everyday people who get caught up in highly unusual circumstances in the big lebowski their first cinematic offering since the multiple academy awardwinning fargo the action takes place in los angeles during the gulf war and the hero of the story is jeff lebowski aka the dude the dude is played jeff bridges one of hollywoods most underrated actors in the best stoned performance since sean penn stumbled through the halls of ridgemont high the dude is simple man who has never quite made it out of the sixties he has shaggy shoulderlength hair grizzled goatee badly in need of trim and he wears mostly stained teeshirts long shorts and gellies without socks he smokes lot of pot drinks lot of white russians and is more than content spend the majority of his time bowling his two buddies slightly psychotic vietnam vet named walter sobchak john goodman and donny steve buscemi one of those guys who always wants be part of the conversation but never quite makes it in one day the dude is confused another jeff lebowski david huddleston this one being millionaire philanthropist whose trophy wife bunny tara reid owes lot of people lot of money the main plot and all its accompanying sideplots and coenesque diatribes are far too complicated get into here suffice say that the dude becomes deeply involved the big lebowski when bunny is kidnaped and the dude is asked be courier for the ransom money the time all is said and done walter has become deeply involved as has the big lebowskis daughter maude julianne moore feminist performance artist pornographer named jackie treehorn ben gazzara and group of german nihilists led peter stormare who was so great as the silent but deadly kidnaper in fargo the big lebowski plays like an amalgam of all the coen brothers earlier efforts it shares their previous films strong sense of time and place as well as their sendups of movie genres and political and cultural ideologies lebowski has the same kind of crazed caricatures that made raising arizona such hoot it has surrealistic dream sequences one of involves busby berkleylike dance number that characterized the ending of barton fink and it has the same kind of cartoonish look and feel that pervaded the hudsucker proxy the was shot veteran cinematographer roger deakins who has worked the coens on three other films barton fink the hudsucker proxy and fargo deakins always gives the coens films distinctive visual style and here he does brilliant job of capturing the bright colors of seedy los angeles in the early nineties whether that the obnoxious blue bowling suit worn the dudes main competitor jesus quintana john turturro or the strikingly manic dream sequences one of involves the dizzy spectacle of watching strike from bowling balls point of view if fargo was the coen brothers most restrained effort in years the big lebowski marks their return overtheedge filmmaking it is overflowing style and attitude helps make up for the scattered plot fragments that never quite come together in the end the coens fill the screen lighting set design music and hilarious performances from all the leads especially bridges and the always reliable john goodman who shows real comic timing in his untimely naminspired outbursts and his intense dedication his adopted judaism joel directing ethan producing and both writing the coen brothers seem limitless in their capacity turn our world inside out their talent lies not in their ability reflect the norms of reality but in their potential dig out the darkest corners of life and bring them light the coens rejoice in the oddballs of the world and they put them centerstage show that it is not just guys like the dude who are nuts but the entire planet

lean mean escapist thrillers are tough product come most are unnecessarily complicated and others have no sense of expediency the thrillride effect gets lost in the cumbersome plot perhaps the ultimate escapist thriller was the fugitive featured none of the flashbang effects of todays market but rather breadandbutter textbook example of what clever script and good direction is all about the latest tony scott movie enemy of the state does not make it that level it is true nineties product that runs like greased lightning through maze of cell phones and laptop computers without looking back although director scott has made missteps in the past such as the lame thriller the fan he is generated good deal of energy in pictures like crimson tide and top gun that vibrant spirit is present here shown in welltimed and carefully planned chase scenes that give the movie an aura of sheer speed enemy of the state also features an unprecedented use of amazing cinematography director of photography daniel mindel throws staggering amount of different views angles lenses and stocks at the audience that goes long way toward involving the audience in the movie enemy is truly visual experience and that is only one of the reasons it is such fun watch the movie lights up an aging senator visited nsa deputy chief thomas reynolds jon voight reynolds wants new communications act passed allow the government free reign in the use of surveilance equipment but the senator plans bury the bill in committee reynolds has the senator offed but not before the murder is caught on naturalists camera an extremist chain of events the tape ends up in labor lawyer robert dean will smith posession and it is not long before he is running from reynolds cronies it is only the help of an exspook named brill gene hackman that dean is able get the bottom of things the acting is top notch and the three principles smith hackman and voight are generally more mature and excellent all around smith puts aside the wisecracking act and becomes normal human being voight tones down the amount of sneer he puts into his character for greater ominpotence and hackman is simply over the top in the mysterioso role smiths regular joe comes off particularly well as he runs from authorties for reasons that he knows not the supports are also in fine form lending credibility the main roles and advancing the plot in key areas this is for the holiday crowd the hot ticket as well as anyone looking for serving of genuine action in market that is otherwise lacking

this is based on the campy tv show from the under the same appellation mind you most people including yours truly who will see this movie will not have seen any episodes from the original series the movie is really stand alone in that regard the family robinson lost in space plot set in the year the family robinson is chosen sail out into space in search of other planets that might contain the natural resources earth needs in order survive its future colonization process if you will they are joined able pilot west leblanc and evil uninvited stowaway oldman who does not want see the trip conclude on successful tip eventually their trek goes awry and all are lost in space how do get back earth is the question that infests the rest of this scifi epic critique this reminded me lot of the fifth element from the summer of it is lot of flash but very little actual substance admittedly there is not an annoying character like chris tucker from the other but this does run little too long and did lose me in regards its complex timetravel multidimensional story line having said that the special effects in this movie were amazing and the overall look and feel were also way above average you really felt like you were in the future and riding through space these poor souls unfortunately for this chosen family their year old son is the smartest one in the group and the father is too wrapped up in his work notice the rest of his family ever heard that one before yawn the acting is ok and was especially surprised at the solid performance tv friends matt leblanc who shows us all that he is definitely more than just pretty face on the down side the family riffraff that cuts through most of the picture is lame and timeconsuming even though we gotta give them credit for trying develop characters in scifi pic the story line is hard follow the evil character in the movie actually tells people that he is evil and the movie goes on for about minutes too long on the slick side many of the special effects are really cool the sequence in the family is paralyzed during the hyperdrive is awesome and the animated monkey that joins the family halfway through the flic is mucho cool the credit presentation at the end of the is slamming and the adventures that they fall into are somewhat thrilling will also admit that somehow they got me semitear up near the conclusion of this picture very odd overall if you are big scifi fan check this movie out for the special effects and challenging narrative and if you are not would still suggest seeing this movie but then you could probably wait until it comes out on video so that you forward past some of the boring parts little known facts this will always be remembered as the movie that knocked titanic out of the top spot at the boxoffice after straight weeks at number one garry oldman is british and was once married uma thurman for about six months mimi rogers was tom cruises first wife

s alien marked not only the death suicide of its popular protagonist ellen ripley sigourney weaver but in many ways the alien franchise itselfbox office receipts were anemic thanks poor audience word of mouth and the critics who rallied around the first two installments alien and aliens savaged david finchers slog of sendoff myself included hence weaver director jeanpierre jeunet and the others behind alien resurrection faced twofold challengenot only somehow resurrect ripley but also rescue this onceprofitable series from the scrap heap despite the odds they have succeeded even if the entertaining new installment does not measure up the excellent first two writer joss whedon devises quick easy and painless answer the dead ripley problemclone her is what shady military scientists do using some blood left behind on fiorina the prison planet of the third that done the _real_ challenge presents itselfwhat do her alien introduced ripley as smart and resourceful aliens simultaneously toughened her up and made her more vulnerable exploring her maternal side alien saw her undergoing the seven stages of death what could be next whedon comes up clever spin since the original ripley died while impregnated an alien queen the blood used for the clone is also infected alien dna so the new ripley is indeed newa humanalien hybrid blessed heightened instincts and strength psychic bond the deadly species and more predatory attitude unfortunately that is where alien resurrections clever streak in writing stops the alien series is known for having stronger stories than most creature features but the story in resurrection is more of an afterthought the movie begins plot involving some military types attempting train aliens do their bidding but once the creatures break free it is once again ripley and ragtag crew this time bunch of interstellar smugglers including tough waif call played game winona ryder trying exterminate them and the alien ripley scenario is ultimately not exploited its full potential would have liked deeper exploration into the quandary of becoming one of the species she has spent her entire life trying destroy while the settling into triedandtrue formula is little disconcerting the formula is triedandtrue for reason and jeunet tackles the proceedings giddy abandon the alien after all these years is still terrifying and new breed that is introduced is no less so the violence is appropriately grisly and extreme and the action set pieces are suspenseful and exciting most notably an extended underwater sequence the is absolutely mesmerizing visually thanks the solid work done production designer nigel phelps and cinematographer darius khondji as technically adept as jeunets direction is perhaps his and for that matter whedons greatest contribution is the infusion of humor into this notably downbeat and serious series sense of humor may seem go against everything this horror show stands for but the selfawareness of the excess just adds the fun no alien resurrection is not the great that ridley scotts alien or the even greater that james camerons aliens was but after the dauntingly slow gloom and doom of finchers alien jeunets resurrection is welcome return its roots as wild reckless thrill ride that is what made the alien series so popular in the first place and that is what will keep the series popular in any future installments

most sequels do not do what they are supposed do like toy story does far too many of them end up rehashing the original and adding very little is it any wonder that most sequels fail live up their predecessors thankfully toy story is wonderful exception cannot remember the last time saw sequel as consistently fun and inventive as this one it is yet another sign that pixar the acclaimed animation studio behind toy story and bugs life is still at the top of its game woody and buzz are back in the sequel the hit toy story and things have changed bit since the last one ended woody voiced tom hanks is preparing leave his owner andy for cowboy camp in his absence he has assigned buzz lightyear tim allen now comfortable in his role as toy take charge unfortunately woodys trip is ruined when he is accidentally put into the family garage sale and is stolen an overzealous toy collector wayne knight off save him are buzz and members of the old toy gang including mr potato head don rickles rex the nervous dinosaur wallace shawn hamm the piggy bank john ratzenberger and slinky dog jim varney while in captivity woody makes startling discovery he is actually part of collection of toys based on s childrens show entitled woodys roundup he meets the show is other characters include jesse joan cusack his cowgirl sidekick the wise old prospector kelsey grammer and bullseye his trusty horse they have all been anxiously awaiting woodys arrival as once their set is completed they will be sold japanese toy museum and finally escape storage forever this means woody now faces difficult choice his friends coming rescue him does he go them and spend few more years andy or does he go japan and be immortalized forever as in the original toy story contains firstrate animation and pixar studios has done remarkable job improving on the impressive work they did there reportedly the was originally slated for directtovideo release but after seeing the improvements that had been made disney rightly decided release it into theaters the is well worth seeing on the big screen the colors are bright the textures sharp and even the human characters look more human the animation is consistently seamless the action fast and furious and the facial expressions believable there are so many impressive sequences that would find it impossible list them here but was particularly wowed scene where buzz and his cohorts must get across busy intersection get al toy barn the store owned woodys captor pixars rendition of the family dog is also nicely done fur so realistic you almost feel you could reach out and touch it the voice work is also perfectly complementary and as the first movie does much help further character development tom hanks and tim allen again disappear into their roles as woody and buzz making you forget who is doing the voice it was woody and buzz up there not tom and tim all the cast members from the original reprise their roles and each is excellent several new voices have been added joan cusack kelsey grammer and wayne knight doing fine work toy story is strong in characterization and is able expand on what we saw in the first movie woody faces difficult choices while buzz is confronted new buzz who has not yet realized his status as toy forcing him see what he used be like the new characters are also developed quite well especially jesse who narrates sarah mclachlanaided flashback illustrating how she was loved then forgotten her owner it may be computeranimated and it may have sappy music but it is downright touching the script despite having story and screenplay each credited four different writers is endlessly clever and inventive especially considering that it is sequel the reason toy story works where other movie sequels fail is that it refuses just capitalize on the originals success redoing the same story and using the same characters not this one we get character change new characters and new issues brought up toy story is also remarkable for the way in it keeps reinventing itself there is always another clever idea waiting just around the corner here the humor is sharp and witty something amuse both kids and adults there are funny asides films such as star wars and jurassic park among others new takes on classic toys like barbie and rock em sock em robots and appearances from other pixar efforts bugs life and the short geri game geri himself makes an appearance as toy repairman who fixes woodys broken arm the action is fast and furious and the chases in the street in toy store in an elevator on baggage carousel and in an airplane keep getting bigger and better toy story never grows stagnant because there is always something new hold your interest the more you pay attention it the more rewarding it is it is rare see like toy story come along because it is the kind of that is almost impossible dislike it is created purely entertain and though enjoy thoughtprovoking drama as much as the next person it is nice see that films are still trying do exactly what movies first tried do send us out smile it is fair bet that the whole family will have smiles on their collective faces after seeing toy story it is the rare sequel that manages expand on and live up the original
